text: Love the atmosphere here! Shattered chips are delicious, we took our leftovers of them home and added buffalo sauce and they were even better! The chef came outside and asked how our meal was and the manager also stopped by. You never see this at smaller restaurants so that was a great perk! WE had the Paris Texas Burger and the chicken sandwich, both amazing! Would recommend to everyone!
Amazing good food... I had the Ingos Burger Adam and Eve style(no bread or condiments) AMAZEBALLS!!!!

Great atmosphere and excellent food! Cool round building with plenty of outdoor patio spots. It was a bit chill out that afternoon so they turned on the outdoor warmers and it was cozy. Ordered the grass fed Paris burger and it did not disappoint. It was juicy and flavorful with bbq sauce and pickles. Don't pass up the chips. Just the way my mom would make them, thinly slice  up the potato into circles and fry them up nice and crispy. The two sauces that came with the chips were splendid. One order is plenty for two people. Two people $30 for burgers chips and drinks. I will defiantly be back and recommend it if you just want a chill place to relax and grab some good food!!

This was a great experience,  my boyfriend and I had no plan as to where we going to eat after dropping his daughter off atvthe high school football game. We  drove around and didn't want to eat at our regular haunts, low and behold a light bulb illuminated let's drive downtown.  The first place I pulled up was closed and decided let's go to LGO... So we did, now mind you we weren't dressed to really go out, so the manfriend said lets go across the street that looks more casual.    Great call the Avocado Toast is a must have and the watermelon salad yumulance.

FANTASTIC food, great ambiance, and awesome service! You won't want for anything here, as they keep your glass above half full all the time.   Most of the food is locally sourced, which earns them the 5th star. And they have THE BEST BURGER I've had in my life.

I was here about a year and a half ago and was blown away by the ambiance and amazing service we recieved. We are back in town and immediately had to come back. We had the Ingo's cheeseburger, it was delicious. The shattered potato chips were fantastic and the jalapeño sauce was very flavorful. The service was spectacular! They were very nice, welcoming and attentive. We had a few drinks which were also amazing.

This place is sooo great! Lovely patio area, the staff is awesome and very friendly, and the fooood! The food is amazing and so are their drinks! They have great items on the menu. You can tell everything tastes fresh. Definitely recommend this place and it's also a great location to ride your bike to!
I love this place! The Farmers daughter burger and deviled eggs are to die for! Great atmosphere and pet friendly patio is very nice!

Ingo's was recommended to me by a friend and I have to say I am now in love! The Kale and  quinoa salad with crispy chicken is absolutely amazing! The cracked potato chips with the salsa are out of this world. Ingo's is defiantly a newly acquired obsession of mine that I plan on keeping for a long time!

There is an "executive chef" of Ingo's who comes by once in a while (he's got a unique hairstyle, so that's how you'll notice him.) Our main complaint with him is although he doesn't ever actually make the food, once it's set out for the waitresses to grab and serve it, he'll randomly come by and just touch the food for no reason. It's very bizarre. He basically just walks by and "taps" your burger buns like he's hitting bongo drums. That might be just a weird little tic that one could overlook if his hands were clean. Unfortunately my party and I once watched him take out the trash, then, without washing his hands, walk right over and start doing his "burger bun tapping." If you don't have to touch the food, don't touch the food. And if you're going to touch the food for no reason, please wash your hands before you do it.  That being said, I personally love the Farmer's Daughter burger. That with a individually brewed ice tea really is great on a hot day. It's a fun little spot and if you don't mind sitting at the counter with you friends, it can be great for a quick lunch.  I'm excited for the fall when sitting outside on the patio won't be horrible and then the seating will effectively more than double. I come here probably one a week for a bite, and hope you'll check it out.

Tiny but awesome casual place with burgers (grass fed beef!), sandwiches, and the most amazing hummus and pumpkin seed dips (yes really) with crudités.  You should also look at the the Post-It Note special (which changes weekly). Don't forget the (free!) French-sea-salt cookies on the way out, either.  You can either sit outside, or inside at the bar in a tiny, modern, almost-hipster-but-not-in-that-annoying-way round building (bathrooms are out back). Service at the bar was *great* and super friendly (free samples were offered of the hummus/pumpkin seed dips for example; also got told about the gelato sandwiches). They have a small menu of beer and wine.   Only drawbacks; portions are smallish (burgers/sandwiches are stand alone so order sides if you're hungry) and prices are reasonablish but not cheap. That said, def making a return trip here next time we home Camelback.

Great food and happy hour!!  The steak salad is awesome!  With a nice sized portion of salad with cooked to order steak that has goat cheese and sunflower seeds.   My wife had the crispy chicken sammy and I have had that prior and it is the best chicken sandwich I have ever had!  My wife agrees!  It's located in the Arcadia area and is has a good patio.  The only thing that is missing is a water feature to drown out the local road noise.  They have limited number of craft beers but they are very tasty and the mimosa is good as well.  A great addition to the Arcadia area.
Ok...the food was fresh and tasty but the portions are super small for the price. We were very disappointed in not only the size of the burger but the kale salad too.

Ingo's is a pretty cool place.  The atmosphere is great and the service is friendly and the food comes quickly.  My chicken sandwich was great (but a bit on the small side) and my girlfriend's veggie burger was absolutely amazing.  The only thing I wasn't a big fan of was the chips- they were smashed into small pieces that made it difficult to enjoy the dipping sauces that came with it.  Otherwise an excellent experience.

Wow, delicious food for such great prices! We were so happy that we found this place. We got the hummus and pumpkin seed dip, the kale salad, and the cheeseburger, and we loved it all! The place has a great set up, and everything came out quickly. We will definitely return!

I'm a regular here. Food is always on point, but service is a shot in the dark so you never know what you are going to get! They do shared servers so it can be confusing who you're person is and sometimes the ball gets dropped unfortunately.   Food is so good though! Must orders are: Crispy Chicken Sammy, Paris Texas Burger, Shattered chips, Kale & Quinoa salad with crispy chicken on top, and the Post-it note special salad (which is now a regular yay!) Orange and Fennel salad. For drinks, must have the Greyhound, MUST!

Our waitress was great and suggested multiple dishes and options that I'll be trying real soon.   For starters, the shattered potatoes are better than any fries I've ever had. Dipped in that jalapeño sauce, so good.  Also you can add a fried egg to any burger, and they offer fresh English muffins as an alternative bun, she suggested going this route with the standard cheeseburger.  The Crispy Chicken Sandwich came very highly recommended, a staff favorite. It had a golden brown crust and it looked friggin amazing.   Lots of people were ordering the kale salad, and it looked, well, it looked like a kale salad to be honest. Probably pretty bomb considering the frequency it was being ordered though.  The tuna sandwich was going out as much as the salads were, which I found a bit odd, but she said their Egg Salad Sandwich is one of the best sandwiches in the valley, and it's only sold for one hour a day...hot damn.  I had the Paris, Texas Burger. It was...wow...  The beef was unbelievably savory, cooked medium rare with incredible mouthfeel, juicy but not at all greasy. Pancetta was salty and perfectly crispy, bacon's better brother. Sharp cheddar cheese blanketed the beef, holding it all together and melding the flavors into umami heaven. The apple butter BBQ sauce is otherworldly, sweet but with this slight smoky flavor that just rounds it all out. The dill pickles chips gave a fresh & light crispness to each bite, and the fresh poppyseed buns were baked to perfection culminating in this amazing amalgamation of tastes and textures. A new flavor took center stage with each chew, and I must have made the family that sat next to us really uncomfortable with all the moaning and grunting I was making as I ate.   The waitress also gave us a little dish of their lacto-fermented jalapeño hot sauce and it took the flavors to another level.  Spicy-sweet-salty-savory-juicy-crisp-chewy-melty-glory.

Had a fabulous dinner on the patio. It was our first time...won't be last.  The homemade chips w some dipping sauce were out of this world. Split their special cheese burger( can't remember name) but it was also incredible and chicken salad with friend. Chicken salad was really tasty. Kind of shredded chicken with grapes and some celery and raisins and mayo. Yum! Had an old fashioned quality taste. Loved the sangria too!  Along with the food being great, the staff was not snobby but extra friendly and did I mention really nice patio?  On the way out, I complimented one of our servers and he introduced himself...Richie!  Great send off loved the place!
Great menu, dog -friendly, awesome service.  My favorite is the chicken Sammy. Free cookies , extra parking down the street . One of the best in Arcadia.

I love this place. i just moved to Arcadia 3 months ago, and try and eat here at least once week. I love the outside patio, food is good, i just wish they has a few more items on the menu to chose from. I love coming here but don't want to get burnt out on food options. Great atmosphere and always a super friendly staff.

Have been waiting for this place to open. Great patio with plenty of heaters for a perfect winter evening. Casual and fun place to grab a burger and a beer (or wine). We enjoyed the crispy chicken sandwich on a LGO English muffin and the burger with the homemade sauerkraut. Burger was tasty  & cooked perfectly. I'm not a big kraut fan but really enjoyed it. Chicken sandwich had a nice kick and I liked the addition of the Granny Smith apple. We also had an order of the homemade chips. This is going to be a great addition to 40/Camelback area.
Great burger place in the Arcadia neighborhood. My second favorite burger place that I've been to in az. Good quality meat is what really makes their food.

5 star food, drink and service! Omg, Paris, Texas Burger, OMG. No. 1 Tuna, Berry tea, alcohol selection also tasty.  Less clustery feeling than LGO and Postino. Order at window and then full service outside, or just head inside for full service from start.  Full disclosure: baby belly? Seats inside are fixed position to bar and rather snug. Plenty of room and heat outside! Minus 1 star for the company's ever present parking issue. Don't try to valet at LGO/Postino. The valet service doesn't allow (but should) and isn't polite about it. However, the very attentive, amazing staff at Ingo's makes up for valet. Apparently, there is extra parking just north of building on 40th St too!

So, I tried the White Fish Club Sandwich and Fresh Shattered Potato Chips. All ordered ahead and brought to the car curbside.  Atmosphere (4): While small inside, I definitely appreciate the ability for drive-up service when you call ahead. There are also a few tables outside to enjoy your food. My only issue is the limited parking. Whether you are eating onsite or taking out, the parking is limited in their lot. I believe you can park across the street at a sister property (LaGrande Orange I believe).  Food (4): The fish sandwich was different than any other I've had in that it wasn't cod or some other pieced together fish. It was flaky and the crust was crispy and well seasoned. I opted for both the lebni AND Ingo's hot sauce, which I dipped my chips in both and it was damn good. I even poured some of the Ingo's hot sauce on my fish sandwich for some extra added flavor (excellent choice). I was expecting a little more flavor to the chips. I did not taste any sea salt or pepper (there was plenty of green shrubbery though).   Service (4): I used drive-up service, not realizing that they would come to the car. After hopping out and heading to the window to pick-up my order, the server told me that they would kindly bring my order to my car. (SCORE!)  Price (4): Prices were fair, $13.25 (plus tax) for a fish sandwich and chips (or fries, whatever you want to call them). The amount of food provided left me full and satisfied.   Overall, I would frequent Ingo's, especially for the fish sandwich. They have quite a few delicious looking items on their menu and they don't have too much so, it's not hard to find a selection. Next time I'll try their deviled eggs (who doesn't love a good deviled egg).  Enjoy.

Everything was really cool, as to be expected with this new lgo concept. Potato chips were exceptional! Bbq burger was to rich. Maybe there was too much sauce that took away from the high quality beef. The cheddar on the cheeseburger is to die for very sharp and stands up to the burger. Poppyseed bun was a nice touch but toasted sesame would compliment the sandwich better. IMO

This place is a well oiled machine!! Amazing service and teamwork from every employee!  Not to mention the food is delicious!!!  My husband and I come here every Sunday for brunch.  Don't forget to sample the free cookies!!

I can't get enough of this place right now! Ingo Cheeseburger (grass-fed BTW) , Shattered potatoes & COLD beer....what else do you need? Hubby has had the chicken burger thingie, the Paris burger and we've shared the kale salad. All delicious! Love the atmosphere, music & the patio. The free cookies for dessert are a fun bonus.

We read the review in the Phoenix Magazine and knew that we had to give Ingo's a try. That was about 8 weeks ago now. We have returned at least a dozen times to taste new items and reorder our favorites. Instead of going through each item on the menu, suffice to say that everything is tasty and really good. What is most amazing in this rather small and interesting place is how they consistently maintain their high quality. I have never seen that in any other restaurant and we eat out most of our meals.   This is a friendly and comfortable place. Give it a try.

The food is terrible at Ingo's.I would NOT recommend this place.The kitchen was very unsanitary.The waitresses were unhelpful when asked if I could get something else.The building is cool and unique,but that's the best I can say about this place.Add to that,the parking is very limited.Do not eat at here!!

Great option. Sat outside and had a bit of a view of mtns up 40th street. The shredded chips (their version of fries) were great, couldn't stop eating them. Paris TX burger was interesting, a little sweet for my taste, but a noble effort. Kale and quinoa salad and lemonade were fine, but nothing special. All in all, a great place to side outside and enjoy a quite tasty causal meal.  Better than LGO IMO.

We got the chicken burger, the Paris burger and fries.  So yummy and fast!  The seasonal dink was a pomegranate margarita $6.  So cold it gave me a brain freeze.  Don't forget to get your complimentary cookies.

Ok- I am sooooo pleased with Ingo's! And so full lol !  The shattered potatoes shattered my diet and so did the tasty greyhound. The veggie burger is one of the best I ever had. Service was friendly and attentive. Great location- I really liked the outdoor seating. BTW- there are free chocolate chip cookies inside :). Love it.

The signage for this restaurant is minimal, but you can't miss the cute little round building on the corner lot with outside seating. Even at 3pm, the place had quite a few patrons and was gearing up for a busy evening. We had an exceptional waitress and also spoke with the manager who was also quite friendly. Our waitress actually comped an order of deviled eggs and shattered potatoes (of which they are know for).  We ordered the deviled eggs and Texas Paris burger. Being a southern girl, I like to think that I know deviled eggs. While I appreciate their creativity with the eggs, I thought the goat cheese was a little too strong (reasoning for a four). If you are a fan of mustard, goat cheese, and dill then these are for you. If not, then steer away.  The burger was perfectly cooked, juicy, flavorful, and appropriately sized. I'm a sucker for bbq sauce on burgers.   Like I said, we didn't order the potatoes but I would recommend them. They are topped with a refreshing yogurt sauce and served with fermented jalapeño sauce on the side. It might sound a little gross to some, but that green sauce is dynamite!  And last, but not least the cookies are free (if I had a microphone I would drop it)!
Very friendly. Good service. They have a really nice outdoor patio. The shattered potatoes were delicious! I ordered the Rice bowl... I am going to be dreaming about that dish for weeks... So good!
The tuna burger is a top 5 sandwich in the valley. I also need the recipe for dip for the potatoes. Great place for a late lunch (to avoid the LGO rush).
Stopped in for lunch today and the food was great. In addition, the service was very good and the staff was super friendly.
Amazing food and service. One of the best burgers I've had in a long time. Love the feel of the place too!

After my first visit and review, I promptly received a kind email from someone at Ingo's asking me to come back for a free meal and try their food again. It was a very kind gesture and after several months I made it back.  Once again this place has a killer atmosphere and extremely attentive and great waitstaff. Everything we ordered came out quick and tasty.   For an appetizer, I got their Deviled Eggs which had a rich and flavorful filling that is a step above most other deviled eggs. Next, I had the Chicken Sammy Sandwich which has an extremely awesome balance between the crispiness from the chicken, crunch from the granny smith apple, and added flavor complexity from the pickle and spicy aioli. It is truly a unique sandwich and unlike any other chicken sandwich I've had before.  So to circle back on my prior review, I do retract telling people to go to Hopdoddy's for a better burger. The Chicken Sammy, Post-It note salad, and Deviled Eggs were all delicious and live up to Ingo's "Tasty Food" motto. Perhaps from my first visit, the Ingo Cheeseburger just wasn't for me.   So why not a 5 star rating...because I'm still a little hungry. I know there are some places where you get way too much food and I respect the fact that Ingo's relies more on taste than quantity; however, with food so tasty I want my belly just a little bit fuller.

Everything is done tableside which is nice. However I had to repeat my order to the server 3 times and she still didn't remember my drink. We were explained that burgers are served with a pink medium. After asking for it med.rare I received it med.well. no pink. The other burger at our table was the same. Med rare and was served med.well+. Decent flavor. Ok price. Left expecting more from the burgers.
The chicken sandwich and the love child are incredible.  Atmosphere is a 10 out of 10!!

Really love Ingo's. Been a fan and loyal customer since 1997. The atmosphere and food are excellent but so are many establishments in the same area. The thing that sets Ingos's apart from the rest is the high quality service. Troy greets you with a smile and friendly banter every time. Some days I'm not even hungry but need a pick me up and Troy offers just that! High recommended to anyone looking for a fun and flavorful time! I give Ingo's 5 dragon warriors out of 5!

I've eaten here probably half a dozen times at least and everytime I fall in love with it all over again! Definitely one of the best burgers in Phoenix for sure! The service is always great and the restaurant is always well kept and clean.     You know its good food when you have a hard time deciding what to eat because everything on the menu makes your mouth water! Can I just order one of everything please?!

Great menu. Great staff. A winning combination. The salty chocolate chip cookies finish the meals nicely. Kale and quinoa salad is the best. Burgers (made with meat or beans) are fantastic. Got to get the fresh made chips every time.

Best burgers and small outside patio in Phoenix . The waitstaff is always super friendly and well trained. Can get a little crowed on a fall or winter weekended night , but definitely worth the wait. I would recommend having a wider variety of draft beer otherwise they have it spot on . Even free cookies for the Kids after meal .

I love this pleasant little place. It's small and round...Circular vibes. When you feel like having a pitcher of greyhounds for lunch, and an endless supply of cookies, well, this here is your jam.   The greyhounds (also, sangria never fails) are so good you will actually return after leaving the first time, for a second pitcher...which, if we want to get mathematical , means you'll be hungover for 3 days.  (Cookies + greyhounds / watermelon salad + basket of chip fries^2 = best day of your life - major hangover)  [order of operations.]   I've always had great service here; Richie always kills it, and that crispy chicken sandwich is divine.  (So is the watermelon salad, but you should probably get there soon to experience that before it's out of season.)  these are my people. Cheers to my people.

Delish!!  Wisconsin beef - check Wisconsin cheese - check Sauerkraut - check  This Wisconsin girl is in heaven!   Great food and service. The menu is limited but everything seems executed very well. We will be back to try the crispy chicken sandwich. You had me at Sircha aioli.   My Ingo burger didn't stay on my plate long enough for a picture so I'm posting a picture of the Paris, Texas burger.  Thanks team INGO

On a positive note, grass fed beef is a plus. However for what you get, the burgers are overpriced and NO FRIES!!! Big mistake in my book regardless of the chips you can get a la carte. I won't be going back.

Tried the chips, Paris Texas burger and the orange and fennel salad. All were great. The salad was so good we will try to recreate back at home.  Outdoor seating available with misters and the place is very dog friendly. Fun and yes, tasty place!

I honestly didn't even want to write a review on how great this place is because I didn't want people knowing how great my neighborhood spot is. It's got an amazing location with an environment that makes you feel like you're at the beach, minus those douchebag seagulls and screaming kids. Oh yeah, the food is incredible too

Visited there last week with another couple and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. My boyfriend and I each had a burger and shared the kale salad and shattered chips. All of the food was awesome - the other couple we went with had the same reaction. The executive chef, Dom, came out to check on the food and introduce himself to us which was a nice touch. I love the architecture of the place...they managed to do a great job with such a small lot. I will definitely be going there again!

This place is not for the average and ordinary taste bud. But for those that would like to enjoy a gourmet diner experience.  I truly LOVE this place the food is amazing and the best burgers ever!!! My favorites are the Farmer's Daughter burger, kale salad w/ the chicken breast, hummus and veggies and now the kale salad with the vegetarian burger not to mention the shattered potatoes. The flavors...YUM YUM!!!  There are very few restaurants in the valley that care about giving their customers the highest quality ingredients like Ingo's i.e. grass fed/finished meats, free range chicken, local farm veggies and fresh baked bread.   Most of all the staff always greet us like family. It's like living out a Norm at Cheer's tradition because although the food is top notch the staff from the MANAGERS to the SERVERS create a complete foodie experience for me and my husband. It is a very fine balance to engage and give patrons their space and they do it so well.   Our thanks to the ENTIRE INGO'S TASTY FAMILY! Our favorite anytime restaurant in the valley!!! We highly recommend going!!!

Late afternoon Sunday Companion and I had different desires.  She wanted a Red Bull and a pack of Marlboro Lights.  I wanted a cheese burger. We went into Ingo's , which I thought was a combination of a "Stop & Go" convenience store and "In & Out" Burgers.   We were greeted by a blonde Jasmine or Jessica or some other "J" name who is a testament as to why skinny jeans were invented.  Shunning the outdoor patio area due to chill, we sauntered inside to the close quarters of a horseshoe bar/counter.  The bar had a close full view of the kitchen staff and those who get squeamish at the sight of tattoos and stretching earrings, sit outside. An interesting "waiting area" are painted numbered footprints on the floor, which reminded me of the lineup I stood in at the County Jail.  But I digress, onto the food.  Quality craft beers are served cold and in clear plastic solo cups.  (Disappointing they were not in the vintage Red Solo Cup to preserve my youth and bring back the "Keg Party" feel".  If Management adopts the color, thank me.)  This is a burger place and it is aptly described as such.  The classic cheeseburger was a brilliant in its simplicity and served on a quality white bun (thank you for shunning the over used pretzel bun).  The violently named "Fresh Shattered Potato Chips" were a perfect compliment and remained hot during the meal.  Adjourning to the patio for an apres-beer, Companion walked up the block to retrieve her cigarettes.  Ingo's closes at 9, so I was asked to leave.  If you see Companion, please tell her she owes me for dinner.  I will gladly meet her at Ingo's.
Ingo's had a fresh and creative menu with a nice outdoor dining space.  There were several tasty craft beers to choose from.  AND its pet friendly!!!

If you are looking to enjoy a delicious meal without feeling guilty of breaking healthy habits Ingo's is The place. Best quality, probably the best service in town, well balanced portions of fresh ingredients cooked to perfection where every bite is an experience. I'm extremely picky when comes to healthy food and don't like fast food but Ingo's is like home cooking.  They deserve more then 5 stars. Highly recommend to try it. Can't go wrong with any choice from the menu.

This place was just OK. I got a burger here and it was just average to me. It was a little overcooked and the flavor wasn't all what I was expecting for the price. The service was decent and the place was clean, but just an average meal in my opinion. I will have to come here again as it could have just been an off day.

All I can say is WOW!  Outstanding Grass fed burgers,  the veggies with hummus and this spicy pumpkin seed dip was delicious  if you eat the raw red bell peppers with the pumpkin seed dip,  it's a taste explosion of yum! Great experience,  great staff,  will definitely be back.
Hands down my favorite place for a burger in Phoenix. I always get the Ingo's burger, the chips, and a greyhound and it's consistently amazing.

You don't need to have a long menu or complex food to give people a good meal and experience. My fiancée and I shared a kale salad, cheeseburger and shattered potato chips and loved every bite. Simple food executed well. Their sangria is to die for and while they only have three beers on the menu they were good choices. Our waitress Erin was awesome! Friendly, quick and helpful. I'm glad this place is in biking distance so we can go frequently. I plan on going enough to everyone knows my name. Another great place in the neighborhood.

I absolutely love this place. Every time I go I have to get the burger. I live in walking distance of this place and I go as often as I can. Not to great for summer time due to the outdoor seating but besides that the food is well worth the heat.

Decided to try this place out since I drive by all the time. They've got an awesome patio to hang out on with misters to keep you cool. The chicken Sammy is where it's at! Oh and don't forget the potato chips!  Service was perfect - attentive but not overbearing. Fun new spot I'll be frequenting.

Food: the burger us really good. The only reason I am downgrading it is because I ordered medium, and it came out a very rare medium rare. I had higher expectations because of its connection to LGO, and it's a burger place.   The lemonade was extremely tart for my liking (and the three others at my table). I added a lot of water to calm it down.   The concept is cool, but I think it needs a little more work to get it right. I will return, at least because happy hour sounds like fun: 11-6pm or something, Tues-Fri is $3 beer, cocktails and sangria!

I've been to this adorable spot twice now. And it's enough to know that I'm in love. I've had their regular cheeseburger, tuna burger, and two of their "post it" salads. Every bite of all of it was exceptional. The salads I had were super fresh and the service staff was all smiles. I also tried their cold brewed green tea tonight. Yummm. I got to watch an amazing sunset from their awesome patio in the perfect weather. I'm not sure how long this place has been open, but they are off to a fantastic start for me.   I'll be back!

Excellent experience!  I had the brown rice bowl which was spicy and the perfect amount of food for a small lunch. The other girls I was with had the chicken sandwich (to die for) and the burger. When I go back I'll definitely be having the chicken sandwich. Simply amazing.  Great music, good people watching, all around great little spot to stop at in Arcadia.

The chicken sandwich is awesome, and the burgers are great too! It's a small place but the food is worth it! The service varies, that's my only concern. Our last experience we felt a bother to this girl. She didn't bother to refill our drinks or give us anything extra we wanted, and she left for the day, without a word. Another girl took over and was very nice and got what we needed, I appreciated that. Once again, food is great, service varies!

What a fabulous place to go now that the weather is perfect!!! I lunch and sitting on the patio!  My fave is Courtney!  She is the most pleasant person on earth!!!!  She always has a menu suggestion and is spot on.
I went back and had a good time.  The food was delicious as it was the first time. the ambiance was much better and the service was very good. thank you.

My boyfriend and I were so excited to get some take out from Ingo's. We parked at the curbside to go area and then got out, stood at the take out window for a while, and no one acknowledged us at all. Not even a "hey guys be right with you!" This was yesterday on a slow Monday lunch. Got tired of waiting and left. Step up your service game Ingo's. Wont be coming back.

I just really like ingos. They have strong burgers made with killer ingredients, great sides and good beer, wine and sangria. We live pretty close and have been to LGO billions of times, but have started to frequent ingos for it's lower-key environment and simplicity. My favorite side to get is the potato crisps with that amazing dip - definitely worth adding to your meal. If you're not into beef, my favorite is the tuna burger. It's nice and spicy but not overwhelming, and the tuna doesn't get lost in the sauce. The blush sangria is on point, too!

This is another great restaurant by LGO.  It is dog friendly which is a big thing in Arcadia.  They gave our dog a bowl of water and a treat! Now to the food...I had the Paris, Texas burger and it was delicious!  There were a lot of things on the burger that I would normally hold but all of the flavors worked really well together.  The buns are delicious since they come from the LGO bakery and the other ingredients tasted fresh.  We will definitely be coming back to enjoy the HH and I will try the shattered chips next time as I heard they were good.  They also have "Post-It Note" specials everyday which is a cool idea.
Always great! Paris Texas and chips is my go-to. Really anything on the menu is wonderful and you can't go wrong.
It was good....... Nothing special though....... I dislike pimple faced kids driving my car, so parking sucks if you don't valet.. Again, nothing special, food was fine......

I work in Arcadia and my boss loves to try all the different restaurants. We stopped by Ingo for happy hour on a Friday after work and loved it!   This restaurant has an awesome vibe and offers unique bar seating inside along with lots of outdoor seating. There isn't too much room in the building, but they have made excellent use of the space and done a great job decorating.  The employees were awesome! Definitely one of Ingo's main assets. They were so friendly and provided fast service. We ordered from our table outside and she was able to swipe the credit card right there on a mobile device.  They mostly offer burgers with a slight twist on the toppings. There weren't too many options to order, but like in and out, sometimes less is more. I can't eat wheat so I had to settle for a piece of meat with cheese on it, but that's the case at many restaurants so I'm used to it. There is definitely a market for gluten free food, so maybe they should consider offering some.  Their (only) appetizer was home made potato chips, but they were amazing and I would order them every time.  We ordered bottles of wine and drank from cheap plastic dixie cups. This is the only area I could see them improving on.   This place is definitely worth checking out!

This is a great place for a quick bite, with a small but delicious menu served quickly at the counter or taken to go.  The deviled eggs are really good!  My only complaint would be the music, which can get loud and isn't always what I'd like to be listening to.  Free salted chocolate chip cookies are always appreciated, though they are a bit too salty.

Best secret burger spot in Baltimore/Arcadia. The menu is small, but everything is delicious. The Potato Chips with Jalapeno Sauce are addicting, 1 order can be shared, but you'll want 2. The Chicken Schnitzel Sandwich is the best Chix Sammie in the Valley - I get it Paris style - BBQ and Bacon. The staff is friendly and the turnaround is quick. Please bring back the Chicken and Waffles...

Just ate here tonight and was less then impressed. The cheeseburger was a major disappointment and the service was slow. I would give it a single star; however, I am impressed with what they were able to build on such a small lot. The atmosphere was decent as well. It is a plus that they use all plastic ad metal cups and plates so a todler can't break anything.

Ate lunch here yesterday and am very happy we did. The service was excellent and the food was even better. Had the steak salad and a cheeseburger and I can not wait to go back to try something else! Very laid back environment, great for a casual lunch or dinner.  Plenty of parking right on site which I appreciated in the 100+ tempreture.

Ingo's has been wonderful both times I have been. My friend asked me to join him one evening and I bicycled up. It was very good. We had attentive service and the food was very good.  This afternoon, my husband and I stopped for a burger and some wine. It was excellent. The food was delicious. The service was done with smiles for us. We were sitting outside enjoying our Phoenix 108 temps. with misters. It was delightful. There is no pressure to hurry up and get out. The ambience is that of a Parisian cafe and I can give you no higher praise than that.  Thank you for allowing us to really enjoy what w came for - good d food, good wine, and some relaxation.  Monday comes all too soon!

We've eaten here twice.  The first time I had the watermelon salad - it was very good if a little peppery (black pepper) and small for the price.  The volume of the music along with the open kitchen setting made for a loud environment.  This last time I had the Ingo Cheeseburger and we shared the shattered potato chips.  The potato chips were thick and quite good with a crunchy border and soft middle.  The dipping sauce was okay.  The cheeseburger though was very oily - I assume from the mayonnaise.  It was so oily it coated the inside of my mouth and overwhelmed the burger in general.  The meat of the burger was so soft it was almost like eating mashed potatoes.  Between that and the oil,  it was unlike any burger I've had and I did not enjoy it.  It's my understanding that this restaurant is run by the same folks who operate chelsea's kitchen.  I love their hamburgers so this was a big dissapointment.
I like this place! The tuna burger is muy bueno!! The hummus is good too and looks cute the way they serve it, but is hard to eat out of the little jars. Simple, but good drink menu as well :)
Love this place!! The burgers are the best in the ey by far and the crispy chicken is unreal. On top of that they make a RIPPIN greyhound.

I typically write fairly in depth reviews but not much needs to be said here. I've eaten a LOT of burgers and this place has the best burger hands down. Seating outside is nice. The only downside I can see is when it's really hot out you can't sit outside   The service has always been friendly and prompt.   Bottom line, if you're in the mood for a burger you'd better get yourself on over to Ingo's.

We go here all the time and are neighborhood locals but typically everything has been so inconsistent.... The shattered chips are rarely ever cooked and we get our order home only to discover things aren't cooked all the way. Pretty disappointed since I drive by here to get home.
Went there today.  Sat for 10 minutes, and nobody would help me.      I eventually left frustrated.  I heard the burger is great, but I can't cook it up and serve it to myself...

Coolest eats in Arcadia.. Excellent and brief menu.. Fantastic Ahi, Dee-Lish burgers.. of note Ingo burger topped with Kool kraut.. Umm, Yum! And the chips kick Ass! U slide nicely onto the groovy orange bar stool, to the best service. Very chic and urban.. Great concept with taste, service and palate. Beers and wine fit perfectly with menu.. Can't wait to show up in the warm months on the cruiser! Viva Ingo!

This is a hipster/casual place to grab a quick bite to eat. I really like the option to eat in or taking food to go.  I like that they offer a variety of food choices with healthy options too. There is outside seating and bar seating inside where you can sit and watch the chefs and staff go to work! I've always enjoyed being able to be a part of the action and see what goes in to making the wonderful dishes before they're served to customers. I have been here 4 times and thought it was time to write a well thought out review. I can't get enough of the Fresh Shattered Potato Chips, the Ingo Burger, and the Crispy Chicken Sandwich that has the perfect amount of spice to it. Overall, the food and service is great for anyone to enjoy in a casual relaxed environment.  I honestly would've given this place a 4+ star rating if it weren't for my MAJOR concern listed below.  My one and only MAJOR concern that has been consistent all 4 times I have eating here is that the executive chef who checks the food before it goes out repeatedly failed to wear gloves to avoid cross contamination. I watched him poke and touch customer's food with his bare hands then text on his phone, make phone calls on his cell phone, and type on his computer repeatedly each time I have eaten here. Not once did I witness him leave to wash his hands. I was VERY lucky that he didn't poke my burger any of the times I was sitting there watching him in disbelief, otherwise I would've sent it back immediately! Maybe he didn't because he knew it was my food and I was watching him, but either way it completely grossed me out!
Paris Texas burger with sauteed onions, so good. One of my favorite burgers in the valley.

Had to revise my review from 4 stars to 3 since our second visit was a 2 at best.  Took forever to get food.  Order was incorrect.  Burgers over cooked.  They did offer coupon for next time.  Lot a great burger places in town so not sure there will be a next time.

My new favorite lunch spot in Phoenix!  We've been visiting LGO for awhile now so we were excited to try Ingo's when we heard about it.  It did not disappoint!  The burger is perfection, and I am pretty picky about my burgers. The cracked chips and yogurt sauce are awesome as well. I've also had the heirloom rice bowl, the kale and quinoa salad, and the tuna burger.. All of which were great.  I can't wait to return for the egg salad at some point, though it'll be tough to stray from the burger. Their patio is dog friendly too! I LOVE that they have Scrimshaw on draft, and the happy hour prices are great. My only wish is that they had a larger beer selection to choose from.

I live in the neighborhood, and mostly go to LGO, but I had to try this place! I am so glad I did, and I have brought so many friends and family members, who loved the food as much as I do!! The fish is so fresh and you can taste the quality of the food in every dish. The staff is always great too.

Best relaxing patio vibe with sun and shade, and dog friendly...can do groups of 6 but seating is limited. Service was amazing!! And well staffed, they were fun food was delicious and it's my new favorite day time brunch/lunch spot!!

I have been eating at Ingo's since it opened, still one of my fav's ....but I have 1 complaint and 1 suggestion as a loyal loving customer.   I was there yesterday and I had the "new" Avocado toast.... why?? Why would you change such a perfect dish?!?! :(  I loved your old version. It was soooo good. I am not feeling the dates at all. I just don't get it. I would actually never order again now. Please consider changing it back. I beg you....   My suggestion is that you bring back the rice bowl for the winter! I loved that dish.   Anyway... everything is still fabulous. I love the chips, salad, burgers, chic sand, and the new egg troubadour sandwich :)
I love this place, great eat up bar and patio. Beautiful burgers and chicken sandwiches. Love the deviled eggs

First, the star-reducing factors: Somewhat high prices and extremely tiny parking lot, but those factors are to be expected with an LGO restaurant I suppose!  Make use of their "secret parking" by their corporate office a couple minutes walk down the street, past the (chained up!) dermatologist office and dry cleaners.  I also find the servers here to not be as personable as they could be, and they spent time talking amongst each other instead of checking up on customers and filling empty drink glasses.  I've also had a waitress "forget" to take my mother's order!  Unfortunately, I think they have been hired based on looks and not on experience.  Star-bestowing factor: FOOD!  I've tried the amazingly delicious Paris, Texas burger and the chicken schnitzel sandwich.  The burger was fantastic, especially on an English muffin and with an egg on top.  The breading came off of the chicken when I had that, though it was still tasty.  Definitely not "amazing" like the burger though!  The smashed potato fries are fantastic, though I prefer them with ketchup.  The "fries" are like deep fried slices of baked potato, seasoned with sea salt and cracked pepper.  Don't forget to take a couple free salted chocolate chip cookies for dessert!  It's kind of a pain to get them yourself, and I think that the servers should consider offering a small plate of them to customers.  The servers don't even tell you about the cookies, much less help you get them out from under their enclosure as you use the tiny pair of tongs and hope said cookies don't slide off the provided napkins!  This goes back to my star-reducing "decent but not great service" factor.  Overall, decent enough service and really great food mean I will be back, but will have to be motivated to drive further past the more easily-accessible and better-serviced Zin Burger at Biltmore Fashion Park.

This is place is great and very unique. I had the ahi tuna sandwich, which was unlike any other ahi I have had before. We also shared the hummus which was outstanding. Loved the flavor and the fact that it was served with a fun medley vegetable crudite. The staff was attentive and in good sprits. Overall really enjoyed the experience and happily give it 5 stars for a great experience at tasty food stand!
The ahi tuna sandwich is my go-to meal! The patio is amazing, drinks are refreshing, and you can't go wrong with their post-it note special.

My absolute favorite local spot! From the food to the service, ingos is top notch. Love how casual, relaxed, friendly and efficient the vibe is. When it comes to burgers, there is absolutely nothing better. Grass-fed meat melts in your mouth and is the absolute perfect size, never leaving you overly stuffed and bloated and instead always happy and satisfied.   Here are are my go-to's but you CANNOT go wrong. Drink: Greyhound (MUST) Apps: crudités (fresh heirloom veggies with homemade hummus and pumpkinseed dip-- I told you I was a regular) and shattered potato chips (ask for a side of homemade hot sauce). Burger: Farmers daughter with an egg or any burger with an egg! Crispy Chicken sandwich or tuna burger mmm! Oh yeah chicken and waffles are to die!   INGO on!

Normally I am not a fan of 'the hipster burger joints', but in this case I was and there was a plethora of reasons to like. First off the bat is the fact that they have a very limited menu. Some people doesn't like this, I love it. If you want pasta, then go somewhere else. Want more beer options? Go to a bar. Doesn't want Chloe as a server, well I then loathe your very existence.  So from this limited menu, that is clearly dissected, analyzed and reassembled, I made a mistake. I ordered the Paris, Texas Burger WITHOUT asking it on a English muffin. I should have. I just should have.   Paris, Texas Burger The burger sure was fall apart tender. At the same time as the tenderness is a quality sign, it also make me look like a fool while trying hard to devour it. Innocently presented, but sneaky like a sloppy Joe. I gave up on eating it American style (that's with your hand people).. and resorted changing strategy to one with a fork. The flavors were there, but I would have chosen a different kind of cheddar, or maybe even go with a different kind of cheese (then again I am a stickler with consistency) and the pancetta  - it was freakishly awesome, was perfect as a burger topping and it came in profusion. What I didn't like was the bun. With that tender meat, the bun needs to be supportive, like a good friend during an intervention - not just pretty on the surface. The name of the burger doesn't make no sense at all. What is the Paris representative part? Was it that the bun was ready for an open relationship?   Fresh shattered potato chips This is the last thing that I need, but this is one thing that I will doubtlessly come back for. It looks like a sliced deep fried potato, but balances on that thin edge of awesomely crunchy before it would turn overdone. With this served Lebni which sounds like a east-european car brand, but isn't. Salt and pepper does the trick, but I would love to see a drop of fresh chipotle in there. Or the garlic-cucumber route to put a Greek spin on it. I'd also rename it 'devilishly specious potato'.  Beer While analyzing the beer choices, I couldn't agree more that the choices on the menu will suit most people thus make all sense to go that route. Again I love the decision to stay small, local & popular.   Homemade ice cream sandwich The choice of dessert is a an ice cream sandwich, with a scoop of peanut butter gelato as the buffer in this sweet menage a trois. I didn't like it - probably because peanut butter is not a dessert flavor to me. It's as deceitful as those parents that call raisins candy. It's lies.   Overall Ingo's did deliver. I didn't get to try the egg salad, that seems to suit everyone that had it. My hat is off for Mr Ruggiero, he knows what he has going here. And the service I assume was great, I know I couldn't have had a more informative and attentive server. Another reason why anyone would return.
The food is unbelievably good and seems pretty healthy hopefully it is haha. Service is always amazing as well nothing negative to say at all!

Wasn't really picturing the inside of this place when I got there, however its a super interesting concept. Not sure what they do when it's busy since there appears to be limited seating. The food was great! Kinda bummed me out that the burger didn't come with anything additional which we found out after we got it. Definitely worth a try if you're in the neighborhood.

Lunch yesterday...deviled eggs, 1/2 chicken Sammy, 1/2 fish sandwich, then another order of deviled eggs. Lunch today...deviled eggs, 1/2 order of smashed chips, 1/2 order avocado toast, 1/2 order black bean burger, tiny sample of the pistachio and vanilla soft serve gelato. Pro Tip: go with a friend so getting 1/2 orders of more things is an option.   I enjoy a good picnic deviled egg as much as anyone, but the deviled eggs here are not your momma's picnic deviled egg. Goat cheese blended with the yolk. Who thinks of these things? It's worth coming here for if you ordered nothing else. They are amazing. 3 half-eggs to an order.  The chicken Sammy, fish sandwich and black bean burger all share the same light, delicious toasted bun. Can't go wrong with any of the 3 and I can't wait to go back to try those buns with a burger in between. Smashed chips are fantastic and a 1/2 order is plenty for two to share. Avocado toast is loaded with cheese and tomatoes and is crazy good.   Soft serve gelato? Yes, please. Every. Time. Thanks to Kent for the samples and for overseeing a fantastic kitchen and menu. You could easily drive past this place and miss it. Don't miss it. Not many places have me walking out and trying to think about how soon I can get back. Wish there was something close this good and innovative back home in Dallas.

I received an "E Comp" from La Grande Orange to check out there other restaurant Ingo's Tasty Food...  Thank you for the certificate!!!  First of all, it's seat yourself, so of course we chose the patio! Great ambiance with strung lights all over.  The food was delicious! I had a chicken sandwich that I'm pretty sure will be my go to- yum!  The manager is hilarious! We joked with her the whole time and she even gave my boyfriend and I a free chocolate chip sea salt cookie. They are his favorite! (Definitely recommend them!)  She explained about their food and I can't remember what all was said because it's been a little while since we went but I was very impressed about the chicken!  Ask your server. I'm pretty sure it's grown locally but can't remember!  We can't wait to go back to enjoy the patio and eat some delicious food :)

I'm addicted.  That's the summary.  A) Grass fed burgers.  Automatic happy. B) Shattered potato chips with awesome dip/sauce stuff.  I could eat those all day. C) Indoor/Outdoor seating D) Prompt service F) Never too busy  We have not had a bad burger.  They are all delicious (so says my husband; I always order the cheeseburger).  The lemonade comes in a cup with finger imprints (for the clumsy, this is a plus.  It doesn't slip out of my hands!)  The menu is short and sweet and may not appease or appeal to all, but this girl who will jump at the sight of a grass fed burger cooked perfectly with delicious chips on the side is happy.  And there have been weeks where I've found any excuse to get myself there for dinner multiple nights in one week.

This is my gfs favorite spot to eat. The potato chips alone are worth coming back for. Delicious kale and quinoa salad and grass fed beef burgers. Definitely a great place to pig out at if you're in the Phoenix area.

Ingos has a great atmosphere and food is great.  They use grass fed meat for all burgers and there are incredibly important reasons why grass fed is so much better. Both nutritionally and in treatment of animals.  All the other items on the menu are great as well, they have great beers, apps and other menu items besides burgers. The only recommendation I would offer the restaurant has to do with their "to go" burgers.  I'm not sure if it has to do with the bun and/or the way you request the burger to be cooked but only when I order to go I almost always get a soggy bun which I of course do not like. Eating at the restaurant this never happens.  Great place

I have never felt so compelled to leave a review... If I wanted mediocre food and TERRIBLE service I would have had my husband cook me dinner. But really, jokes aside, I am entirely disappointed with my experience. After the raving reviews, I was so excited to give Ingos a try, and break away from my LGO routine. NEVER have I ever been so disappointed. Sure, we were asked about our food by 3 different people, yet all of them were unable to crack even the tiniest smile while they spewed off their robotic dialogue. I'm sorry, did I bother you by being here? Do you understand what it means to be in the service industry? 100% will never go back.

Don't bother coming here if it's less than one hour before closing.  My husband and I are LGO and Chelsea's junkies and thought we would give their other restaurant, Ingo's a try for something different.  We arrived around 9:10 on a Sunday evening on a holiday weekend, closing was at 10.  Our server was clearly not happy that she had to take care of us and wanted to get out of there by 10:00 sharp.  Our entrees were brought out almost immediately after the appetizer and once the entrees arrived, we were never checked up on or asked if we wanted anything else, even though our wine glasses were completely empty and we would have gladly taken another round.  The check was delivered before we were even finished eating.  As for the food, it was hit or miss.  My husband's Paris Texas (veggie) burger was tasty, but my whitefish sandwich was small and bland.  The hummus was average, but the pumpkin seed dip that came with it was delicious.  Oh, and the shattered potato chips were pretty damn good too.  We did manage to get out of there well before 10, thanks to our turbo server.  Might go back and try again at a time that is more compatible with the servers' party schedules.  They do have the infamous evil white sangria and chocolate chip cookies w/sea salt on your way out.  Yum.
The best veggie burger with fantastic vegan cheese; incredibly filing and love how there is an easy to go option.

Ingo's has become a regular favorite for our family!  They have a menu that pleases all of our tastes.  and complementary cookies for dessert that satisfy your sweet tooth.  The staff is friendly and engaging.  Always enjoy dining here.

The crispy chicken Sammy was very good here. Thin breading and crispy as in the name.  The Apple added a great crunch and flavor, while the spicy aioli rounded out the flavoring.  The bread was fresh and a good compliment as well.   The green tea was tasty.  The fries were slices of potato crispy good with the sauce.

First off, The Paris Texas Burger is absolutely amazing. Its not even worth thinking about, just order it. I got a sangria with strawberries in it, and it was super sweet but delicious. They had dog water bowls being it is primarily an outdoor dog friendly patio. The service was very good, they were on top of everything. Even our dog was lucky enough to get a plain patty!   The only thing I would say is if you have a large dog, make sure you sit closer to the outside of the patio because everything is very close together.

Best tasting beef in town, bar none. Burgers are better than Delux's. Shattered chips are addictive and chicken sandwich will blow your mind. The tiny, cylindrical building is cool and very fun. The slightly crowded kitchen churns out a surprising amount of killer food. Colorful, funky, musical and totally unique. Rally the fam and the pups, Ingo's is a stand-out.

This is a fun local eatery with great outdoor seating and complimentary chocolate chip sea salt cookies!  Their shattered chips with jalapeño sauce are a crowd favorite. I'd liken them to a cross between french fries and potato chips, or the natural word-meld "frips." Some are thicker cuts of tater, others are thins crisps, so everyone is happy. One order is good to share as a side for two people. I also overheard a guy at the next table ask for a half-order which isn't on the menu, but apparently is allowed!  My husband and I had the Paris, Texas Burger and White Fish Sandwich. Both were good, although the fish serving was a bit small and the buns were the kind of white bun that leaves you feel like you're eating air.   We didn't order drinks, but they have a ridiculously long happy "hour" that runs from 11am to 7pm and includes beer, sangria, wine, and cocktails.  The decor is colorful and tables are well-shaded. My only other critique is that the service felt a bit over-attentive. The waitress asked permission to refill our water glasses and cleared my plate while I still had a bite in my hand (not to be pushy, just trying to serve well). Although, I am coming from cold Boston, so the friendliness is partially just a bit of a culture shock!  Overall it's definitely worth a try. Check out the LGO grocery and knick knack store across the street if you have time to poke around, and don't forget to grab some of those complimentary cookies on your way out!

This place was awesome! My fiancée and I went here last weekend and had two of the best burgers we've ever had in AZ. I had the Paris Texas Burger, and I asked for ketchup so I could squeeze it all over my burger like I always do, but then I took one bite of the burger and realized this was definitely not a burger in need of any condiments, it was perfect as is! We also had their home made chips and dipped them in their jalapeño sauce. Also, their outdoor patio setup was very spacious and inviting. We have our wedding coming up in October and will definitely be sending our friends and family here!

If you're in the NE Phoenix  area Ingo's is definitely the place to go of you're looking for a nice chill lunch. The staff was friendly and very helpful for a first time customer 5 star place for sure

Oh my, my second time here and the food is just as delicious as before even togo! We had the chicken sammy and the indigo burger  With 2 sides of the smashed shattered  fries Everything was wonderful and cooked to perfection You can not beat the price  Portions allthough smaller than most sandwich shops,  they make up for the taste and presentation  Not greasy and so tasty yummy perfect combination of flavors If you park at curbside the servers come to you, great service with a smile Try them out, you do not want to give this place a miss

Updating my review to 5 stars for Ingo's! We have dined in multiple times now & have consistently had great experiences. Their food is always delicious & the service is good. Our favorite menu items are the Crispy Chicken Sammy & Farmer's Daughter Burger with a side of Fresh Shattered Potato Chips (big enough for two to share)!  We have brought multiple friends with us, some from in town & others who were visiting us from out of town. Everyone is always impressed with this place! We will definitely continue dining here & bringing our friends with us.

They gave us a tiny plate of potatoes out of the four meals we ordered because they ran out of potatoes. Before we left, they mentioned they had potatoes now but were reluctant to give us the remaining potatoes to go. Indicating we were simply asking for more? Umm no, we didn't get any with our meals to begin with.   The waitress was dropping f-bombs behind our toddlers which made the whole experience worse.   AND Don't drink from the glasses. Orange juice spots are caked to the bottom of the cups. Gross!   Horrible experience. :(

You can't go wrong here. The name Ingo's Tasty Food is very accurate! Tasty food attentive service! Erin was the best! You gotta have the fresh shattered potato chips with their homemade hot sauce. The tuna burger and white fish club sandwich were tasty and well presented. Deserts were good even though they were not on the menu. Highly recommend a visit to this hip local spot with street side dining.

I live a couple of minutes away; why has it taken me so long to dine here?! Cool corner eatery/bar in Arcadia. Chill atmosphere,good music, friendly staff, cool-looking chefs(love the mini-mohawk man) and nice patio(dog- friendly).   First bite of their burger is like no other, light, airy, crisp & flavorful at the same time.   Buns are deliciously toasted, good sharp cheddar cheese,  crisp bacon,  juicy burger patty that is steamed then finished off with a pink center! Eh, on the pickles, too salty.  Great shattered potatoes(like my mom's) with a creamy dill(?) dip. Didn't care for their home made jalapeno dip that doesn't pair well with the potatoes, possibly better with tortilla chips.  Delicious, tart lemonade.   Overall, a must try!
The shattered chips are so good. I also had the ingos cheeseburger. It was Adam and Eve style and it was still so good. Definitely a good place for a burger.

Great weather and fun patio with dogs and good food. Wait staff was a bit co fusing but I think we caught a seat when the waitress was on break. They got it figured out. Had the chop salad, delicious but a but too much lemon made it hard to finish. It won't keep me from coming back often
Awesome staff, very accommodating. Food is just mediocre and menu is very very limited. Seemed overpriced for what it is.

Ingo's is a neat little spot, with an interesting concept.  I agree with Lindsey H. who called it a 'gourmet concession stand'.  The inside only seats about 12 people, but there is lots of outdoor seating!  The menu is also quite basic and small, but you can tell the main focus is on the ingredients.  You can get any burger Adam and Eve style (naked- with lettuce), on a LGO English muffin, or on one of there homemade hamburger buns.  I went with great company, Jon and Amy, so we each got a burger in a different style, of course Jon went naked :P   Amy had the burger with sauerkraut (Ingo Burger), I think we all agree that was the best burger and quite unique with great flavors.  Amy said, "This is the best burger I have had in a long time!"  Jon and I were a bit jealous.  We both opted for their version of a bacon cheddar burger (Paris-Texas Burger), which had Tillamook sharp cheddar cheese (for the record I LOVE this cheese), a homemade sweet barbecue sauce, and crispy pancetta.  It was quite good, but I have had better bacon-burgers in my day.  I also found the barbecue sauce to be a bit sweet for my liking.  Jon and I still devoured every last morsel, so I am not really complaining as it was good food.    The menu was lacking side dish options and salads.  We had the spiced up potato chips that are made in house and comes with their version of a sour cream dip.  It was good comfort food, but very fried.  The only salad on the menu is a quinoa and kale salad, so if you don't like that 'stuff' you are SOL.  This is not a bar, but it is also worth noting the beer and wine options are limited...but they are only $3 during happy hour, which we managed to make by 7min (ends at 6pm).    Last but not least, our amazing server told us about their ice cream sandwich dessert with Belgium chocolate and peanut-butter!!!  If I wasn't stuffed and heading to the gym right after eating I would have been all over that!! I will be back to try that for sure, but I would come back in general anyway :)

The food here is just sooo good! I love this place from the design to the service to the food. I had multiple dishes as I came here hung over & was starving the first time. The watermelon salad was amazing, but the Ingo's burger made my day. The grass-fed beef is great. It was ridiculously good. In fact, I've been back twice to get a burger to go since then.  I wish it was closer to my place, but that is no a deal breaker. They lose one star for not having Tito's Vodka & a little more of a wine selection. I plan on heading back there for food very soon.

Heard a lot of positive things around town about Ingo's.  Best Burger I have had in town.  Fantastic service, reasonably priced.  Good local beer as well.  Only knock would be the hybrid fries/potato chips...  They just weren't my thing (more of a personal dislike rather than a knock on the establishment).  Mrs Z had the gelato to finish and loved it.

Apparently people are having a much better experience than I did. Because of the good ratings, I was interested in checking it out. My husband and I stopped by when Ingo first opened, I order the salmon burger, and it was completely raw inside, I wasn't expecting to have a sushi burger. When I inquired about the sandwich, they told me that's how it's supposed to look, but I know what raw and rare look like. My husband didn't really care for his order either. Could have just been an off day. Maybe one day we'll be back.

Great food, horrible service. Their burgers are excellent: juicy, flavorful, delicious. My friends enjoyed their veggie burger and chicken sandwich too. The chicken sandwich was ordered grilled, but arrived breaded and was sent back. That was just the beginning of service that was just awful. The food arrived, but we had no silverware or napkins. One of my group of 3 asked for utensils, so the waitress brought her a knife and fork. The other 2 didn't get any. Then I asked for utensils (ordered burger with no bun-I really needed utensils) and she brought mine, but no napkin, and neither for the 3rd person. When the chicken sandwich came prepared as ordered, she STILL didn't bring utensils! Later after the plates were cleared the waitress asked my friend if she wanted more ice water. She didn't offer iced tea to the other 2 people sitting there with empty glasses. Then another server filled up my friend's glass with black tea, but didn't fill mine with green. I had to ask yet another server for more tea. It was bizarre-they couldn't see the needs of the whole table, just 1 person at a time. They need to hire some smarter people, these dingbats are hurting business.

I never knew this place was right across the Postino's and LGO!! How I got here was due to eating at a sister restaurant, Chelsea's Kitchen. I received a certificate to dine in and I finally made it a point to come in for a bite or two. Today I came in for a super late lunch - at 4:30pm-  or you could call it an early dinner. Parking lot was a bit sparse but so is the rest of the other restaurants' parking. (Would be such a pain but luckily we came at such an odd time!)   I accidentally walked in the employee door where the staff forgave me and allowed me to enter. Otherwise, you should enter at the front double doors facing the street.  There are tables outside with heat lamps and then an inside bar that can seat about 16ish or so. 4 of us chose to sit inside since it was bitter cold outside. The area was shaped in a circular shape so that patrons can view the chefs. 2 chefs were working behind the somewhat covered kitchen while a couple staff members (maybe one was the owner) took orders and held the fort indoors.   The menu was limited as the space. Everything is a la carte style. I started off with drip coffee with cream and sugar to fend off the cold weather. Then I tried the freshly cut and cooked seasoned potato chips with skin-on with a sour cream-like sauce on top. Chomp chomp! Then I tried the Ingo's Cheeseburger made with grass fed beef, black creek cheddar, lettuce, tomato, mayo, dill pickle in between soft brioche bread. They cook their patties medium pink but of course you may choose to alter the making of that. This was quite juicy and delicious. The "No.1 Tuna Burger" was a tuna party, lettuce, avocado and a Siracha-mayo sauce (to give it the kick) in between a pillowy brioche bread. This actually seemed like a No.2 burger compared  to the Ingo's Cheeseburger just because it didn't seem as flavorful although both were juicy.   I was getting quite full but had to get something sweet so ordered a couple sea salt chocolate chip cookies. Found out that those were complimentary! Yummy for a Cookie Monsterish chick like me. My eyes became not full but my stomach was.  I ate 2 small cookies with the rest of my coffee.   The server was energetic and always checked how we were doing. Overall I enjoyed the freshly made meals and the comp cookies. I also saw that they make fresh juices too! I'll have to give that a try for next time! They have happy hour drinks from 11am to 7pm weekdays. Cheers!

I absolutely love this spot. Another champ from the lgo family.. The hummus and veggie plate is beyond beautiful and delicious.  They have some similar items from the menu across the street at "Lgo" and have a great patio. The best is the happy hour from 11am to 7pm and they have a wonderful cocktail called the ingo's greyhound, mint leaves, grapefruit, Lemon and GIN!!!

One of my new favorite places! You can tell they pay attention to every detail, from the ingredients they use to the quality of service! Everyone is friendly...love sitting inside to watch the line. The burgers are amazing, as well as the chips. I am confident everything on the menu is amazing!
Second trip in: The fried fish sandwich is delish and ask for a side of the fermented jalapeño sauce. It makes everything it touches AMAZING!

What can I say? Shattered potato chips... Yum. Deviled eggs... Yum. Chicken salad... Yum... Chicken Sammy... Yum. And top it off with the fresh baked cookies, it was the perfect brunch! I would highly recommend Ingos. The food really is tasty!!

YUM YUM, oh ya and YUM! My boyfriend and I loved every bite and minute we spent here. The homemade chips are amazing, our burger was to die for and we also filled up on the hummus and the amazing cookie ice cream sandwiches. All of our servers were on their game and so kind & welcoming. It's also fun that the kitchen is so open. It feels like you are apart of the whole process. I would absolutely go back again and again.
The tuna burger is delicious!  Menu is reasonably-priced and the service is quick and friendly.  This is a great place for lunch on a nice day.

Fun concept and it's always nice to be able to sit outside this time of year. The burger was quite tasty, but I think some of their sides stand out more than the burgers themselves. Thought about going back several times to give it another shot, but each time I get there I end up deciding to visit LGO across the street instead, which may be the best summary of it I can give.

Omgoodness! My husband and I came here for an improvised date night last Friday. We did not know what to expect but we were amazingly surprised. He ordered their BBQ style burger and an iced tea; I got the classic burger and a frozen vodka lemonade. We also shared an order of chips with tzatziki and tomatillo salsa. Everything was absolutely delicious! To be honest, I'm craving those chips and dip right now. And I could go to one or two of those lemonades every weekend. Hoping they open up one of these places closer to home.

Ingo's has quickly become one of my favorite spots for a quick lunch or dinner. The simple menu has something for everyone. Ingo's Cheeseburger is fast becoming my favorite burger, the Crispy Chicken Sammy is delicious and the Shattered Potato Chips are amazing.  For a small patio restaurant with limited space I've never had trouble getting a seat. The service is always friendly and the atmosphere is fun and inviting. Highly recommended.

Ingos, you are so cute. I really want to have a huge crush on you. BUT... the food's just OK. The potatoes and sauce?? Awesome. The chicken sandwich?? Awesome. The free cookies? So awesome. But the other stuff I've had there... rice bowl, tuna burger, have been bland and just... OK.

We stopped by on a rainy Saturday--it was great timing --we were able to sit down at the counter immediately.  We ordered the chips to start.  We are a family who likes our fried foods well done or extra crispy---these did not disappoint and the dip they come with is fantastic.  We all ordered burgers.  They are very good--but I know now that I will order a little differently next time--they were a little too pink for my tastes--not their fault--they were exactly as they were described on the menu. next time I will order a little more well done--which will also give a chance for the cheese to melt a little more.  We shared a couple of ice cream sandwiches (which were given to us for free for a little tiny mix up on ordering--how cool is that--what great service)  as the rain stopped it started to fill up.  by the way the building is great looking--so simple, but there is something sublime about it and loved the McIntosh vintage amplifier--spitting out the tunes.    Will definitely be back to sample some more of the menu.

I am a big fan of the LGO and this new amazing place just proved again that this team definitely knows what they are doing.   The atmosphere at this new place is purely amazing!  Three of us went for the first time around dinner time. The Food was really amazing. In my opinion sizes are perfect; however, that is the only one thing me and my boyfriend disagreed on as he thought that portions are bit small....No surprise there...hahhaha  We ordered their popular chips and I do not know if I like chips or dip more! These amazing chips were Crispy, crunchy, and served with a lemony tazaki kind of dip (not sure what exactly it was but - it's super legit!) Ketchup who?     For dinner me and my friend ordered the crispy chicken sandwich and my boyfriend had a Paris, Texas burger of course. I was lucky to try both as me and him split ours....Crispy chicken was amazing, the spicy aioli they use is out of this world. The chicken was crispy but yet nice and tender at the same time. I loved the apples and dill pickle combination in sandwich as well. Burger was good as well but I am not big on red meet so I am not as good judge on that. However, I can say my boyfriend liked it a lot.   The only thing I did not like is the fact that they served food and drinks in plastic ware. Food in plastic didn't bother me as much as drinks did. For example, the beer would have been fresher in a cold glass as opposed to a plastic cup. But perhaps that is just me....  Outside seating area is amazing....Overlooking Campbell avenue with beautiful lighting outside was great! Service was amazing as well. The fact that their chef came out and asked how the food was, is kind of place I would for sure go back too.   Everyone there was really nice and friendly and I will for sure go back!

Great place. I've been here several times. Very casual and friendly. Amazing service. Nice people. I've had several of the hamburgers - very good. Last night I tried the fish sandwich!!!!  Wonderful. My wife likes the salads. Go there.
Good food & friendly staff gets my vote! Love the shattered fries with yogurt sauce. Local fresh food and reasonable prices. We'll definitely be back.
Our family loves this place.  Dog friendly. Great chicken sandwich.  Potato chips are to die for.   Excellent servers.  Especially Anthony.

It's a cute restaurant....  but that's it. The menu is so limited and everything is overpriced. It is nice to be able to order some of Chelsea's Kitchen's stuff like Tuna Burger and Kale Salad for a reasonable price but I'd rather go to LGO, Chelsea's or Postino's. The food was OK but overpriced for what you get. My friend and I ordered the Kale Salad and a lemonade. They also charge $1 for a lemonade refill. Paid $14.50 including tip and we left hungry. Parking is so limited - same as LGO.

Ingo's is one of our standard go-to places. To the point that we've made a rule that we can only eat there one a week! The menu is small but everything on it is really well done. The chips are a "must have". I prefer to ask for them to be extra crispy. And the sauces are delicious. Service is usually good. It's definitely a dog friendly place, but a small patio so not a good place for a rambunctious pup. I haven't had the weekend breakfast yet, but I'm definitely planning to try it sometime.

What's not to love?! This place has decent cocktails, dog friendly patio, free cookies, unlimited lacto fermented hot sauce, and the best vegan burger I have ever eaten! To make it Vegan you can get it with an english muffin or as a lettuce wrap. The service is usually decent, depends on how busy they are though. My boyfriend is in love with their fish sandwich, and I feel price wise everything is reasonable.
5 stars for food, service is so so.  A must go for sure for casual lunch / dinner. food /drinks / location are awesome.

This place is cute! It's small, intimate, and very personable!   Our server Mimi was adorable! She attended to our needs very promptly.   I ordered housemade lemonade to drink. It was tangy and minty! Perfect for a hot summer day out in the porch :)  I got their cheeseburger with chips. My burger was juicy and pink, just how I love it! The pickles on the burger were so good! They were those pickles that aren't fully pickled. Lol the chips were interesting. They came with this delicious yogurt sauce that has garlic and lemon juice in it.  I had to get dessert. I got a mint chocolate chip ice cream sandwich. Delicious! Just delicious!   I would definitely return to this place!

Ended up at Ingo's on a whim today and had one of those accidentally awesome experiences that ensures I will be a return customer.  My boyfriend and I arrived around 1 pm on a Saturday and immediately found seating at the bar, which is awesome because it is essentially "in" the kitchen. We ordered deviled eggs to start and were impressed by their size and creamy filling. For the price, I wish they would add another piece to the serving, but after getting so much other good food, it was not an issue.  I immediately fell in love with the idea of getting the tuna burger, but due to shipment issues and the morning rush, they were out. The boyfriend and I decided on the Crispy Chicken Sandwich and the Paris, Texas Burger and our server talked us into a side of chips.  The sandwiches came out pre-split (which is ideal as my bf and I love to share) and the chips were just as delicious as promised (they use baked potatoes, which gives the chips an awesome texture and flavor)! Our server also hooked us up with a salted caramel Gelato sandwich to make up for the lack of tuna sandwich, which was very yummy too!  Overall, we had a great experience with delicious food and conscientious service. Next time (which I hope is very soon!!), I want to try the egg salad (weekends only, looks amazing and innovative) and the tuna sandwich. Keep up the good work Ingo's!
