Love the grass fed beef, you can definitely taste the difference! The only reason I give them 4 stars instead of 5 is that they don't have fries, and the potato chips were ok but not worth 4 bucks. They should raise the price of the burger and include fries :)

Great service! Jenny and Erin were great!  The plastic wine glasses are unique. There is currently no wifi, so not a work lunch place. But the overall atmosphere is great and the music sets a great vibe. And the veggie, hummus, and pumpkin seed dip dish is delicious!

Everything here is good. I love the circular patio and all of the employees are helpful and friendly. Their patio is also dog-friendly which I always enjoy. So why only 3 stars? There are just a few things that make me feel like this place will not be a regular on my restaurant rotation.  Ingo's has become a mecca for families with young children. That's okay but just go knowing that you will probably hear a few kids screaming or crying at any given moment. The shattered potatoes were good but needed more seasoning--they were basically fried potatoes with pretty minimal seasonings. And the  burger? It was good but I wasn't amazed. The kaiser roll got pretty soggy by the time I was done eating (and I'm a fast eater!). I think pretzel rolls or something else might hold up better.   Overall, Ingo's is a fun place. The food is decent and the vibe is fun. I'm sure I'll be back, especially for happy hour when certain wine is $3/glass! But the overall experience and food doesn't have me dying to go back too often.
We ordered the chicken and fish burgers--both were incredible. Service was a bit hit or miss. We would go back for food!

Make time to go to Ingos..   This quaint establishment is a must stop for me at least twice a month .. ..    My wife and I truly enjoy everything about this place .. For me personally once I try something I really enjoy I usually don't sway towards anything else ...    I always order their chips w/ aoli dipping sauce .. amazing  .. So amazing!!  and their Sammy chix sandwich is exceptional ..lightly breaded chix breast with green apple slice , a special aoli and a fresh bun .. I'm getting hungry just typing this .. I pair this w/ their gin greyhound which is in my top 5 best greyhounds ..  The service is always friendly and cute.. The management is always their to make sure your experience is great, which make this spot one of my favorite stops in Phx area ..

When I saw a rotunda like restaraunt I knew I had to pop in. Parking is rough here, spots are slim to none. Parked West of the building in the neighboring lot and it's a pretty small lot so it was not the most fun maneuvering around or getting out afterwards.   Had the Paris Texas Burger, Fresh Shattered Potato Chips, and the Housemade Lemonade. The Lemonade wasn't sweet at all, so you might want to ask for some sugar packets. The Paris Texas Burger was savory and delicious. The atmosphere was pleasant, had string lights, and trees. Definitely a great spot in the evening. Service was excellent, attentative and amiable! The Shattered Potato Chips were okay, they taste super salty and burnt to me.  But loved their version of tzatziki sauce. Would go as far as to say that their sauce was better than the chips. The complimentary cookies were very hard/tough.  Burger, atmosphere, and service was great! Not a huge fan of the parking situation, lemonade, or chips.

A friend and I accidentally stumbled upon this place en route to the Postino across the street. The interesting look and feel of this restaurant, coupled with the outdoor seating and the cooling weather enticed us to give their **tasty food** a try.   I ended up going with the Cale & Quinoa Salad, while my friend tried out the Mother Earth on Toast (vegetarian burger on toast, essentially). In preparation for an eventful evening, we both had their Single Cup Brew coffee... in all respects, it turned out to be just an average dining experience. The food wasn't overly exciting and the coffee was ordinary. To top it all off, our waitress (although attentive) seemed to be very distant and uninterested. Both my friend and I found it to be rather strange.  Nothing to seriously write home about, which was disappointing because the restaurant looked pretty trendy!

Sit in the sun with a sangria pitcher and potato chips during happy hour for a nice escape from reality. Fresh veggies with double dip were also very good. Burger was juicy but had too much relish. Food prices are typical for the LGO/Postino corner.

A friend and I tried this place for happy hour and we both agreed that the name is appropriate. In addition to tasty fare, the patio makes a very pleasant hangout and the service is fast and friendly. I hesitated to come here only because I thought parking would be a problem, but it turns out that I need not have worried because they provide additional parking a short block away.

Had lunch with a friend this week.  Can't say I would want to go back.  Service  (patio) was great.  Paris Texas burger was very good although a bit on the small side.  Guess I must have automatically gotten the petite size and did not notice they had a regular size offered. I had read the reviews of the smashed potato chips and was hoping to experience a really good side but alas it was a BIG disappointment.  The chips were mostly burnt and the lebni sauce wasn't all that good.  The pickled jalapeno sauce was at least enjoyable when I could find an unburnt chip to dip it into.  The Moscow Mule was served in some type of copper cup which transferred the tinny taste to the drink so that was most unpleasant.  Might have been better if it had not been served in the cup but I am not going back to get another one and ask for a glass container to see.  On the whole if you stick to the regular size hamburger and forget everything else on the menu you will not be disappointed but if you try other items be ready to be sorry.  After all the good reviews I read I am wondering about their taste buds have gone on strike or they just don't want to truly critique the place.

Well I just found my favorite burger joint in Phoenix, it is Ingo's.  It is a really cute place across from LGO.  Everything about this place is awesome.  The only down side is that they do not have a whole lot of seating inside the restaurant.  But they do have tables outside.    The reason why this place is my favorite burger joint is because of the Ingo Burger.  It has sauerkraut, Dijon sauce and to top it off I got it on a English Muffin.    Let's just say I will totally be coming back here all the time.

I'm upgrading my review to five stars, because I've grown to really love this place. I've pretty much eaten my way through the menu (it's small, please don't judge :-D ) and each new thing I've tried has been better than the last. The chicken schnitzel is amazing, full of crunch and flavor, and the Ingo burger is one of the best (get it on an English muffin). The service has been consistently good as well as welcoming, and they're now offering complimentary sea salt cookies (the same ones from Chelsea's) which are amazing!
Very flavorful black tea and the Kale and Quinoa Salad was a different combination for a salad and very tasty.  Friendly cheery staff, good music and atmosphere.

I really like Ingo's. And yes, their food is tasty. This casual dog-friendly patio hangout, right across the street from its parent restaurant La Grande Orange (or, LGO) offers the same high quality eats. Although Ingo's menu is small, each item is chock-full of fresh ingredients and flavor. I really like the black bean burger; in all honesty, it is one of the best veggie burgers I've ever had anywhere. The kale and quinoa salad is also yummy and full of good-for-you ingredients that makes you feel like you did your body a favor. The deviled eggs and shattered potato chips (very similar to really thick potato chips) are delicious. I usually order 2 of each. Ingo's is a la carte and each menu item will cost you between $7-9 (except for the deviled eggs and shattered potato chips, both of which are considered appetizers and are both under $5).  Check out Ingo's and try some tasty food. :)

Gourmet version of any regular American food place.  6/10 for taste. Get the big burger (5oz I believe) if you want the size equivalent that to a regular size cheeseburger.  No French fries but they do have their own version called fresh shattered potato chips. Eh.  I'd return here if I'm in the area, only for the sea salt chocolate chip cookies they gave us when leaving.
The servers are always nice and down to earth. This is a good place to have a peaceful bite to eat outside. Selection isn't huge, but still good.

I ordered the chicken burger and it was just as mouth-watering as I expected it to be - with perfect breading on the outside and a wonderful bun, plus delightful pickles to add some crunch. The shattered potato chips are AMAZING, especially with the dip they provide. The tea is very unique and delicious. Basically, the food here is perfect and the atmosphere is cute, so I will be coming back here as much and as often as possible.

My second time at Ingo's and it was hit! I love the concept of a gourmet food stand! Quick, easy and inexpensive.  We've sat both times inside at the bar so we can watch the action in the kitchen.  Great menu and great service. The tuna burger is awesome and full of flavor.  Must have the shattered chips! I will be making regular stops here, what a great addition to the neighborhood!

Yeah, I'm thinking there is going to be a lot more of this place in my future.  I finally tried that elusive egg salad only served for one hour. Incredible. I truly believe eggs are the perfect food. I also believe I might be addicted to food considering I am writing this update solely for an egg salad sandwich.   Send help.

Before I start, I must say that I'm quite salty that LGO took the Shangri-La veggie burger off the menu when this place opened up.   It was a good marketing strategy, because it forced me to go over here for a veggie burger. I ended up with the avocado toast. It was delicious! A little garlicky for my taste, but I know my boyfriend - the garlic lover - would have enjoyed it. The sangria was great for $5. I am not a white sangria fan, but this was their only option and it did not disappoint me.   They have an AMAZING happy hour. 11-7pm mon-fri!!!! This place is less than one mile from my office...dangerous.

This is undoubtedly my favorite spot in Phoenix. It's pretty much why my husband and I live where we do. We love the crispy chicken sandwich & the kale, quinoa salad + crispy chicken - seriously, it's the best! They just started serving breakfast so we had to try it. We indulged ourselves by trying the cinnamon rolls (baked to order perfection), the english muffin with yummy preserves and the chorizo burrito, dipped in their jalapeño hot sauce, is what dreams are made of. Our hearts and stomachs are always so happy at Ingos!

Amazing service on top of amazing food makes ingos a must try in Phoenix! A handsome gentleman (Anthony I believe) greeted us with a welcoming smile and suggested  their in house iced teas and the hummus dip, we were NOT disappointed! You can taste the freshness of everything you eat here and thats a rarity in todays world. Following our app came the fish sandwich and shattered potato chips, TO DIE FOR! We will definitely be visiting ingos on a regular basis :)

Had a terrific burger here for dinner.  As for Ingo's as a whole, still not quite sure what to make of the place.  When you drive up to 40th St and Campbell, this tall cylindrical building on the northwest corner sticks out like a sore thumb.  I knew going in that it was an LGO restaurant (the same folks behind popular Arcadia neighborhood hangouts like La Grande Orange Grocery/Pizzeria and Chelsea's Kitchen), but the building is pretty unconventional even for LGO.  And as with the other LGO spots, parking is sparse at best.  Fortunately we got here at the right time on Sunday and got a spot.  There's actually quite a bit of seating outside the building.  Its shaded too, but it was 110 degrees today so we chose to eat inside.  First thing you notice walking inside is the tray of cookies right in front of the main entrance.  They're complimentary and taste great (basically the same complementary cookies you get at Chelsea's).  The rest of the interior mimics the building construction itself with the grill right in the center of the interior.  A circular counter surrounds the grill with waitresses in between you and the grill.  The menu is very limited, but I already knew I wanted a burger.  Specifically, I came for the Farmer's Daughter burger.  Dijon sauce, sauerkraut, and swiss cheese.  The toppings were great, but honestly the unique beef was what sold me on this burger.  Its a grass-fed, hormone-free beef from a free range family farm in Wisconsin.  I honestly don't actively seek hormone free or free range beef, but WOW this burger was unbelievably juicy.  I'm not sure why Ingo's seeks out this product, but boy am I glad they do.  I was a little weirded out that the burger didn't come with a side, but the burger was good enough that I forgot about it.  My only compliant about the burger would be that I wished it were bigger.  Total cost for the burger, a beer, plus tax and tip was $17.  The burger by itself was $9 which is a little steep for the portion I got (thus why I can't give this 5 stars), though I get that its a special type of beef that probably costs more.  We were in and out of this place in 20 minutes.  Staff was friendly and helped explain the menu to us.  It wasn't busy today, though I'm sure this place is nuts during the weekday lunch hour.  And I can definitely understand Yelpers' frustration with the parking situation.  If my burger hadn't been so awesome, I probably would've given this place 3 stars.  But the beef really is that good, so 4 stars it is.  Much of the rest of the menu is on the healthier (and cheaper) end so I'll do some more exploring next time I'm here.  But for the record, the Farmers Daughter is definitely among the Top 5 burgers I've had in the valley.

Came here for a spur-of-the-moment dinner last night with a friend while exploring her Arcadia neighborhood.. I'd been interested in Ingo's for a while, and I'm SO glad I finally got to try this spot!!  I got the slider-sized veggie burger with the shattered chips, while my friend got the kale and quinoa salad with crispy chicken. I was starving by the time we'd decided to have dinner, and my meal was more than filling. I'm not vegetarian, but I tend to eat veggie when dining out, and I LOVED my burger.. it was perfectly crisped on the outside and that vegan cheese is still making me drool. The fries were amazing -if you're not a huge potato chip fan, you could definitely share this, since it's a very generous portion.   While I'm not generally in the Arcadia area, if I find myself nearby and hungry in the future, I'd definitely come back to Ingo's. Plus.. did I mention, they have free salted chocolate chip cookies?! Yes please and thank you!

Stopped in thinking I was going to grab a quick lunch. Left having ordered the deviled eggs as an appetizer and then dessert! The sandwiches were amazing, accompanied by delicious homemade sauces. I will be going back, often!

This is my new favorite restaurant. The food is so fresh, light, refreshing, and delicious.  We had the "No.1 Tuna Burger," "Shredded Kale and Quinoa Salad," and the "Fresh Shattered Potato Chips."  The No.1 Tuna Burger consists of super grade tuna and bulgur wheat, spicy aioli, and avocado. So delicious. The Shredded Kale and Quinoa salad includes sunflower seeds, grapes, red pepper, parmesan and manchego. It was okay. Wasn't that impressed with it to be honest. It lacked a savory element and I didn't like the grapes but it's very refreshing as a side.  The shredded potato chips were really good with the Lebni side sauce.  The atmosphere is interesting. It's like a family oriented bar. I sat next to a family with a baby while upbeat dance music played at a medium volume that allowed for conversation. I'm really excited to know this restaurant exists because it's a cool restaurant/bar with great food. I'll be back again soon.

I honestly don't like giving bad reviews, so the one star is for the great location. The facts: the burger was small and had a funky taste - we both had the Texas burger- the bun was paper thin, no refills on water, and no utensils. Really wanted to like this place. But didn't happen. Not sure why the great reviews. Won't be going back.

A beacon of light amongst a grim and draining work seminar.  During a work trip in Phoenix, I decided I needed some good food to keep me from trying to strangle myself with my conference lanyard. As always, I turn to yelp to guide me in the right direction. On overnight trips I get a dinner expense allotment and try to buy as many items as possible before I hit the max. If you're going to keep me in a cold, dark room for 10 hours and feed me nasty turkey meat and caesar salad all day, you will pay (literally and figuratively).  I found this beautiful gem and decided to get an Uber for pick up. I called ahead and they have curbside service which is cool. I ordered 4 items and only used 1/3 of my allotment. As a regular person, that's awesome! As a tired employee seeking vengeance, I was bummed out. I get there and run into two of the nicest servers/cashiers/to-go bag getters ever. They are just so helpful and happy, especially since they were about to close, I was so confused. They also kept complimenting me, that I started really feelin myself a little too much on a Tuesday night.  I get the green sauce and some cookies and I'm on my way. I decide to give a cookie to my Uber driver for waiting. He was pleased.  I ordered the deviled eggs, kale salad, chicken sammy and black bean burger.   Kale Salad - UM. YES. Kale on it's own, can really bum someone out. But this salad was amazing. The flavors blended so well. And even though it's not the biggest, it's rather filling.  5 Stars  Deviled Eggs - Good. It was closer to an ice cream scoop on the egg than a dollop. Nice and creamy. Memorable though? Not really. 3.9 Stars  Black Bean Burger - UM. YES Please. Simple burger, but great. Soft bread. Flavorful patty and spread. Just a good bite. Spicy though? Not to me. 4.8 Stars  Chicken Sandwich - Another win! Although I must admit, at this point I started getting dizzy from all the wonderful flavors building up on my palate , I thoroughly enjoyed it. The chicken wasn't really crispy (again, it was take out), but the sandwich is good. Nice kick from the aioli and balance from the apple.  I know you're wondering, did she finish it all? Well, you'll never know. I don't like being judged, especially on crowd-sourced websites. But what I will tell you is that I feel like a champion.  Oh, and I have yet to try the complimentary cookie, but my awesome Uber driver thought it was great.

Simple little place, fast to get your food . The burgers are awesome they're super light and airy so you don't feel overwhelmed after eating. Cute patio to sit outside and it's reasonably priced. I got the black bean burger and it was really great. Recommend trying this out

This place serves perfectly portioned meals. I ordered the Paris Texas Burger and it was very delectable. The meat was perfectly cooked, juicy and had the right flavors you are looking for a burger. The bun was also very soft and scrumptious. The servers were well attentive. This little gem is a must visit.

Get the crispy chicken sammich. Best fried chicken I've ever had, and the pickle+apple combo is out of this world. I can't stress this enough.   My boyf got the burger and also loved it. Oh, and the chips are delicious (we split them and it was plenty, the dippin sauces are original and so, so great)...and and and the people who work here are so nice and great! If you haven't eaten here yet you are missing out big time!

Such a cute place in the Arcadia neighborhood!  I met a coworker here for lunch and we sat outside to enjoy our tasty chicken sandwich...it was the kind of chicken sandwich that you can't stop thinking about and crave it often.  It was a little pricey, but worth every penny.  This place gets busy, so anticipate a wait.

You can drop a hundred here & there at nearby steak houses, however Ingo's will satisfy you with fresh, perfectly done eats for a fraction of the cost. Beau enjoyed the fish sandwich and my guacamole veggie dish was the envy of the counter. What gorgeous veggie colors & presentation. Perfect ending to an early evening out.  Free salty, chocolate chip bites. This is a really nice touch.   Staff friendly & professional.

What??!?? INGO's Crispy Chicken Sammy (100% natural chicken schnitzel, dill pickle, spicy aioli, granny smith apple) goes 'IN' my questioning mouth & then it's 'GOne' haha!!    I know, I know!  Thinly sliced apples on a chicken sandwich?  At first it's a bit strange but then with each additional bite it becomes WOW!  Even my guy friends surprisingly fell in 'awesome like' with it!  TONI'S Deviled Eggs (german mustard, goat cheese, pickled beet, dill): I remembered them from a previous restaurant they had & the deviled eggs are still very tasty.  INGO'S Greyhound (gin, fresh grapefruit, lemon, mint) was smooth.   And my friend had her favorite: the PARIS, TEXAS burger (certified angus beef, apple bbq sauce, nueske's bacon, cheddar, lettuce, dill pickle). Hers was really nice but the Chicken Sammy is my FAVE!  Now the sauces are made from scratch, too.    Yummmmmm!  Go apple slices!!  PS:  finally tried the shattered chips mmmmmmm!  And Keegan, our server, is an absolute doll & adorably awesome!!!  @ingostastyfood

Neat little place.  Dog friendly. Cheeseburger very good; however you have to update one dollar to get better grass fed beef. Prices are so reasonable, why bother with the lower grade stuff?  Wife's salad was on warm plate which should have been chilled -greens were wilted and not as fresh as they were expected to be. Not quite Postino quality, but we will return and hope for improvement.
Quick and easy take out spot.  Definitely try the shattered fries.

First of all, this is a beautiful building designed by Will Bruder Architects. They did a wonderful job designing a building that fits in perfectly with the fabric and character of the area. The site layout and landscaping is neat too, though parking is a bit sparse. Except for when it's brutally hot outside, their patio is amazing. Seating inside is pretty limited. Service is friendly and efficient. Our meals have always been really good, but not necessarily out of this world. The chips and veggie burger are close though. Prices are a bit steep for the portion sizes. Overall, a very solid option with a lot of character.

This is a really neat place to go. I've never seen a restaurant like this. I recommend the French fries! We got the fries and they were so good. They came with two different dipping sauces and they went nicely with the chips. The food is very fresh and the people there are very nice. I definitely will go again!

Loved this little place. There is not a ton of seating, but the patio has a great feel to it.  We both had the Paris Texas Burger and it was delicious.  We also have the homemade potato chips which are more like slices of potato deep fried.  The food was wonderful and the service was excellent.  I would highly recommend.

Last night, my two toddler daughters and I stopped by this sister restaurant to next door LGO. It's a cozy little spot, reminiscent of the classic bell ringing diner where your waitress stands in front of you at a counter pouring a fresh cup of coffee and the chef is behind the grill cooking away, but in a totally updated and refined way. The menu is simple classic American but with a twist and every entree is delicious! I commented to my wife at home that the chicken sandwich is the best I've ever had! Who would think to put a thinly sliced green apple and pickle in a superbly fried crispy chicken sandwich. The resulting balance is culinary perfection even if it's something so simple. Try it out you won't regret it!

THIS PLACE ROCKS!   I had the Ingo cheese burger, my wife had the chicken sandwich and we split an order of the chips. My burger was amazing. The service was phenomenal. Our server was very well informed and was able to answer all my questions without hesitation. The beef in my burger was made will all natural, grass fed beef and it really makes a difference. It has been a long time since I have had such a great burger!   All in all this place is great and I cannot wait to go back with my friends and family.

Yummo burger! I read the one review that didn't give the place high marks... well maybe they didn't get the cheeseburger or they are taking crazy pills as I am a connoisseur of cheese burgers. Now I will say- my fav. in the valley is Matt's Big Breakfast Butter Burger... Ingo's is a different kind of burger as this is a super cool food stand and not a retro diner. What they have in common is AMAZING BEEF and CHEDDAR! So if you love great quality rancher's beef and yummy gooey cheese on a delightfully simple bun- go now to this place before others find it.

This little corner of Campbell and 40th Street in Arcadia should be called , 'fun foodie corner'! LGO has once again added a new place and it pleases on the more healthy simple side of the palette. Recently, I used a gift cert I had to try it out during a great winter day in Phoenix.. meaning, not the typical 'winter day' of anywhere else; The sun was shining and the birds were happily chirping as we were not under three feet of snow like other parts of the US. Ahhh us lucky Arizonians! We get to lunch in the winters on a sunlit patio.. and Ingo's has a great one! Colorful little tables adorn this picnic patio under the trees and on the corner for watching the life of whatever pass by. The menu is simple, as is the food. The special of the day is brought to you on a sticky note and thats cute. Clean and pretty healthy choices await you here at Ingo's. But if you're anything like me.. I can order everything healthy and then SOMEONE at my table inevitably will get the splurge factor involved that I can not resist. In this case and on this day it was the Fresh Shattered Potato Chips! Soo, so tasty! They are not 'chips' in the sense of being thin .. they are hand cut potatoes and a little thick with just enough sea salt and Ingo's hot sauce , (and yes, IT's HOT!(, or a creamy dipping sauce on the side. Too yummy for words! Completely shareable! We shared the Toni's Deviled Eggs that say they have goat cheese per the menu.. they were super good! I just don't know if I can say I actually tasted goat cheese. I also had the White Fish Club Sandwich.. and if you have read my reviews before, being from the bay area and growing up as the ocean as my back yard, I always ask if the fish is fresh. She assured me it was and I can attest that it tasted very fresh! I did the fish grilled versus fried and it was tasty! The sauce was amazing and made the sandwich very good! A decent serving at that! I also did a small Kale and Quinoa Salad.. YUM! The right amount of lemon sets the greens, grapes and red peppers offset with a smattering of parmesan, manchego cheeses and sunflower seeds into a spin for your tastebuds in this very healthy salad. I can see myself grabbing one of these to-go in large to fly with! Ingo's has housemade sangrias; cocktails; craft beers and LGO's own red and white wine. This was a 'school day' for me so no libations but Ingo's could be the perfect place for having cocktails on this great patio. They also have curbside service for 'to go' orders! In all of my years of living in the valley, not one LGO concept has disappointed me and Ingo's, by no surprise, did not either. I truly loved it.. a healthy, simple concept with clean ingredients! I only came in with 4 stars versus 5 on this review for the girl lacking in her energy in serving us.. I could not tell if she just wasn't into us or her day or her job! She barely cracked a smile .. I get it, as I have days like that too. Usually a perk of espresso makes me forget my woes for the time though! Nonetheless, nothing else could possibly have been wrong with Ingo's ! Can't wait to come back and hang out on the patio with sangria in hand!

Charming patio scene with gorgeous cafe lights that screams adorable! I love the relaxed vibe and trendy staff.   My girlfriends and I came here around 7pm on a weekday and were able to sit down right away. We ordered some vino and the shattered potato chips (I think that's what it's called)....sooooo good! Perfectly sliced potatoes with an amazing sour cream / dill dip which was lip-smacking good. For dinner I had the chicken Sammy and shared the kale/quinoa salad with my amigas.   The chicken Sammy was a fried chicken sandwich with a zippy sauce that was so flavorful. As for the kale salad, I hesitated a bit because I'm not one to enjoy kale (I hope to get there in my life). This salad was amazing!!!!! There were grapes in the salad which gave it a sweet something something. I need to figure out how to copy this salad because it's packed with superfoods.   For dessert we had the salted caramel ice cream sandwich which was sooooo good!! And to mention, if you don't get dessert go hit up their free 99 cookie table.   Definitely check out this restaurant for a fresh twist on american food.

Am I missing something?  I've been here three times, and I just don't get why people like this place so much. In an area that's as saturated with restaurants as Arcadia is, Ingo's is nothing special.  The funky building architecture and the "is it plastic or is it glass?" wine cups are far more interesting than the actual food.  If you want a good burger, go to The Grind or The Stand, which are both nearby and WAY WAY better.

Love the patio seating, the service was great. I ordered the crispy chicken sammy which was delicious. I loved these apple slices on the sandwich, it went great with the pickles. The shattered chips were excellent. Next time I'll be trying a burger.
I absolutely love this place. Paris Texas Burger with their homemade chips. To die for!

Amazing food! Came here on Saturday evening around 7:00 & had a slight wait. So nice to sit out on the patio & enjoy great food & weather. We had a drink to start off called the Greyhound so excellent if u like grapefruit and the avocado toast as an appetizer  (so delicious). I ordered the veggie burger & it did not disappoint. We also had the fried potatoes with a sour cream dill sauce & green salsa.  So glad we were told to try this awesome place. We will be back!

Wow! just absolutely amazing. I am an employee of La Grande Orange and I had never been to Ingo's. tried it out today for the first time!   I had the farmer's daughter with the cashew veggie patty. it had so much flavor and was overall a complete home run! The shattered potato chips were delicious too! And to top it all off the Flower Child was incredible. So well-balanced, refreshing, and I am a huge fan of the Frida Kahlo Tequila used by LGO and Ingo's. mmm!   My friend had the tuna Burger and it was very tasty as well. Great job guys! love that this company takes such great care of their guests, and employees. plus there's so much thought, love, and care put into the food!!!

I come here for the Happy Hour greyhounds, but stay for the delish cheeseburgers and fun atmosphere. The best part of living in AZ is eating on the patio, and they have one of the best. But even when the warmer temps drive us indoors(although they do have misters), we enjoy ourselves. The food is reasonably priced! Troy is an awesome server, very attentive and knows how to anticipate our every need and offers awesome suggestions.  We have never had bad service here! When you are in Arcadia, make sure to stop by!

This is the perfect burger. The meat is amazing. High quality and cooked just right. The types of burgers are nothing fancy... They don't need to be the actual burger is that good. I'm a low carb gal but I have had the burger with the bun and it is fantastic. You'll be happy with any of the choices. I also love the watermelon salad. The complimentary oatmeal chocolate chip mini cookies is a nice touch.

Just simply delicious. I decided to try Ingo for the first time tonight after driving past it numerous times and seeing their awesome reviews. They definitely didn't let me down. I ordered in so I went through the curbside pick up. It's a small parking lot and I had to wait for others to get their food first even though they said 8-10 minutes. Anyways... I had the whitefish sandwich and the shattered potato chips. Sooooo good! The sandwich was very fresh, I just needed more sauce and I was given a generous amount of potatoes. I plan on returning and hope to become a regular.

Simple menu with choices for everyone. The deviled eggs were on point, and the rest of the menu is just as good. The atmosphere is comfortable and the music is appropriate for a patio dining experience.   This place makes the neighborhood nicer!

Ingo's is a cool place! Small inside, but the patio is really cute and there's a lot of places to sit. I enjoyed the food I got a lot - we both had the Paris Texas Burgers with BBQ sauce and bacon. I was super hungry and it was delicious!  However, I had to rate this place a little lower because our service was so bad. It started out fine, and she was really attentive and quick with our drinks and taking our order. Once she gave us our food, though, she pretty much never looked at us again. We were still hungry after the burgers and wanted to get something else and another drink, but after waiting for 20 minutes we just put our card down to pay and left (it took her another 5-10 minutes to get our card). It would be one thing if they were super busy or if she was stuck in another area for a while, but she passed right by us SO many times and never glanced over or seemed to see us trying to get her attention. I would like to come back here because I liked the food, but I probably won't rush back after such a frustrating experience :/

If you're a fan of Ingo's sister restaurant LGO, than you're going to love Ingo's. Their burgers are reasonably priced, and incredibly delicious.  Their menu is small, yet they have unique entrees that will still make difficult to pick one.  Sitting is very limited as it's small location, but everyone is usually in-and-out due to the quick service. The only thing that I'm not the biggest fan of is their fries. Well they aren't even fries, they are chips. I want real fries, and I want ranch to dip them in. I know it sounds obnoxious, but there is nothing like having some thick cut fries with your burger. Besides that, the burgers are amazing. For all you vegans, make sure you get the black bean burger, but ASK for it on an English muffin as the regular bun is not vegan. Staff is really friendly. Make sure you plan ahead as parking can be tricky and time consuming.

Hands down the greatest veggie burger! My boyfriend an I come here a few times a month because it is so good! He says the chicken sammy is amazing. Make sure to grab a few cookies with your meal they are delicious! And a  greyhound to drink.  The patio is great to relax as the sun goes down. Heated in the winter and misters in the summer so it really is great all year long. We bring our dogs and the servers are so kind to them. We have never had a bad experience.
Every time we go to AZ, we go to Ingo's. This place can't be beat--burgers, sangria, and homemade chips. You gotta go!

We sat at the counter indoors for our first time.  We weren't sure about the noise level outside and we like to watch chefs at work.  Traffic level/noise at 6PM on a Wednesday was pretty minimal, so we will sit outside on the patio next time.  Order the shattered potatoes with the jalapeño sauce!!!  Amazingly good and they make them fresh right in front of you.  The potatoes are served with a ridiculously addictive dipping sauce called 'lebni' (greek yoghurt, spices & something highly addictive).  The 'lebni' was so tasty that we ordered a side to take home and try on other things.  Regarding the jalapeno sauce, they puree the peppers, add a few things and then let it 'ferment' for a week.  Then they add vinegar and a few other things.  Minimal heat level, fantastic jalapeno flavor.  Happy Hour -- $3 for good beer (and wine)!  We ordered two Paris burgers medium rare (we feel that it's a shame to overcook high grade, grass fed beef).  The meat was perfectly cooked with just the right amount red.  Amazing apple bbq sauce -- we ordered a side to go with the potatoes.  For something semi-healthy, we ordered their salad special for the night -- watermelon, feta, mint and pistachios.  Absolute perfection for an August night in Phoenix.  The people next to us ordered the kale salad and the avocado toast, both of which looked awesome.  It was funny watching them 'go foodie' on vegetarian food in a burger place.  :)  Regarding dessert, they do ice cream sandwiches from LGO ... but they aren't on the menu ... and they are really GELATO!!!  I had the 'fresh' mint chocolate chip & my wife had the salted caramel.    We are converts.  :)

Ingo's is absolutely amazing each and every time that I go! I always opt for the Paris Texas Burger, because it never fails to satisfy my burger craving. The potato chips are tasty and cooked perfectly with a little crisp. I've tried the deviled eggs, but wasn't too impressed. I wish they had a large selection of beer, wine, and drinks. :(   Burgers are the best, hands down. If you go, go for the burgers! They're mouth watering and they always recommend the burger to be cooked medium, which is the best way to have a burger, dah!

Tried Ingo's for the first time today. Got the White Fish Club Sandwich with 1/2 order of fries and the housemade lemonade.  First off, the fish on the fish sandwich was perfect and very moist & flaky. The dipping sauces with the fries are amazing, especially the jalapeno one.  Lastly, that's some of the best lemonade I've had since I was a kid. Really, tart, lots of pulp. Yum!
A 12 ounce beer (minus 2 oz for the head) served in a plastic glass is a bit absurd.  Charging 5 dollars on top of it!?  More absurd.  I won't be back.

We tried the new local burger bar by doing takeout. It was quick and the burgers were great. Love having a place that sells well sourced grass fed beef.  The only suggestion is that they should have more side options. Sweet potato fries would have been great.
First time at Ingo's! My bf and I went here for dinner  on Wednesday. We ordered the chips, deviled eggs and each had a burger  Chloe was amazing. She knew a lot about the company and menu choices!

Tasty place to grab a bite while dining street side for people-watching and to enjoy days with beautiful weather. The homemade chips and dips are very savory. Prices are very reasonable. Staff is friendly. Dine during off-peak hours to avoid crowds. Make sure to grab a couple free sea salt chocolate chip cookies on your way out.

This was really, really good. The atmosphere is just right, the customer service is extremely nice, and the food exceptional. Really I can not find one thing wrong with this place, hence the five stars.  I ordered the Paris Taxes burger, and my wife got the special chicken and waffles. We ordered a side of "chips" on the side. The chips came out first, and they were like no chips that I have ever had before. Obviously house made, they were like tiny cuts of delicious potatoes with sour cream on top. They were very very good.  The burger was cooked medium rare and was very tasty. The house brewed tea that I ordered along with it was also very good. My wifes chicken and waffle was the bomb, seriously the best chicken and waffles ever!  Enough can not be said about the level of customer service. There was never a time when we felt neglected, nor did they hover. It was the right amount of attention. The manager even came out to check on us to make sure we were enjoying our meal.   This is a place I would highly recommend to anyone, try them out.

I stumbled upon this place today and I am so glad I did! This restaurant is tucked away in the corner of Campbell and 40th street. The outside patio is surrounded by trees so its shaded and really cute. You can definitely sit inside around the bar area. Okay, now let's move to the food. I ended up ordering shattered potatoes because literally everyone around me had a plate of these in front of them. I was not disappointed. They were delicious and paired well with the Ingo green sauce and lebne. I also got the veggie black bean burger, which I have to say is the best one I have had so far.  Definitely going back to try more stuff!

This is a very small casual sleek MODERN gourmet burger joint that also offers cocktails and beers. You're most likely coming here for the insanely great grass fed beef burgers. I had a really terrific beef burger from here before so this time I tried the sushi grade ahi tuna burger. The chopped up tuna patty was held together with whole grain and seemed light as air. The patty was topped with buttery avocado for richness and that spicy sauce made the burger really delicious. I also liked that the bun didn't seem too big and was sturdy but also seemed light at the same time. We shared the non-traditional deviled eggs. They were really large and tasty with a little fresh dill and pretty pieces of beetroot. We also shared the shattered potato chips. They were crisp and some had soft centers. The chips came with jalapeño sauce and labne. The jalapeño sauce that came with the chips was very tasty and the Lebanese style yogurt cooled you down so things don't get too spicy. When you're done they offer you complimentary salted chocolate chip cookies.   The help were extremely helpful and friendly.  The restaurant is hospital-like sparkling clean.   They offer a small dog friendly patio.  Parking lot is small.  A complimentary valet is located across the street.  High quality ingredients prepared to perfection with Great Service in a pristine clean environment deserves 5 Stars.

Potato fries Good . I got tuna burger. Not good I expected a tuna burger with fish filet but got lots of fillers with a few bits of fish. I took a bite of my hubbies burger and it's very  overpriced and nothing to write home about. Go to in and out burger and save your money.
The hamburger is pretty good(ch3ese burger, a bit on the smaller side).  The house potato chips with garlic is great also.  Overall a good eat for lunch.

Really wanted to try the tuna burger, unfortunately it wasn't available.  Paris burger was an excellent substitute. I also ordered the fries/chips. The sourcreme paired well with the fries/chips. The server was friendly and quick.  Music and ambiance were great, wish there was more seating inside.

We had lunch here this weekend and the food was pretty good. I was not impressed with the service tho.  Our server actually gave us a $7off coupon to use because she said she was 'not up to par' today without us even saying anything or complaining. That was nice of her, and unexpected.   The ambiance was great and we sat on the patio. I love the fact that the restaurant is off the beaten path. We will definatly try it again.

Easily the best burgers coming out of a cylindrically shaped building in all of Phoenix.  The grass fed beef is spot on juicy and the accompanying ingredients are unique and an ideal complement to the meat.  Now if only the LGO family could take a step back and learn how to build a parking lot.

Great service, tasty food, outdoor seating with the perfect amount of sun & shade with a stellar happy hour drink menu.  We had the shattered fries, a black bean burger and quinoa salad. The shattered fries win every time.

This place is so freakin' magical. Tonight Dema and Sunna were amazing - they hooked it up! The kitchen killed it, per usual. The spinach salad (post it special - so cute & clever), cheeseburger, deviled eggs and potato chips, literally changed my life. No. Seriously. There is so much love and good energy in this food.   Oh...and that patio? It's a little escape in the middle of the concrete jungle. Great music. Great atmosphere. The little string lights? Forgettaboutit!!!   My boyfriend and I will definitely be back. We will definitely be telling all of our friends and family. We might be your biggest fans.

I visited Ingo's this weekend (twice) and have to say they now have a little place in my heart. I absolutely love this little neighborhood joint.  On Saturday I stopped in on a whim and sat at the indoor counter solo. I ordered the tuna burger- wasn't a fan so I then ordered a cheeseburger. The tuna burger was interesting but the texture was odd. Why still 5 stars? Because the grass-fed beef burger was heaven in a bun! I'm talking melt in your mouth deliciousness! I kind of wanted dessert and Laura (I believe she's the manager) talked me into the ice cream sandwich. She told me it would change my life. Well she wasn't joking this salted Carmel ice cream sandwich gave me life!! It has sugar cookies on each side and I was told they add more cream cheese and butter to the cookies so they don't fully freeze. I'm sure that means more calories, but who cares it's totally worth it!  Well I was so impressed that I brought my friend in on Sunday and we sat outside. Let me point out that we received full service outside after we seated ourselves- we did not order from the window. I got the crispy chicken sandwich this time and O...M...G!!! It's even better than the burger I would have rated 5 stars!!! How did this happen?! It had apples, pickle and a sriracha mayo on it. It sounds odd, but take my word for it finding a chicken sandwich better than this will for sure be difficult! I also enjoyed the shattered potato chips. They come with a dipping sauce- no idea what it is but it's pretty good. They also have this house-made jalapeño hot sauce that is awesome on the potatoes and has a nice clean fiery kick! If you like spicy food be sure to ask for it as it's not something that automatically comes with your order.  Lastly, another reason they get 5 stars is because the service is amazing! I had conversations with Dom the executive chef and Laura and both were so extremely friendly and welcoming. Along with the friendliness, there's also some serious eye candy working in there which is never a bad thing! ;)
My first time here. Great coffee, awesome atmosphere, and super friendly staff. You don't need to be a hipster to enjoy this place. Will definitely come back for lunch and hh

The food, outside patio, and service here is awesome! We started with the homemade potato chips with lebin...and I'm addicted.  I have been craving them since we went yesterday.  I ordered the Tuna Burger, which was sushi grade tune with a light bun and other dressings.  It was delicious and very light. I highly recommend this place!!!

Beautiful little spot with healthy, yummy food at great prices (for reasonable portions, all a la carte).  They call it a gourmet food stand which is basically a healthy, quick little burger-type joint, with beer, wine and lemonade.  My husband and I split the tuna and veggie burgers, both of which tasted healthy and delicious.  The ground tuna is mixed with bulgur wheat and topped with lots of avocado, and the veggie burger is a fresh mix of neat stuff - veggies, cashews, brown rice.  I do plan to ask for tomatoes on the tuna sandwich, next time.  Note: the portions are on the small side.  I personally love a place that serves the amount I'd like to eat and charges accordingly, but it's good to know.  There are tables inside and outside this small, circular restaurant - it looks delightfully swanky but it's totally casual.  If you're in the mood to grab and go,  there are several convenient to-go parking spaces, a dedicated pick-up window and super quick food.    After hiking Camelback, it's a great close place to stop to eat something yummy that doesn't negate your fitness efforts.

Visited today for the first time with my wife and son.  Excellent!!!  We all had the cheeseburgers and special fries (2 portions was enough for the 3 of us).  Everything was brilliant.  I even had caramelised onions for no extra charge and they were delicious.  Service was outstanding, as was the quality of the food.  Other food that we saw being served also looked yummy!  Will definitely visit again.

Hands down the best veggie burger I've ever had. My boyfriend got a regular burger and really enjoyed it too :P  We also tried the deviled eggs which were pretty good too. They were made with goat cheese and mustard and topped with pickled beets !

Tiny place, tiny parking spots, tiny portions. But, place is worth a try. Ordered -  Black bean burger with cheddar : tasted really fresh and yummy. Tiny burger like I said before. Potato chips : its worth a special mention. Chips are  deep fried but not completely fried. Like weird but tasted amazing with the green dip.  Amazing ambience and music. Not really sure about the groups. Totally worth a visit.

Food was ok, not my favorite burger in town.  The style of this restaurant and outdoor seating makes this place draw you in.  Had to the burgers back to be refired a bit, hadn't complained about it but the manager came out and apologized and gave us a coupon for $15 for our next visit just for the inconvenience of having to wait for the burgers....I like a place that takes care of its customers!

This place is such a hidden gem. Across the street from La Grande Orange and Postino's Arcadia, this place almost feels like it's inside a tree. The patio is covered in sagging trees giving it a super cozy feeling.  I had the crispy chicken sandwich that came with a spicy mayo and thinly sliced green apples. We also shared 3 baskets of the Chips (crispy potatoes) that were pretty incredible. I haven't had anything like that before and was pretty blown away.  Our waitress was super focused, patient and knowledgeable about the menu. She explained each question and dish in detail, and was quick to pick up our plates as soon as we finished. Even the girl behind the bar was super friendly and chill. The place was quiet as we went in after happy hour ended. It was a perfect girl's night!

One of my favorite spot to go and grab a delicious burger at when I'm in my neck of the wood. They just came out with The Avocado Toast! Try that before your entree and you will remember me...boy is that delicious!!! The manager is always around and very friendly, always meeting and greeting the customers. The staff is friendly and happy to work here, you can tell. Now, this will definitely make me be a regular here; that's what a good customer experience is all about, and we as customer love to be treated right :)

Chicken sandwich and fish sandwich. Oh and those chips are just so mouthwatering. You'll have issues parking most likely because it's a super small parking lot, but they do have overflow which is nice - short walk away. Love walking or riding bikes over to eat! The patio is adorable and super pleasant.
Great imaginative menu items and efficient ordering system!  Ingo's Tasty Food is an instant classic!

Great burger joint! Excellent service and chill patio. Inside seating is limited and there's no wifi (although if you sit on the west side of the patio you can lift it from their sister restaurant LGO). If you order your burger medium rare you ACTUALLY get it medium rare. Very #rare. Extra parking a block down on 40th st.

I can't believe it's taking me this long to write this review, but better late than never!   Listen to whatever others day and try the egg salad, but show up between 11 and 12 because they only offer it during that short hour. Even if you think, "I don't even like egg salad," still get it. I was one of those... "but I don't even like egg salad" people and then I tried their version and was blown away. This isn't your typical egg salad sandwich. If they didn't put mayo on it, I would almost call it a breakfast sandwich with a twist. The eggs are cooked fresh for each order and they are combined with their delicious mayo sauce and placed on crispy yet fluffy bread. Make sure you order it with the pancetta if you like a little meat. It's crispy and salty and yummy!  Besides the egg salad, I have also enjoyed the tuna sandwich and cheeseburger. I was pleasantly surprised with the tuna sandwich because it was crispy and accompanied by an aoili and avocado. I don't typically order tuna but I was glad I switched my routine. The cheeseburger had the delicious LGO touch and the meat was perfectly cooked. You really can't go wrong with any food here. The Kale salad is a great side to accompany the meal. I only wish they had french fries on the menu. Their homemade chips are delicious but I am more of a french fries kind of girl.  This is a great location to enjoy lunch on the patio, but if it's too hot, then you can sit inside and watch them make your food which is really fun! They also have a walk-up window where you can place an order to go.   If you can't find parking, head north on 40th street and follow the signs to additional LGO parking.

Amazing. The three of us had about 24 hours in Phoenix and are self-declared foodies. When my sister found Ingo's we decided to check it out. We were already excited by the architecture. Then once we got even more excited once we saw the food coming out of the kitchen. We ordered the potato chips with labne, deviled eggs, rice bowl and the tuna burger. It was all, like I said, amazing. The tuna burger lacking in flavor but with the jalapeño salsa it got better. The rice bowl and the potato chips were the real winners. Plus the complementary cookies at the end were delicious, chocolate chip with sea salt flakes. Yum!

Positives: Shattered potato chips with lebni dipping sauce. Wow. Deviled Eggs. Wow. Pretty good beers on happy hour.   Negatives: Honestly wasnt too big of a fan of the burger or the chicken sandwich. A little bit of a letdown but the 4 stars is mainly for the appetizers.   Will return simply for the shattered potatoes and lebni.

I've been here three times previously and always had the chicken sandwich which we all know is amongst the best in town. But on my stop by the takeout window today at noon I knew I wanted something different and told the young lady working the counter (wish I'd asked her name so I could acknowledge her...cute brunette...ponytail I think). Rather than give the "everything is amazing" line that annoys the crap out of me she recommended a single item that she thought I would like, the Paris burger. She even gave me a food hack to ask for the next time I'm there (chicken sandwich with Paris burger toppings). I got home, devoured the delicious burger (I'm not normally a grass fed guy) and am already thinking about the chicken sandwich with Paris toppings she recommended. Kudos to Ingo for truly tasty food and also for such a great staff of friendly and knowledge people. They make the food even tastier...especially for people like me who score atmosphere and energy of a place right up alongside the food.  The Stand may have the best overall burger in Acadia/Arizona/America? but for the complete package, Ingo's Tasty Food can't be beat.

Can you say amazing!? I only get the fish sandwich when I go here but it is a damn good sandwich! One of the best fish sandwiches you'll find in this city. The shattered chips with the green sauce and the white dip!!! Omg! Glad my mom lives in another state because it's so good I wanted to slap her! 5 stars!
Cool little hipster joint. Food is good and they had a few beer taps. Good place to go if you want to get in and out in a hurry. Deviled eggs are outstanding!

Great food and great happy hour prices, with a few downsides:  Parking is not easy especially if you are unfamiliar with the neighborhood.  When paying with a credit card, the minimum tip was 18%. (note to self:  pay tip in cash).  My friend and I both shared the fish and chicken sandwiches - chicken wins as it stayed together and was more flavorful with the apple.  The fish fell apart and was a mess.  The potato chips were outstanding and flavored nicely.

I love Ingo's. (Little sister to another fave across the street, La Grande Orange). Ingo's is very small and cozy, but has a wonderful wrap around patio that's great for people watching, and also dog friendly.  The menu here is limited, but don't let that deter you. Ingo's is a little gourmet burger joint specializing in grass fed beef. The burgers are simply amazing. They are recommended cooked medium pink, which is really the best way to eat them . They're also available in two sizes...petite (3 oz) and regular (5 oz.). Do yourself a favor and get the regular. Otherwise you may be ordering two burgers, not just because they're small, but because they're that good! The other thing not to miss are the shattered potato chips served with Lebni ( a Greek yogurt sauce) and pickled jalapeño sauce. Sounds weird, but it's so delicious, especially mixed together! For libations they feature LGO's famous white sangria, and a wonderful Greyhound.  Good stuff. Check it out.

From the second I walked through the door it was an amazing experience! Tara took such good care of me as well as the other employees ;-) Looking forward to telling all my friends about this place . My veggie burger was so yummy+ complimentary cookies! Way to go team, friendly happy atmosphere!!  You have gotta stop in, to try the deviled eggs. Happy dining~~

This place is really cool! Stopped by to get food to go. Didn't realize they will serve you curbside and I like walked up to the window haha. I had no idea though! I got the veggie burger as my meal. It took quite a while to be prepared and it was kind of pricey to not come with a side. Otherwise really good though! Sometimes I find myself having to dunk veggie burgers in ketchup because there's not enough sauce on it, but this was just right! The spread had a delicious kick to it. Also I love pickles on the side but usually can't stand them on a veggie burger. I forgot to ask for my burger without pickles on it, but the pickles on it were actually really tasty! I'd really like to come back, the avocado toast looked yummy too.

This place was really surprising. A coworker and I went to lunch not expecting anything spectacular and were we surprised. The potatoe chips were mandalined seasons great and fried amazing. He got the classic cheese burger and I got the Paris Texas burger. One of our new favorite burger places. Very simplistic but that was the beauty of it, was incredibly delicious. We will both definitely go back and try more. Everything was reasonably priced as well.

Well, last time we came here, about 8 months ago, I would have given it 5 stars easily. Great burgers, everything was grass-fed beef, great happy hour prices, great atmosphere. Today, we came here after eagerly anticipating Ingo's, and it was disappointing. Now, it's $1.00 extra for grass-fed beef, and we were totally rushed by the waitress. We wanted to relax, have a few drinks, then order, but we were continually pestered to order, even though there were a ton of empty tables. We had the shattered fries, which were far greasier than usual, and we had the Farmer's Daughter burger and the Paris, Texas burger. Neither burger was worth writing home about. After 2 drinks and our burgers, our waitress just came and placed the bill on our table without even asking us if we wanted anything else. Totally killed the experience.  Food... Not nearly as good as it used to be. Drinks.. Greyhound is great but is $8 Waitress? Terrible.  Unfortunately, we won't make the trip here again when there are far better places to enjoy a few drinks and food in a much better and relaxed atmosphere.

Burgers are high quality and the perfect size. Not too big not to small. The fractured chips are excellent, especially with the sauce that came with them and the jalapeño sauce. The Paris burger will set you free and I could do shots of the jalapeño sauce
Overrated and over priced for what you get Good service but the veggie burger I had was mush and salty.   Zinburger far better.

Probably closer to 3 1/2 stars. I came here last night on a whim for dinner. The weather was perfect for sitting on the patio so we grabbed one of the few tables that were left and took a look at the menu. This place is small, and markets itself as a food stand with table seating. I didn't get a chance to look inside but the patio was cute and relaxing. Tables were a little tight but I enjoyed listening to our neighbors on what appeared to be a 1st tinder date.   For a drink I went with the Ingo's greyhound and my date had a Moscow mule. I ordered the deviled eggs as an appetizer and they came right away. Almost too fast, and as some others have stated they were pretty heavy on the mustard. For my taste there was also a little bit too much yolk per bite. We also got the potato chips which were pretty dang tasty. They were served with two dipping sauces, one was sour cream-based and the other was a weird green hot sauce. The hot sauce was good but it didn't seem to go well with the chips.   Just an FYI the menu is pretty limited, but done well. For entrées we ordered the cheeseburger and fish sandwich. My cheeseburger came out perfect medium pink and the poppyseed bun was to die for! The pickles were crunchy and overall it was a solid burger. The real stand out for me though was the fish sandwich. Lightly battered and fried, served with tangy tartar sauce and that amazing bun. The breading on the fish was very light but also very filling (and let's be real fried fish is way better than grilled).   In short, good food, service, and drinks. Not blow your mind amazing but I would recommend it if you're in the area.

I love this place. Hiking at the nearby mountain, I was hungry. Chatting with a couple of hikers on a trail and they recommended this place.  A quick glance on Yelp reviews, I wanted to try all. They all look so tasty. I ended up trying a cheeseburger. Added $1 to grass fed beef and ordered my burger medium rare. First bite of my burger, I tasted a soft bread and very good meat blended perfectly. It was a bit small for my appetite, I was still hungry after I finished eating.  I also liked yogurt base dip for their shattered potato chips. Deep fried potato went well with this dip as well as fermented jalapeño peppers sauce. I added sauce to my burger too.  Really liked the ambiance. This place is set up to cater only small group at a time. I like their round shape counter. In a warm day, I would like to come back to enjoy my meals on their patio.  They are so close to both Camelback and Piestewa peak hike. Perfect place to eat after good hike.   I would like to come back and eventually try all on the menu.

Here's the thing. A burger is a burger is a burger. You can get somewhat creative but at the end of the day, it's still a burger. So there's nothing particularly remarkable about the menu, on which burgers are the predominant item. Where the food does stand out though is the freshness and preparation: grass-fed beef and fresh veggies. What made my visit worth it was the fresh shattered potato chips served with a side of tart, creamy lebni. So highest marks for being creative with potatoes!!!!  The menu also has a few sandwiches and salads plus beer, wine and sangria. I REALLY hope that they start serving breakfast because it would be a great place to start the day. It's tiny but cheerful.....like a small diner complete with a circular counter around the open kitchen with some outdoor seating. Everyone working there is very friendly and light-hearted and they play good music which all really make this an enjoyable place to eat. I can imagine having brekky here with the morning sun coming in. (hint, hint, LGO!)  Parking is limited so keep that in mind!

I had the chicken & waffles! This dish is only available on the weekends. It was AMAZING! We will definitely be going back. There isn't a lot of parking at the location, but there is additional parking right around the corner, which was really nice! The service was excellent. The waitresses are on top of it! All-in-all this is a great little spot!

I love the food here. Haven't had a disappointing dish yet!  I usually go with the Texas burger because that is consistently good. Along with their fries and outdoor patio, it is an awesome experience. I also had the pleasure of ordering egg salad on their English muffins which is probably the best item on their menu. Too bad they only serve it for an hour each day. So you gotta get there at a specific time.  Nice waitresses and they do a lot to make sure you are having a great meal. Totally recommend this place for it's quiet neighborhood, great food and the convenience of going across the street for dessert and drinks at the market and bakery... who is also own by the same company.

Ingo's is a little gem, small portions that reflect in the pricing for very hip(ster) and happening Midtown Phoenix area.  Why go there:  It's a great spot for a light lunch or brunch.  If you are the kind of people who love to try different things, smaller plates to experience a few tastes, this is your kind of place.  Their bread is baked right across the street and so are the cookies.    Don't miss: The little burgers are excellent, these little tasty buggers pack a punch of flavor and so do the homemade chips...  The Sea Salt Chocolate Chip cookies are worth buying, they tempt you with a free sample at the end of your meal.  Tips: Don't go for the big dishes, try a few things a la carte when you are there, follow your meal with the coffee from La Grande Orange across the way, their parent company.

we love Ingos. Our family and friends will be arriving soon and they always ask to go to Ingos great burgers, fish sandwiches, and salads....good drinks as well. we go there often and love the chips as well. every dish is good. good service as well.
Food coma has set it... I will keep this short. The food was on point and had they not cut me off, I would have been arrest for driving under the influence of grass fed bliss.

The service was fast and good! The burger was very good but not the best I've had in Phoenix! The fried potatoes were really good! I didn't care for the pita bread and humus! The pita was very dry and bland like they got the left overs from Postinos across the street!  It was a good experience overall

I just can't seem to get enough of...Ingo's!!  I love Ingo's!! I am so happy that they offer grass fed beef, and the burger's are just super yummy.  My son loves the little cookie that comes in every bag and what better place to sit outside and enjoy the weather.

This place was very mediocre for me. The best part of our meal was the potato crisp appetizer. I ordered a black bean burger that was not only incredibly bland but completely fell apart. I understand it's sometimes difficult to keep them together, but this was ridiculous.  My friend ordered the chicken sandwich; it was good but very ordinary.  Everything just seemed so bland; just needed something extra.  Sorry, but I expected so much more.

We loved Ingo's! A group of three of us came here after hiking Camelback, so we were really ready for burgers. I enjoyed the Farmer's Daughter burger with bacon, and we all split the "chips" and deviled eggs. Everything was so fresh and flavorful, and I loved the flavor combination of the chips with the lebni + homemade hot sauce. They also had chocolate chip sea salt cookies that were way too delicious to even be real. I can't tell you how many cookies I ate, but I can tell you I'll be back!  Edited to add the service was great! Friendly and very helpful with giving us suggestions on what to order!

Had my brother pick up Inga's take out a few days ago.   I actually didn't order anything myself but loved the few bites of chicken sandwich my mom had ordered. They have some really tasty spicy sauce on this sandwich, definitely suggest it.   The fries are a must! Next time I'll stop in and eat there :)
This is a lil gem! Best patio seating for date night. They are known for their chips which were amazing with the recommended dip.   The burgers are also amazing. Will definitely be back!

I've been here a couple times now and it's always good. I'm an LGO group enthusiast. I love love love the kale and quinoa salad. So this time I added an angus burger as protein to the salad. So good. Cooked and seasoned perfectly. (I've had their burgers in the past and they are really good, worth a visit specifically for the burger). If you've never had the LGO group signature salad, it's got quinoa, dinosaur kale, grapes, sunflower seeds, and cheese (I want to say manchego) with lemon zest and a teensy bit of olive oil. It's so good, I crave it. Adding the burger to it was deeeeeelightful.  The hub had their crispy chicken Sammy. He loved the fresh bun and the lightly battered and fried chicken. They thinly sliced Granny Smiths on there, pickles (which the hubs removed), and a nice Sriracha aioli. He will be back for this.  We also ordered the shattered potato chips which live halfway between French fries and potato chips. Deep fried, out piping hot with a onion dip variation and salsa verde. So good. So naughty.  The kiddo "enjoyed" an excellent kids grilled cheese. She's just not a big eater but I tried it and it's a great grilled cheese. A nice hearty bread which is probably why she had a hard time with it. Comes with a couple shattered potato chips and a carrot. Of course she gobbles down the garnish. I do have to say that her lemonade was phenomenal. So fresh, tart, and perfectly sweet.   Good spot with happy hour from 11-7 M-F. Fair warning, if you order a sandwich, you get just a sandwich, albeit delicious, but there won't be a side with it unless you order it in addition.
Awesome restaurant. The  gin greyhound is to die for!! Happy hour could be the best prices in Phoenix. The wait staff is equally awesome! Defiantly will be coming back!

I had their chicken sandwich, was pretty good...nothing to special.Husband had the Paris burger, that was amazing! Service was great. Got to sit outside on the patio which was very peaceful. Ordered a Moscow mile during happy hour, was good...and they actually serve it in a all copper mug. Not the cheap stuff like most places do. A lot of really cool touches. Will be back!

I finally came back to try the chicken Sammy and it was delicious! The fried chicken was super moist and crispy. I though it would be strange having the green apple with the pickle in the sandwich but they complimented each other really well. It was probably the best  chicken sandwich I have ever had.  My bf and my best friend both got the Texas burger and they really liked it. The burger seemed like it needed a crispy factor to it (there was bacon on it but the bacon wasn't crispy) but the flavors were all there. We also had the pistachio vanilla swirled soft serve. It was really good very light pistachio flavor that went well with the vanilla. The soft serve was not too sweet.   I do really like this place and would highly recommend everyone to try it.

I think Ingo's deserves 4.5 stars, but I'm holding off on 5 for now.  We came in on a Saturday, close to closing.  While many places act put off, we were never rushed and were given quite good service.  Thank you!  INGO's is located across from LGO and gives you another option if the waits are too long across the street.  We ordered the deviled eggs (yum!) and chips (also yum!) as appetizers.  Definitely get these starters - they rocked!  I had the kale/quinoa salad with a tuna patty.  Next time, I'd opt out of the fish addition, but this salad was quite tasty and will remind you of LGO's salad, if you've had that.  My friend ordered the brown rice bowl, which I would consider for next time.  Very rich and hearty.  I want to make these meals at home every day!  The boys got the white fish club sandwiches and were quite happy with their choices.  All food was devoured quickly!  We finished with ice cream cookie sandwiches.  Not the best desert ever, but a nice, sweet, finish.    We'll definitely be back!

Ingo's is  home away from home. Cookies on the counter and you don't have to ask before you take one.. Or two. Good food that you come to think of as your own special something. Great vibe an the patio -even in July- without all the hassle. I heart into.  Must haves: chicken Sammie. Yes, it's that good. Chips are tdf (to die for). Veggie tray that comes with hummus could double as a centerpiece (if you're into that sort of thing). Greyhound with him though? Nah, had mine with vodka and enjoyed every bit of it. Love it, Will be a regular spot for us!

This is exactly what this corner needed, a cute little eatery for locals to enjoy, but I have a love hate feeling right now.  I was excited to hop up to the counter, but unfortunately the chairs do not move back and are too close to the counter and I slammed my knee pretty hard into counter wall while trying to sit at the counter, yep these seats were not made for those who are 6ft or taller, not comfortable at all, so I moved outside.  Good thing they have heaters, or this night would have been a flop.  Once we were seated outside, we were handed menu's, everything looks interesting.  To drink I had the coonawarra tea, which came in a cute little bottle with a glass & some ice.  I'm not even sure what coonawarra tea is, but it was good, I enjoyed it, the bottle rendered about 2  1/2 glasses, and I'm unsure if it is refillable bottle after that.  I ordered a side of shattered potato chips that comes with some sort of lemon spread dipping sauce, I was perplexed then as I am now, I can't honestly tell you if I liked them or if I didn't.  The shattered potato chips are fresh chips, but some are not chips just thick slices of potatoes, which this Irish girl loved and some were thinly sliced potatoes, I guess that's how they are shattered chips right? The chips were garnished with salt & pepper too. The lemon spread/dipping sauce that came with it, well that was unique, not sure if I liked it with the potatoes or not, but didn't stop trying it. haha. So conflicted I tell ya.  Also ordered the Paris Texas Burger, it was a Strauss family grass feed beef patty with apple bbq sauce, La Quercia pancetta, sharp cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomato & dill pickle.  Now I loved this burger, the sharp contrast of flavors between the cheddar & pancetta and dill pickle just made this burger pop! I would for sure come back just for that burger!   They do have a walk up window so you can order your food to go, which is something I will consider next time.  It's a cute place, service is extremely friendly and the burger was delish!

Best burger in town. Officially my favorite. Dema let me in late even though they were closed. Great customer service and great atmosphere. The two guys making the food were professional and nice as well. I suggest this place to anyone. Try the grass fed burgers. Can't go wrong here with the chips either. I will keep coming back.

What a charming little spot. The food is freshly prepared while you wait and it's healthy and light and delicious. Great ventilation and interesting decor. The wrap around counter is really cool and a great use of space. Outdoor seating is great too. Very little parking available on site, but Ingos is worth the walk.  Please don't bring your small children here unless they are well behaved. This place is much too small for disturbances.   I highly recommend trying Ingos. If you are met with a long line or wait, please know if you wait, you will not be disappointed.
They never disappoint! Everything we've had here so far has been amazing every single time!

I just love coming here. If you follow my reviews, you know how I am. If the vibe is right, I don't care what the price is. And that's how it is here. Every time I come, I love sitting out in the patio, enjoy my time in the sun (or not- as this time, the sun is blazing and of course the staff is considerate enough to move the umbrella so we are in full shade) and enjoy watching the traffic drive by. This time my friend had the spinach apple salad and I had the bison goat cheese salad.  The portion was just right, both were delicious esp the salad dressing for the spinach apple salad! The owners of LGO somehow has the magic 8 ball dailed into the right frequency to create an ever lasting environment each time. When I am sitting out on the patio enjoying my food and drinks, I feel transported to a space and time that is of the moment not connected to any human created contraption such as the clock. For the duration, there is just enjoyment.

I had never heard of this place then a friend suggested it for happy hour so we went and I'm glad we did. The food was awesome! Lots of healthy things to choose from and good drinks. I got the deviled eggs which were probably the best I've ever had. I'm not typically a huge devil egg fan but I was intrigued when I saw they had goat's cheese and pickled beets, they were cheap enough to I figured what the heck. I also got the kale and quinoa salad which was great, super fresh.

We love the chicken sandwich with the slices of apple to die for and oh so very good. We heard amazing things about this place so we decided to try it and it will not disappoint! The chicken sandwich is really lightly breaded and just the texture and taste will keep you coming back.

Last two experiences I've had at Ingo's  1) ordered curb side waited the ten minutes, went to pick up food, sat there for 15 minutes, decided to get out and see what's up, the guy that was taking to the person in the car next to me for the last ten minutes says "oh, I didn't know this was yours, it's been ready for a while".... I was in a hurry so I was mad, rightfully. I ordered from Ingo's this day for the curbside experience and didn't even have time to eat.   2) just now, order my go-to, better curbside experience, chicken is too dry to eat.   I WAS eating here three times a week (see my previous review ... 4 stars) but lately there has been no attention to detail and the food is either too salty or I guess now, over cooked.    Moving on.    Old review......   My husband and I just moved down the street from Ingo's and eat here often. It's really good, when it's really good. But sometimes it's entirely too salty.   He loves the fried chicken sandwich and I'm obsessed with their kale salad. I go back and forth on the fish, burger patty and the chicken.   I recommend the chicken but ask for light salt!   They also have an option for a grass-fed patty which is a really nice touch.

Burgers cooked perfectly (Medium rare, as I requested), egg salad with pancetta was out of this world, and the service was great! We will be telling everyone to come here! I bet if they wanted to, they would make amazing fries, but their burgers did it for me! :) thanks for a great lunch!

Waited 30 minutes while waiters passed by chatting to a group of girls at the only other occupied table at the "restaurant". They couldn't even get the water right. There was yellow crust inside all of the cups like someone had pissed in the cup and left it for weeks. Total waste of my time on my birthday. Will never go back. If I could give less than a star I would.
