Seat yourself kinda place. Very cozy. Came here for the Paris Texas burger...My boyfriend is actually from Paris,Tx lol.  Nothing to rave about. The meat was good quality...The whole burger itself lacked in much flavor. Boyfriends Greyhound was not really strong but I enjoyed my mule.  The 3 stars went for the ambience. :)
The black bean burger is amazing! Shattered potato chips with lacto-fermented jalapeño hot sauce and lebni (Greek yogurt sauce) is addictive!
Had a delcious beet salad with the "Ingo's" lightly battered chicken delight, the perfect combo to go with the "shattered potato chips"  I just love Ingo's, always consistant, always tasty...

Omg. This place leaves me speechless!! Ordered it one night through postmates and fell in love. I ordered the farmers daughter burger and husband got the chicken schnitzel sandwich. Flavor was phenomenal!! Never had chicken schnitzel before but I loved it!! Everything that was in that sandwich was honestly just perfection. The farmers daughter sandwich was just as phenomenal. I wasn't sure if I would like the sauerkraut on it but am so glad I just got it anyways!! Loved every single bite. After having it at home I had to check this place out in person. Hubby and I brought the pups and the waitress promptly brought out a water bowl for them. Service was great which tops everything off. This time I tried the Paris Texas burger and it was so good! I still think the chicken burger and the farmers daughter burger are my top favorites right now but I can't wait to get back to try everything else!! Oh and if you want to have the best chocolate chip cookies they have those here too!! Idk what it is about them. Can't say enough good things. Bottom line, if you're looking for some bomb food at very decent prices, come here!
Amazing trendy atmosphere!  Fantastic burgers, loved the Veggie platter and FREE cookies!!

We live across the street and last night my daughter and I went to dinner. As always the food was amazing (the chips are always our favorite) and our service was great. The gal who served us was our server when we brought my parents there months ago and she even remembers that time. Even if we didn't live across the street I would still frequent here. Love it!!

Very good burger and fish sandwich. Excellent home cooked potato crisps. Wonderful service. Outstanding, and we mean outstanding music - the proprietor of this restaurant is world class, and knows music and how to mix music, and that is an understatement!

I dined in at Ingos for happy hour the other night. I asked the waitress to explain the happy hour and she said 2$ off any drink. We ordered the frozen lemonade. When we received the bill, the lemonade remained at full price. We asked the manager, Arzu [sp], why the lemonade was not reduced. She responded that it was already at happy hour price and that it was "hard to explain". When we told her our server told us all drinks were 2$ off, she said "oh she must not know." She did not apologize for the poor communication, nor do anything to resolve the situation. She brushed it off and ignored us the rest of the evening. We had to flag down our original server to pay and received no further explanation. Very disappointed with the poor service, poor communication, and no attempt to resolve the issue.

Delicious and creative food! The veggie burger, orange and fennel salad, and smashed potatoes are all SO GOOD! I also really enjoyed the greyhound. Now that is a refreshing cocktail!   The service is great and the patio is perfect. With the misters on, it feels like a little shangri-la in the middle of the city :)

Good food and ambience in great neighborhood. Big drawback is that they use throw-away plastic plates, cups and utensils. Needlessly wasteful, can't wholeheartedly recommend because of that. For a brand new place, you'd think they'd be more thoughtful in their design.
Really good Paris Texas burger. The burgers are not cheap but you can definitely taste the quality.

I'm updating my review after getting an email asking for an opportunity to come back in, and am upping my review to 4 stars! I really do enjoy walking there with my bf and our pup and hanging on the patio. They put cement down on the patio where it used to be dirt, and it makes a big difference! The service is always on point and the food is really good. The chicken Sammy and quinoa salad are bomb, and I love the white sangria - super refreshing on a warm day. Only reason why I'm not giving five stars is because I still think the servings are too small for what you're paying. Today I grabbed the salad with chicken and the avocado toast. The total was $21 for a small (but delicious!) salad and one piece of toast with avocado, tomato and mozzarella. Again, very good but a super small serving. Will I be back? Absolutely! But I may forgo grabbing a drink to make up for the food price. Thanks Ingo's, enjoy having you in our neighborhood!!

We wanted to try INGO'S since we eat across the street  when we come to Arizona. It always looks busy so we thought the food should be good. We waited about 5 min before our table was ready . Everyone working there seems to be nice but the Manager  went out of her way to Make us fell welcomed. She was so nice when  my wife couldn't decide between which drink to get . She recommends a drink to her and also brings her a sample of the drink she was thinking of getting .I would recommend INGO'S if you like burgers..thank you Erin for being so nice... We live in California but when we visit Arizona we will eat at INGO'S for sure.

I love being outside and taking in the sun. At Ingo's, you take in the sun. Most of the seating is outside save some bar seating indoors. It makes me wonder how much clientele they get during the vicious summer months...think heavy use of water-misters.   I also love the small, intimate feel to the place. It gives it character. At the same time, the surrounding area feels like a social dining experience with La Grande and Postino's on the other side of the street, so Ingo's doesn't feel alone and isolated.   I've had the Paris, Texas Burger and the White Fish Club Sandwich. Both are really good and I highly recommend. I would call it fine-dining of traditionally fast-food. One other thing I noticed is that the portions of the main dishes are a little small to what I''m used too, but I think that just means appetizers are in order.   Parking within the immediate area is limited, but more parking is available a block north and on the other side of the street. A nifty accessory they carry is a hanger, which is a rod that's about 3 feet off the ground, which is used to hang your bags on.
I really liked this place. The service, drinks and food were great. I had a fish sandwich and the quinoa kale salad. No complaints.
I and my hubby had been to ingos we ordered paris texus burger and ingos cheese burger both were amazing very delicious.
This place is one of my neighborhood favorites. Great food, friendly staff, attentive service! I LOvE the chicken Sammy and the farmers daughter burger...

The ingo burger- it has an interesting flavor especially with the fol epi. Fresh shattered potato chips with lebni- it was ok, but rather have fries Hummus & pumpkin seed dips- good  Free cookies in which they add salt- interesting flavor

I went into Ingos with a friend this afternoon after passing by it countless times. I must say this place really blew me away! It's very very tiny you walk in and it's literally just a bar around the kitchen that seats maybe 15? I like the cozy feel and the servers are very attentive! We were in and out in about 30 minutes. Drinks came out immediately, the app came out super fast along with our entrees! I got the seasonal Rita, which was a frozen spiked lemonade with mint! It was so tasty. We started out with their shattered potato chips. They aren't normal chips but better. Almost a French fry feel. It came with a creamy dip and a spicy one, both were delicious. I got the black bean veggie burger it was to die for. You could tell all the ingredients are incredibly fresh. You literally watch the cook make it in front of you. The service was so friendly I can't wait to come back and bring friends!!

Stand Up For Tasty Food!  Ingo's Tasty Food scores a big thumbs up for Trendy & Tasty. Awesome casual vibe with even better food.   The location's design and atmosphere set it apart from its surroundings. It has a nostalgic fresh off the grill, picnic in the state park kinda vibe, but with a modern twist, and killer music selection. But not too hipster... cause you know too many hipsters in one spot is just too much.  And say hi to Erin. She can make solid suggestions for you.  I had the Paris, Texas Burger and Fresh Shattered Potato Chips. Both cooked in front of me and to perfection. Paired nicely with Chardonnay to start and Cabernet Sauvignon with my meal.  If you like a little spice ask for the Homemade Lacto-Fermented Hot Sauce, made with only jalapeño, vinegar, garlic, and salt. Simple but super tasty with just the right kick.  Ingo's is a sister restaurant to Chelsea's Kitchen and la Grande Orange Pizzeria and Grocery, all within a few hundred yards of each other. Looks like this family of hot spots owned by Bob Lynn have it all figured out.  So great to find a small town favorite in a big city like the greater Phoenix area.  Don't miss it, and prepare to hang out, cause that's what your gonna want to do.  Finish the night with the Salted Caramel Gelato and Vanilla Cookie.  I'll be back.  Don't miss more reviews at my website elevationexpeditions.com.
Love love loved Ingo's, but will not be back. They no longer offer any vegan burger. So sad. :(

This is an awesome, casual concept. With its outdoor patio and modern cylindrical shape, this fancy food stand is not one to overlook.         Sitting down, we decided to split a bottle of wine (they have a nice selection!) and order their shattered chips that come with lebni sauce--it's lemony and yogurt-like. I could hardly resist eating them all in one go!          Dishes come out minimally with no frills or fuss. If you're looking for a special, their salad special is on a post it note. I decided to try their brown rice bowl and wasn't disappointed. Although the jalapeño was a little more fiery than I'd expected (which slowed me down a lot) the brown rice, pistachios and poached egg on top were a delicious combo!        My friend got one of their burgers and was incredibly impressed--this is my next thing to conquer on their menu!

Tonight was the first night we tried Ingo's and we can't believe we never tried it before!!! We were greeted by a very kind staff and told to choose any seat, no wait at 8:00pm and they were just putting out candles on the tables outside! It was romantic, great music playing and our server came over right away! We started with the "potato chips" which are a delicious crispy mix between French fries and chips! It's served with their delicious homemade Greek yogurt sauce and hot sauce. Trust me, start with this is so good and perfect to share between two! The food menu is small but packed with unique flavors! I tried the chicken sandwich --it was nice and piping hot and super crispy! The sauce and apple combination with the sandwich are unbelievably good! My boyfriend has the fish sandwich "Adam and Eve" style (lettuce instead of bun)! I love bread but the fish sandwich was yummy with the lettuce--it didn't feel like you were missing out on the bread! Great atmosphere GREAT FOOD, amazing service! We'll be back for happy hour and dinner SOON! :)

Thank you Laura for your generous gift certificate, yes I had lunch at Ingo's with my family members today and had such a great time! We loved the atmosphere, the restaurant theme, the service and the food!   I had white sangria of course and I also had kale and quinoa salad for lunch, it was yummy but I would recommend the chef to add raisins for the balance.  My hubby had bean burger and he said it was yummy as well. My brother and sister in law had the grass fed beef burger and they said it was amazing.  We shared the home-made potato chips and devil eggs, oh boy it was great. We loved everything, but my #1 fav was home-made potato chips with some short of white deep and the green salsa deep was a dope!   Larissa our waitress was so sweet, she gave us chocolate chip cookies with French sea salt as dessert compliment, it was amazing! We also had vanilla and chocolate swirled gelato, it was so smooth like silk melting in your mouth.  Thank you for your service Ingo's tasty food, you have the most friendly staffs ever!
Great food! Great drinks! Great service!! Love this place!! This is an awesome place to go grab a burger, it is so delicious you have to try the  chips! Yum yum

Met a buddy here for lunch during the best time of year to enjoy what Ingo's has to offer -- good food on a great patio.    Awesome little lunch spot, also nice for an evening beer / cocktail or two while taking in the scenery.  I truly enjoyed the spacious patio which offered lots of shade and ample people watching, as it sits on the corner of a busy intersection in a trendy area with other restaurants across the streets.    Really good, friendly service, and the veggie black-bean burger was one of the best I've had in recent memory.  Hangry for lunch?  Show up right at 11am weekdays to get a parking spot in the tiny lot and beat the rush!

...This is my Favorite Place to eat... I go here all the time but today was so good I decided to help about it.... Let me start with the Burger.  Ingos Cheeseburger is somehow the best burger I've ever had every time I have it.  The bun freshly baked in the neighborhood and lightly brushed with mayo, the tomato and the pickles, both thick and juicy, a bed of shredded lettuce for the juicy patty of meat to lay upon while being blanketed by a respectable slice of melting cheddar cheese.  If you have ever seen the episode "Best Burger in New York" of "How I Met Your Mother" Please refer to Marshals Monologue and then go eat Ingos Cheeseburger. Thank me later.  Chicken and Waffles are my next favorite dish at Ingos but it is only available for weekend brunch.  The chicken is just so good but add to it the strawberry jam they use with the syrup and waffles mmmm mmmm. I wish it was Saturday Morning right now.  The Chicken Sammy is my next regular at Ingos. It's great for summer or lunch anytime.  You know how they say opposites attract? This Sammy proves it.  It's hot & cold, it's sweet & spicy, it's savory & refreshing. I still recall the first time I tried it. It took me by surprise playing with both my senses and emotions, I was so young.  It was before I even knew about chicken and waffles.  Sometimes when I'm feeling saucy I get the chicken Sammy Paris style, or the Paris burger. Both great options if your feeling the whole bacon & BBQ sauce thing.  The chips! Gotta try the chips! The latki (sp?) white creamy sauce on top is amazing but make sure to get some of the green jalapeño sauce to dip it in also the bbq sauce! And sometimes even the spicy sauce they use on the chicken Sammy is good with the chips.  Mix the bbq, jalapeño and latki if your really feeling saucy.   Today I even tried the little salad. I'm not much of a salad guy so it took me off guard when I saw goat cheese and sunflower seeds but I trusted in Ingos and my great server Dama (sp?) and it was delicious! (Shout out to Dama hooking it up with the suggestions, sauces, and being on top of our drinks! ) Again the salad, very refreshing, when you get a good bite the mix of ingredients really compliment each other from start to finish!  I will definitely be having that again  Can't forget about the complimentary mini sea salted chocolate chip cookies they give for takeout orders!  These are addictive so be careful, you can buy the giant versions of them across the street at LGO.    My one complaint goes to the lack of Gelato Sandwiches. In the beginning there were these little round bites of heaven. I still remember the salted caramel melting in my mouth.  Makes me sad. I know the gelato is right next door at LGO but it's all about the cookie dough like super soft cookies used to hold in the freshly made gelato. WHY? WHY DID THEY STOP?!?! Can't LGO at least make them? I'm sorry to raise my voice but c'mon, it was the final piece to this puzzle I call lunch.    Anyways the service is always great, quick and helpful. You can tell the chefs take pride in what they make and present to you, which makes it all the better. Thanks Ingos!!

Went for the first time today and was great. It is a bit small but the food is awesome! Cool interior and exterior building. I got the chicken sandwich and it was amazing. Think of Chick-Fil-A but times 10. It was temperature hot (I love my food hot) right off the grill and had fresh pickles,great bread and spicy sauce. I also got the chopped kale salad and that was awesome too. The beer they had I think it was North coast was really good summer beer. The prices are very reasonable too. The server was great and manager was very nice. I will definitely go there again soon!
Very pleasant patio dining. Fresh food, gress-fed, grass-finished beef burger and the chicken sammy was perfect. Who k we green apples and pickles would go together on a chicken sandwich?

My friend and I shared Igno's Cheeseburger and the Paris, Texas Burger as well as a side of Fresh Shattered Potato Chips. We made sure we ate the cheeseburger first and then the Texan second since we knew that the latter would be flavorful. Good thing! The Texan is flavorful but I don't think I could eat a whole one. Good experience, good food.

We are new to Phoenix and saw this place as we drove by and thought it looked super cute. We looked it up and say good reviews so went for an early Sunday dinner.  We saw inside was only counter seating, so although it was still pretty hot, we sat outside. We ordered iced teas which were tasty.  (I would have had more if I knew there were free refills!)  We ordered Shattered Potato Chips, a cheeseburger and Troubadour Egg Sandwich.   The potato chips came out first. They are potatoes sliced into circles and fried incredibly crisp. We just made big eyes at each other after the first bite. The sauces were good, buy I preferred them just as they were. The egg sandwich and the burger were both solid. No big eyes but very good and fresh tasting.  We asked for dessert and were told they only had complimentary cookies. OK! These were super tasty too and a nice touch.  We were discussing our experience while waiting for the check, saying we really liked the vibe and the food was good while being very reasonably priced. Just then the waitress came over and said the manager was comping our meal because it took longer than they like for it to come out. What? We did not think it took an unusually long time and we did not complain. We argued, but they would not have it. It's nice to see a business holding itself to superior standards even if customers are used to service that may not be the best. We left a nice tip and promised to come back soon.
This place is awesome. Great meetup group choice. I ordered the small cheeseburger. The ambiance is great.

Parking is a nightmare which made me give this a 4 star versus a 5 star. Food is great = 5 Stars. Service was awesome = 5 stars. Love the touch of the server using ipads and checking you out right there at the table.  My 3 year old spilled her lemonade and they brought napkins immediately and a new lemonade right away. Friendly staff.

Food: Solid. Any place that cooks a burger medium rare without me having to request it automatically gets bonus points. I got the Paris, Texas Burger. The beef was tender and well seasoned, the produce was fresh, the pancetta on it was crispy and delicious, the bun was decent appeared to be made in house. The Shattered Potato Chips were great. They came with lebni on the side which, isn't my cup of tea, but if you dig lebni I'm sure you will love it. The beer was fresh (very important for an IPA). The section left something to be desired, only 3 on tap and no bottles.  Atmosphere: Decent. Lots of outdoor seating. The building is interesting to look at. They have heaters for the chilly evenings, I have no idea what it will be like in the summer. I think the theme is kind of "convenience stand" and so all food and drink comes in/on disposable dishes/cups. Definitely interesting, but I definitely prefer my beer out of a glass.   Service: Excellent. Everyone was very friendly and made sure I had everything I needed. The one downside to this all is that you tip up front when you order your food before you sit down. I'd probably prefer the ability to tip afterwards.

This is right by my work and I've become a regual. I need to bring it to a 5 star being I had it 4 stars for service being a little off. But the last 4 times I've come there has been amazing service and same people still here. I just love this for lunch bite and a glass of wine to close out the day or for dinner with my man. Come here asap and give this place a try. Your review will be a 5!

Ingos was suggested to me after my love for LGO was voiced! I did not even notice it was next door because it's this tiny little place, but it is amazing! We ordered the fries, and as a foodie who doesn't actually care for French fries OMG I did not want to share my order with my boyfriend! I ordered the Paris burger (awesome that they let you do lettuce wrapped) and added an egg (extra awesome because it's my favorite topping on a burger)! The beef melted in my mouth, the BBQ sauce was the best I've ever had, and the bacon was crispy. It was an amazing experience will delicious food!

Go-to spot for lunch or happy hour. Absolutely the best Greyhound cocktail I've ever had. The mini burger sliders and kale salad are delicious and you can't go wrong with the homemade thick-cut potato chips.

An original location with creative flair. Ingo's offers the best of a burger joint with an uptown feel and creative cuisine. I am a sucker for establishments who show some focus on farm to table, but Ingo's not only supports this cause but provides fine fare as well.  I had a great burger, grass fed, a delectable bun with a BBQ sauce and pickle dressing. Ingo's take on deviled eggs, made with goat cheese and topped with pickled beets. Shattered potatoes, with a Mediterranean dipping sauce, and lastly some delectable cookies to wrap the meal.   Not only the food, but the service too was outstanding. This one makes a short list of recommended spots in Scottsdale AZ. Delicious.
Went back tonight, loved the Chicken Sammie and helped my wife finish her amazing fish sandwich!!  Much improved!!!

Interesting little upscale Arcadia joint. Dog friendly patio a plus of course. Beer also a plus. The burger was delicious, no complaints at the table and just nice chill vibe. Great place for a date or to sit with friends.

There's a few things on the menu (burger, chicken sandwich, fish sandwich, salads) and they do them very well.  The chips are a great side or app to share and the fish and chicken were very good.  I don't know which I'd go with next time but I'd definitely reorder.  If it's a nice day there's more outdoor seating than indoor.  This is the type of place that makes the area great.  You could rotate between here and the spots across the street and never get bored of it.

When my husband and I first started going here three years ago they had the best cheeseburger and steak salad around. They've since changed the menu up and no longer have the salad. The avocado toast has gone through some changes as well but is still quite tasty. I also recommended the chocolate chip cookies inside. Great atmosphere on a nice day but we hope they stop changing the menu and bring back the classics that first started us going.

Ingo's is a hip little patio restaurant that, like Chelsea's Kitchen, falls under the La Grande Orange umbrella. It offers a pretty straight-forward menu that isn't overly complicated. Bar seating inside and patio dining on the outside.   We've been here multiple times and always get the shattered potato chips as a starter. Although, as most reviewers will point out, they're not really chips, but slices of a potato. The lebni addition is a nice touch, although if there is sea salt incorporated, I certainly couldn't taste it. I feel they would have benefited from a little sprinkle of salt and ketchup on the side, which I'm pretty sure Ingo's sees as the equivalent of poison based on its limited availability. I will have my girlfriend smuggle some in her purse on her next visit and hope that we won't be banned for doing so.  The burgers here are on par with what you'd get at most of the gourmet burger places in Phoenix. We've ordered both the Ingo Cheeseburger and Paris, Texas Burger. I recommend opting for the LGO English Muffin instead of the traditional bun, which is what currently sets them apart (at least until Diablo Burger opens up). Any Ingo Cheeseburger can be further enhanced with the addition of a fried egg. They're good, but not quite in the same league as the LGO Burger served next door, which is a whole other experience.  They used to offer ice cream sandwiches for dessert here when they first opened. Those have since been eliminated. You can still get miniature versions of their sea salt cookie. Sometimes the server will give you one or sometimes you just have to go inside and take one. Being a true heel, I took two for myself. Just don't tell anyone.  Overall, I like Ingo's for a quick dinner. I feel it's worth the occasional visit, but it's kind of hard to choose eating here when it's placed right next to its superior big brother in LGO.

Since moving to Phoenix, this has been a go to place for me and my family. I highly recommend the Fresh Shattered Potato Chips - crispy - with the lebni and Ingo's hot sauces. Those two sauces really compliment each other - lebni helps tone down the spice without taking away the flavor. The Kale and Quinoa Salad - add chicken! - is so fresh and delicious! The Troubadour Egg Sandwich is spicy but so gosh darn delicious!! Add those two sauces for a great punch of flavor! The Paris Texas Burger is my absolute favorite. The apple barbecue sauce really adds great dimension to the burger. Finish with the soft serve gelato - the vanilla and pistachio swirl is yum!

Adding this restaurant to our regular places! Such a cute little place with a lot of unique personality. Not much seating inside so this wouldn't be my place of choice if it was too hot out.  My husband and I got burgers - I got their regular small burger and he got a larger bacon burger. Burgers were so moist and delicious, you can tell it's grass-fed beef. I really wished I could have done regular ole ketchup and mustard on my burger because I'm old fashioned, but I don't think they even supply ketchup and mustard here. The shattered fries were awesome, so fresh, you can tell and see that they make everything from scratch. Service was so fast! Got our food in less than 15 minutes.

We've come here twice now. Amazing service all around and great food. The avocado toast is delicious and so are the chips! Try the Almdudler too!  Wish I remembered our server's name though...curly hair, gigantic smile!

food: chicken sammy. i can taste everything but the chicken. the texture is right, the sauce is good, but no chicken flavor. it was just something crispy inbetween buns. ***3/5  service: the server was friendly. i liked the space. feels like a modern diner. lots of windows and lit the place. i liked sitting in front by the kitchen watching the cooks make the food. ***4/5  value: the sandwich is small. not good enough for the price. ***3/5

I love L.G.O. so this being part of their family of restaurants made me really want to like it.  Unfortunately I was a little disappointed with our first experience.    The decor and ambience was cool and modern.  We sat at the bar which allowed us to see the cooks prepare the food.  My friend and I ordered the shattered chips, Ingo Burger and Paris Texas Burger.    The chips came out right away.  This was fantastic.  I would come back just for this.    My friend and I decided to split the two burgers as they both sounded good.  We pretty much had the same impression of both.  This Ingo burger had too much sauerkraut that pretty much overpowered the flavor making the burger part cold and soggy.  The beef was good but barely noticeable.  The Paris Texas burger was partially better but again had an overpowering sweetness with it's apple bbq sauce.  No complaints on the beef or the quality of the ingredients - just the balance of the flavors were off.  Overall the balance of the burger was no where near what you'd expect from a place like this.  What made it worse was the burgers are extremely small.  I'm not a big guy but after eating the burger and chip I was literally still hungry.  We didn't want to order another mediocre $8.25 burger each so we literally left to go to another restaurant nearby.   I might give Ingo's another chance just for the chips and maybe the 1 hour availability egg salad sandwich.  As expected the service was excellent and the complementary sea salt cookies are a nice touch.

The weather didn't hurt today but lunch was amazing. My wife and I split a pitcher of sangria and we each had a sandwich. I had the regular cheeseburger and she had the fish sandwich. The potato chips are great and don't miss the deviled eggs. Bailey, our dog had a fine time as well.
Chicken Sammy is delicious and other food looked good.  Inside seating is limited, but more outside seating with misters. Great lunch or snack spot.
Burgers tasty but too small for the price.  Please rethink this ..Many other establishments offer more of a product, for a more reasonable price.

So this is a new spot and as such it does have some growing pains.  I really love this area a  great deal and I think this will be a solid addition once they iron out the kinks.  First: parking is a bi*#%.  It's ridiculous. Truly. There are maybe 10 spots. You *can* park down the street behind a dry cleaners in the overflow lot for La Grande Orange.    Ordering:  weird.  Those who wish to sit outside need to go up to the ordering counter and place your order there. Then they seat you.  Okay fine. But come warmer weather and that window is going to be a cluster you know what.    We came for happy hour (they don't have one).  NO HH ?  That needs fixing.  Once you are seated then you can be waited on without having to go to the counter again. HOwever it's another pay as you go situation. Weird.  I will say the food was delicious.  I got the kale/quinoa salad and it was right up there with True Food's kale salad. However, it was more like a side salad portion. I mean, it's not a burger, it is a salad so it's not as filling. I was still hungry when I finished.    Everyone else got burgers and said they were outstanding.    Everything is a la carte, so you have to order a side on your own. My friends got the fried pottatoes and they were delicious.   The menu is quite limited but what we had was delicious, albeit somewhat small portions.

I am in love with Ingo!! Definitely surprised I haven't written a review sooner, I have been here multiple times and have had a stellar experience every time.  The food is delicious, fresh, and generally healthy options. I love the avocado toast (taken off the menu...SAD...but I guess I'm not the only one sad about this because they have it back as a special!), the white fish sandwich, and the stands-above-the-rest must-order crispy chicken Sammy. The burgers rock, shattered potato chips... I could go on and on. AND they have a jar of salted chocolate chip cookies so satisfy your sweet tooth after the meal!  Super cute location, love both the patio and inside bar where you can watch them cook. Service is friendly, especially Britt G. Thank you Ingo! Keep on keepin on!

Few things. The food was amazing. Atmosphere was very nice as well. The only problem I had was the lady running expo. Which I believe she is a manager. A server came up to ask a question and she  ignored her. The server walked away and she rolled her eyes. So, I know she heard her saying her name. She would yell for runners in a rude way! The servers still had a great attitude! Kudos to them. To sit at the bar and observe this was disturbing. I have been a restaurant manager for several years. She for sure needs to read the book One minute manager by Ken Davenport! Would help her a lot. Other then observing a manager being rude to the staff. Everything was great!   "People who feel good about themselves, produce good results."

Complimentary salted chocolate chip cookies!!!!!  OMG!!!!  Tuna sandwich, kale salad, Mother Earth on toast and the shattered potatoes with lebni are mouthwatering awesome!  I have yet to try their egg salad...it is always sold out when I get there!!!!  Anyway, great food, friendly staff and great atmosphere!  Will go back over and over again!!!

It was my first time eating at Ingo's and I love this place! Great for take out or eating out on the patio! Our server Courtney was very nice.  She offered many great suggestions and I chose to try the Paris Texas Burger with the grass fed beef and the Shattered Potato Chips. I loved both! My daughter had the Vegetarian Black Bean Burger which was also very good.  Next I plan to try Toni's Deviled Eggs and the Crispy Chicken Sammy.  See you soon Ingo's

This place is absolutely wonderful. We ordered quite a few things to share amongst ourselves and everything was delicious! Service was quick and friendly and our server had great recommendations. They no longer have kambucha which was disappointing because they're praying monk drink was fantastic but the sangria was wonderful!

I base all of my reviews on service and this place doesn't disappoint. The service is very attentive, extremely friendly and fast.   Loved the Farmers Daughter burger. I can see how it won the best of Phoenix.   My only regret is it took me so long to try Ingo!

Great little quaint restaurant!!! And there is parking!!!  Additional lot around the corner. Super healthy and very friendly staff!! I will recommend this little round local burger shop to all my friends.

Absolutely love this neighborhood gem - I do not normally eat burgers but the burgers here are amazing and don't have that "funny"ground beef taste. The  only reason why I don't give ''tis place 5stars is the beer selection .  The Stone polder has too much bite,  you need something more drinkable and light.  Scottsdale Blond, or Orange Papago.

Some of the best customer service I've had at a restaurant! The girls working here were so sweet and very helpful describing the menu and suggested drinks for certain foods. Oh and the food is crazy good - order their homemade potato chips as an appetizer! I love that the entrees here are all fresh and healthy and actually reasonably priced. The parking situation is kind of crappy - there's about five total spots in their little lot but you can always park across the street and walk!

This was the worst experience I've had as a person eating with food allergies. At the beginning of the meal, I informed the waitress that I had Celiacs Disease, and asked if the items I selected were gluten free. She assured me thy were fine.   They brought out the chips, which I began eating. About 5 minutes after bringing out the chips, the waitress comes by and says, "You didn't eat any of those yet, did you? They're not gluten free."   The meal made me horribly ill, the manager never came by to apologize, and the waitress provided a very halfhearted, "Oh, sorry. You didn't eat a lot of them, though, right?" The lack of awareness of food allergies, I believe, makes this an unsafe place for people suffering from said allergies to eat.

CUTE, TINY SPOT in the Arcadia area. I had the black bean burger and potato chips with salsa. The burger was very good, kind of your usual vegetarian option. The potato chips were EXCELLENT and the salsa was super good. Happy hour drinks were also very good and the staff was very friendly.
Love this place. The food is always good, the drinks better and the service top notch.

Can't get enough of this place at the moment. Shattered potatoes, egg salad, hot sauce, burgers, drinks, AND the pride.  All the ingredients are so well thought out.   They say the place is named after the owners first music teacher.  I have to wonder if the instrument of choice was a drum considering the building looks like a drum. Ingo's is non GMO and local.  From the homemade almond mylk to grass feed beef, I am gaga for Ingo's. Eat local, support local, and this is the place to do it!

Seriously, this is my favorite place to eat right now. Everything I have ordered is absolute perfection. My current favorites are the Farmer's Daughter burger --topped with homemade sauerkraut -- yum. I also love the kale salad, one of the best in the city. They have the best cocktail too-The Greyhound, made with a french grapefruit liqueur. It's casual, friendly and you can almost always get a table immediately. The people at LGO Hospitality know how to create a great restauramt.

May 23, 2018  Tasty food indeed!  Great service, too!  (Ask for Martin!)  I definitely am returning to try other tasty-sounding items on the menu.  Ordered half-portions of two appetizers and the "seasonal 'rita" since I had a YEE (Yelp elite event) to attend after the meal.  Strange that I was charged full-priced for the drink after I was told that the cocktails were $2 off during HH...  Oh, well.    I like that I was able to order half-orders on almost everything on the menu, except the Crispy chicken sandwich.  And to be able to change my mind and do full orders mid-meal is even better!  I tried the special salad of the day, which was the Orange-Fennel salad, minus the orange (allergy), and the Shattered Chips-- deep-fried slices of potato chips dusted with cracked salt and garnished with lebni and homemade jalapeno sauce.  Both were fabulous!  The salad came with goat cheese and almonds.  I was not aware that it also came with avocado (allergy), so I had to fish the pieces out.    No dessert, as Ingo's Tasty Food is part of the LGO restaurant concept, and the idea is to have people experience deconstructed dining by eating food here and then crossing the street to have dessert at LGO.  There was a footed stand of complimentary salted chocolate chips, which I was told I could help myself to, which I did, but the cookies were too salty and too hard/dry.  I'd suggest to pass on these, unless you like over-salted and rock-hard cookies...  Hope to return soon!

Fun vibe! Loved the spuds, fish sandwich was above expectations.  Really cool plastic cups (if plastic can ever be cool).  The employees were all having a great time which truly makes for a better experience, while you apparently love your job, we loved our dining experience. Oh the free cookies were a nice ending touch which led us to cross the street for more sweet treats.  Nice Job overall, will come back for another casual date night with the spousal unit.

Ingo's is doing great again. We went a couple weeks back and had the chicken sandwich and it was completely different and not very good in our minds, but we love this place so wanted to give it another try...who knows, it could have just been the night we went. The dips we had on the bad night were not great and we did not get them again for that fear, but agreed the next time we go, we will give them a try.  So we had the chicken sandwich again and it was up to par and delicious. We had the chips and they gave us this awesome Jalapeno dip which was delish (and they shared how they make it which made us happy!).  We also tried out their new cocktails which were awesome (try the greyhound!).  We cant wait to go again and try some of the newer items and retry some that we didn't have a great time with before. Every time we go back, they just get better!

Hello? Healthy! I had lunch here with my friend Jeran after doing our morning hike, and rejuvenating mani/pedi treatment. I love the  outside seating and a fresh veggie appetizer. I am so coming back here for sure! The only issue I have is the lack of parking. Best time to come here is before the lunch and dinner rush.

I honestly think they have the best burgers in town.  Even better than their burgers though,  are the shattered chips with the white dip/sauce they are served with.  The potatoes are fried to crispy perfection.  The sauce is Greek yogurt with lemon zest.  Totally unexpected but amazingly delicious.  Don't leave without a sea salt chocolate chip cookie!

Gourmet concession stand.   We were excited to try this new LGO concept and both felt meh about it. I had the beet and lentil salad and my bf had the tuna burger. Both had really good flavor but the salad was very small; best as a side dish. The potato chips looked awesome but we didn't order them; after reading other reviews it seems we should have. The menu is limited and aside from burgers doesn't have a lot of interesting options. Bathrooms are gas station style- accessed from the outside and in order to use them you have to wait in line to get a key from the ordering window. I was also bummed that my diet coke came in a (not as cold as I would hope) can served with a flimsy plastic cup sans ice. We love LGO 's other restaurants and were hoping for more from this new spot.

Well, I liked the food here so much last Monday that I had to come back yesterday for some more! On my first visit I had fallen in love with the Kale salad and I just can't get enough of that. It's not quite enough to satisfy me as a meal, however, so both visits I got a sandwich too. First time I ordered the Paris, TX burger and it was fabulous; I would eat this every day of the week. BBQ bacon cheesburgers are my guilty pleasure but a lot of times they can get way too greasy and soggy. Ingo's version uses pancetta and grass fed beef which cuts down on the fat but amps up the flavor. This is probably one of the better burgers I have eaten but in the interest of trying new things yesterday I ordered the crispy chicken sandwich. I thought they were being fancy by calling it chicken schnitzel rather than fried chicken but it made sense after I received it because it was a nice thin, skinless breast piece of chicken coated with a crispy breading. I think they probably do deep fry it because I don't know how else you could get the crust so nice and crispy but the meat inside was still very moist. Again it was not too greasy at all. I don't like aioli so she brought me some of their Dijon mustard and I thought it went perfectly.  I know I will keep coming back just because the food is so delicious but I also love the fact that they use organic and humanely raised meat products. Their prices are reasonable for the level of quality of the ingredients. Those two items (salad and sandwich) made a pretty filling meal for only $14. Service was great and even though the place is very small it wasn't too loud or cramped feeling. Really the only thing keeping them from 5 stars is the lack of parking. I can see that is going to be a big problem as they get more popular.

I had the opportunity to dine here again. As per the manager's recommendation, we ordered:  1) Hummus & Pumpkin Seed dip (which was the best hummus I've had in AZ!): the veggies were fresh and I loved the selection of veggies they provided 2) Kokuho rose brown rice bowl (rice, feta, pistachio, shiitake, egg, and herbs): at first, it seemed just okay. Then we remembered our server had given us a jalapeno sauce to go with it. It was the key ingredient! It really brought all the flavors together. 3) Shredded kale and quinoa salad (sunflower seeds, grapes, preserved lemon, red peppers, parmesan, manchego): there was a little too much dressing, but it was a good salad overall  The service was fantastic. Everyone was friendly and I liked how they all helped each other. It was lovely to be able to dine outside on the dog friendly patio! By the way - the servers were attentive to the four-legged patrons as well.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place.   It's a cute little place that has no more than 24 seats on the inside but with a nice sized patio. You walk in and you are immediately hit with a wave of scent from the grill, which is surrounded by the seats in a u formation.   The menu is simple. Booze and good food. We ordered the chips which came with an overwhelming number of chips with a delicious house sauce for dipping.   I highly suggest ordering some burgers. They give you the option of getting a slider or full size (awesome!!!!) of any of their burgers. First time here? Definitely get some sliders. It doesn't come with side, but it does come with a carrot (What's up doc?).   As I mentioned, it is SMALL.  Be prepared to wait or possibly break into smaller groups if you're with a larger party.    Ok, now for the best part. FREE COOKIES. Yes, you read that correctly ladies and gentlemen. FREE COOKIES FOR EVERYONE. When I went, there was a plate of cookies to take as you left. Others who were there mentioned they used to get cookies on their plate. I don't know how you'll get your cookies, but you are going to love these cookies.    Did I mention free cookies?

Ingo's lived up to the hype. The chicken sammy is that good. Really! But how about the veggies and hummus? They were so good, with free refills on veggies (yea, mom, I like my veggies now). As you would expect from the ownership, the service is superb, too. We will be back!

This place is average. I felt the three stars is fitting because nothing will blow you away about the place. You'll sit outside and feel trendy while you eat an average burger (with no fries), drinking a beer (from a selection of 2), while you stare out at the beautiful view of 40th street. Wasn't terrible, but for what it is (burgers / bar food and drinks) I just think that there are better places to go. But I won't name any names, I'm not that savage.

I didn't think this place was anything special. I think they think they are too cool for school- but I was left wanting more and felt very unsatisfied with my food. It's really unfortunate because they are in such prime location.   Skip them and go to LGO or Postinos instead.
Daaiim is awesome! Great service! Ask for daaiim. His name is pronounced DAH-eeem! Foods awesome and I love it here.

Ohhhhh boi, they did it again! What a cute place. Small wrap around bar and awesome quite dog friendly outside.  Killer burgers and mostly the chips. Pretty good . I has the tuna and pretty good , also tried the burger! Stop by

Just tried this place and my boyfriend and I absolutely loved our experience here! The atmosphere is great. It's a small place, but super cute. Our server was lovely and provided friendly service. We both got the black bean burger and shared the house made potato chips. The chips were delicious with amazing dipping sauces. The black bean burger was the best I've ever had! Yes, it does fall apart quite a bit so be warned, but that really didn't bother us. Most bean burgers I have tried are very very dry and bland, but theirs was very flavorful and not dry at all. It left us both feeling full and satisfied. I love that they have options for both meat eaters and vegans. Usually places that offer vegan meals leave something to be desired, but they really nailed it with their burger.  Their fresh squeezed lemonade was delicious as well and tasted so fresh. Not too sweet. Just perfect.  Overall we left very satisfied! I love locally owned businesses and I'm happy to have discovered this restaurant.

Extremely limited menu. Server was very nice.  Came here with my in-laws and my 10m old baby. The deviled eggs are a little too heavy in the mustard department. The deviled eggs at Garage are infinitely better.  The potato chips were good. Burger is fair at best-- meat wasn't bad but the bun leaves a lot to be desired. I much prefer the burgers across the street at LGO, at the Attic or at Chicago burger company.   With so many other great options in the area- Ingos just fell ridiculously short. You couldn't pay me to give it another chance.
Love this place! Had the shattered chips, hummus board and cheeseburger--all deeeelish!! Great service and reasonable prices and it was a perfect night to sit on the patio.  Can't wait to go back!

Tried Ingo's the first time. Positive:  The burger was excellent, almost as good as a Fergburger in Queenstown New Zealand.  Very flavorful!  5 stars. Negative:  Service was very very bad.  We sat inside at the bar.  Almost all servers seemed bothered.  Zero eye contact.  No smiles.  After burgers were delivered, no one ever checked in on us.  We needed another napkin and couldn't get anyone's attention, so we got up and stole one from the cookie stand!  1 star.
Vegan Dalai Llama burrito is a WIN! Also a huge plus that the patio is pup friendly:)
Great place to grab a really good burger! Awesome building with some really cool atmosphere! Great service as well!

The food is super great and the staff is very helpful. It's just very expensive and when you order and burger is doesn't come with any sides but is still very expensive. Would definitely recommend going!!

Enjoyed a great burger experience this past Sunday.  Toasted bun, just enough BBQ sauce to make it interesting and the burger was cooked perfectly.  Fries are more like chips, but are awesome.  The finishing touch was the homemade next-level jalapeño sauce.
Amazing atmosphere and cool place. The chicken sandwich was delicious. This is an excellent neighborhood restaurant for simple and inexpensive meals. Their menu is small, but powerful.

Burger perfection. Slightly smaller portions but the ingredients and preparation are so perfect I got to go with five stars. Wait staff are friendly, attentive, and unpretentious. Be prepared for a mild inconvenience of difficult parking.

Stopped in today for a quick lunch, totally impressed! The menu is small BUT covers all the Foodie bases. I had the Kale Salad and will crave it from now on. Service was fabulous and we sat outdoors in September...oh yeah! Great spot, I will be back!!!

Just sat down at ingo's.   5 stars based on Chloe our waitress. Haven't tried the food yet.   Kidding.  Handcut chips definitely stand out from your standard side-- picture the first chef who tried dicing up a potato and fried it. You haven't tried it before and you'll like it. Texture was a 10, flavor lacked a bit for my taste (in all fairness I'm more of ranch and chipotle aioli on everything guy; their sauce is a more subtle sour cream flavor).   All three of us got the Paris burger-- picture a single from in-n-out for size, even your smallest of girlfriends will finish it. Don't get me wrong, appreciated flavor versus size.  I definitely advise getting the chips (and Stone IPA) to fill up.  On to alch. Although the simple menu is hip, I prefer a little more depth for the craft beer lineup.    Overall you'll enjoy their twist on a burger/diner joint. The 20 minute turnaround makes it a great call after work.   If I can't post my picture you'll have to take my word for it-- you're indulging in my first yelp contribution. Still a huge fan of Chloe.

Finally had a chance to eat at LGOs new place. It was not disappointing !!! I had the Paris Texas burger-meat was perfectly cooked and juicy, flavors were great!   Me friend had the brown rice bowl with poached egg, pistachios and other delicious things!! Really yummy!   We also both enjoyed the wine spritzer drink! It was delicious and light! Not too sweet, just right.   I will be returning soon :)

Pretty cool place with a very different design concept. Walk up window for beer ordering? Yes please! Lots of helpful staff members. Have not tried the food yet but I'm sure it's great.  The parking looks a little cramped but I didn't have any issues. You all should try it!

We were very excited to try this place since we consider ourselves burger experts. Unfortunately we did not think it was worth all the hype.   Pros: -super easy curbside pickup -very friendly staff -great looking menu  Cons: -Burgers lacked flavor -pricey  -potatoes were soggy and couldn't decide if they were chips or scalloped

I wasn't going to say anything, but after another person mentioned it, thought I would just throw it out there.  I'm sure many people received the same email inviting you to attend the opening this past Sunday.  Based on the email, we were expecting to be "treated" to their food.  Upon arrival, we found out it was a paying event.  I think this was a ploy by the owners to "bait and switch" loyal LGO customers.  After looking at the limited menu, we decided to go elsewhere.  I was fairly disappointed at the antics used to lure customers to their opening.

Yes, Ingo's is tasty.  Ingo's is also pricey.  Portions are small and beer is expensive - an eight ounce glass of Sculpin IPA will set you back $7.  I had the chicken sandwich "Adam and Eve" style, which is sans bread.  The sandwich was tasty but small.  Had chips on the side, - they do a great job with the chips.  Service was lackluster, and here is what kills a star for me.  They use the mobile devices to run your card right at the table, then the tip amounts are automatically calculated, so you cannot decide what amount to give apart from their pre-set tip amounts.  Doing this while the server is standing over you is uncomfortable - especially when the service was as bad as it was.  Despite that Ingo's is a short walk from home, I think I'll pass in the future.

Yes, very tasty food.  I have had salads and a burger from here and I'm quite impressed with the quality.  If you're looking for a nice, filling chicken Caesar, Ingo's will certainly deliver.  As for burgers, they make a fancier, buttered bun type of one, although it's not a terribly large plate of food.  Prices are on the higher side of moderate.  If you're in the neighborhood, this is a great "meet me here after work" kind of place.

I came here on the last day of my trip to Phx and was pleasntly suprised! Its such a quaint little place. I had the Paris/Texas burger and it was wonderful. It melted in your mouth with the freshly baked bun. I love how they show where they get all their ingredients locally on their menu. Service was fast and the waitresses engage you in conversation and dont act like youre some shmuck and ignore you. Wish they had a larger beer selection and that my Stone IPA was served in a glass pint instead of a plastic wine glass type of cup. I understand they are going for a "no dishes" theme but hate drinking good beer out of a plastic. Drank enough natty light and keystone out lf red cups in college and get flashbacks. Anyways, nice place and they have a pick up window too if you dont want to sit you can take your "craft burger" home! We also got a free salted carmel cookie on the way out the door! Place was a little gem. Check it out if you get a chance.

Still really good food but atrocious service tonight.  The waitress was certainly more interested in talking with her coworkers about how much another server made in tips than in waiting on the customers.  Another coworker ended up refilling our drinks after they had been dry for over 5 minutes and delivering our food.
Things have been back on point for a bit of time now. Good size breast, very juicy , and a light flaky breading !  We stop in several time a month as well as order curbside.
If you want to go to a place that is hip and fun and great burgers and chips you need to go. Everything is fresh made to order.

Best meal I've had in Phoenix, for real. It's not only non-gmo and grass-fed beef and all the other humane and healthy food sources (which is what prompted me to go here) but it's super tasty. Sauces are on point. Place is bangin and staff is sweet. Lovin it Yall.
I want the Paris, Texas burger every day for the rest of my life! I've still only had it once! Bring that puppy up to ck at the airport! I'll sell it like crazy!

Typically, I am wary of establishments that put the words: best, tasty or even yummy in their name. However, Ingo you are quite the exception!  Having breakfast at their sister store, La Grande Orange, across the street before it was an absolute must to visit Ingo's if you love their food. Instead of fresh juice, pizzas and crepes Ingo's provides grass-fed beef burgers, healthy apps and a good variety of wine and beer (some coming from CA) to cause some CA nostalgia.  Since I was dining with my roommate we decided to sit out on the patio and to share a meal with a couple of items so we could see what Ingo had to offer. We decided to start with the Hummus and Pumpkin Seed Guacamole served with crudites as our appetizer, the Paris, Texas burger to share and to drink the Black Market Hefeweizen and the Lyric By Etude Pinot Noir.  Hummus and Pumpkin Seed Guac- pretty large portion app for two people to share, good creamy hummus, with slight heat, thick consistency, the Pumpkin Seed Guac was not my fave, but it was all a personal preference. Comes with cauliflower, cucumbers, carrots, celery and golden beets.  Paris, Texas Burger- Really good burger, cooked well, juicy, love how the sharp cheddar cheese came through, crispy bacon, slight sweetness from the BBQ sauce and the pickles were awesome! They crisp the interior of the buns giving a good texturally crunch contrasting the soft, airiness of the outer bun.  Black Market Hefeweizen- Fruity, light, refreshing. I could drink this all night. Lyric By Etude Pinot Noir- Apparently acidic, tangy, berry flavor, spicy and tannic.  Great service through out the night, lovely atmosphere inside and out and awesome food! Definitely will be back to try their other burgers, the rest of the drink list and hell, I just realized they carry dessert here. Hold that last thought, I'm on my way back already!

Not understanding the hype here. Simplistic menu with not many options. My group ordered a variety and no one was impressed by the burgers. The chips were also just fried potato circles but many of my order were undercooked. The side sauce that comes with the chips is good though. The lemonade was the best thing anyone tried there, nice and sour and not packed with sugar. Even with that, I wouldn't return.

Dined here last night with my Hubby,  Baby sis, and my dog! Great outdoor patio area with string lights and laid back ambiance. We ordered the fries, Apple chicken burger, and the Ingos Cheeseburger and everything was absolutely tasty and delicious! To end the night we got the gelato sandwich and it was the perfect end to a great dinner! Our server was great and the GM introduced herself at the end to see how our meal was which was very nice. Overall a wonderful experience!

By far my favorite burger in the valley... hands down. However, lunch service is hit and miss. Seems like a lot of staff turnover from my experience, which is the only reason I'm not rating this 5 stars. Other than that, the apps and drinks, in addition to the burgers are amazing!

UPDATED: The manager/owner reached out to me in regards to making my dining experience better and I happily accepted the challenge of trying this place again. We finally got around to coming back and we're super pleased with the service... great friendly staff (once again) and super helpful on explaining the menu. We ordered the chips again... jeez! This recipe is amazing!! The sauces to dip in are equally as amazing. I then got the cheeseburger and my boyfriend got the Paris burger with egg. He was super excited about his. Mine was a simple cheeseburger (just how I like it) but very comparable to other burgers. I'll be back for a drink and the chips!! Thanks again for the management team, owner, and staff! Great customer service.   OLD REVIEW: Okay, I wanted to be a huge fan of this place... it's walking distance from my work and house, it uses grass fed beef, and I LOVE locally owned restaurants. We ordered the devil eggs, chips, Paris burger, and chicken sandwich. Devil eggs were great, got us on a good start. Chips were the best part of the meal! Amazing! I didn't try the burger but I heard it was "good". The chicken sandwich had no flavor and was lathered in grease... the apple was a nice touch but it needed more flavor to the sandwich to make it better.

Tasty in the name is accurate.  Tasty food.  Burger is juicy and cooked perfectly with excellent toppings.  Their homemade pickles are spot on.  Shattered fries are tasty - but the green dipping sauce is out of this world.  Other visits have had their crispy chicken sammy which is great.  Going to try the fish sandwich next.  Took leftovers home - would have loved if they would have offered some of the sauces to go since those were emptied before the fries...pricey for the sizes but tasty.

Ok, I'm a lover of Le Grande Orange and this concept restaurant for LGO meets, no exceeds, the exceptional food quality I've come to expect from LGO. INGO may be small on size but don't let that fool you. Their food has BIG flavors! So I started with the shattered potato chips. Crispy, crunchy, and served with a lemony tazaki like dip (whatever it was- it's super tasty!) no need for ketchup for these chips! Then to the grassfed beef burgers. When they say cooked and served with pink - that isn't a lie. BUT they are so juicy and delicious. I has the Paris TX burger- a delicious blend of BBQ sauce, pancetta, aged cheddar, and pickles. Ok, so I am usually not a fan of pickles on my burger... But these aren't your usual salty, vinegary, overly dill pickles. They make them fresh and they are the perfect blend of dill and sweetness with the crunch of a fresh cucumber and they compliment the burger amazingly. Overall 5 star food for a 3 star price!  Now I put the food first because let's be honest - that's why you review a restaurant!  But the atmosphere is worth mentioning. Indoor and outdoor seating with an open kitchen and bistro lights. Driven by on a Saturday and it seems like a great hangout. If you arent in the mood for an amazing LGO pizza but rather a juicy burger - cross the street and enjoy INGO!!!!

what a cool, unique little spot.  Small patio and diner with distinctive casual yet hip European feel.  Great daily happy hour (11-7), and a small but tasty menu. We tried the deviled eggs, which were delicious (but not sure why you only get 1.5 not 2 full halves), and the Farmer's daughter burger.  Great that you can get it lo carb on lettuce as well.  chips are great and a big portion as well. A definite if you're in the 40th/Campbell neighborhood.

Did lunch here with the pooch. Nice patio. Plenty of shade. Water bowl for your dog, too.  Burgers were very juicy and tasty. Happy hour drinks made going with a soft drink/ice tea not worth it. $3 beer/wine vs $2.75 for ice tea.  They'll do a $4 ala cart burger patty for your dog, too. That was a huge hit and gave me the chance to just taste the meat. It was very good.  Would go here again.
Ingo is my favorite hang out for a drink and a light meal. The patio is divine in all kinds of weather. I'm a regular!
Great neighborhood spot. Get the shattered potato chips to start. Bummed they took the Mr Midnight salad off the menu.

Holy schnitzel... Farmers burger, chicken schnitzel, shattered chips... All perfectly cooked.  Burger medium rare and chicken was tender and juicy.   Prices are high but the ingredients are QUALITY.  The only downside was the tiny glass of tea at $2.75 with no refills.  Excellent service too.  Happy hour from 11-7pm $4 beer and $4 red/white wine (house selection).  Can't wait to go back!

Mmmmm, Ingos. The place has such a cool atmosphere - has a nice neighborhood hangout feel.   The place is perfect for grabbing a bite after a workout or hike up Camelback. Yet, it's also good for a casual night out with your friends. Love the versatility of the place.

Awesome sandwiches... Great service... Vegetarian options are bomb! Kids love it. Shattered potatoes are where it's at..get that fermented jalapeño salsa!! Love this place..lovely patio...good music...one of my new favorite places....so far they are doing a great job. Just a few dishes I would improve but just about everything is enjoyable. You guys rock!

My girlfriend and I came here tonight.  The service was by far the best service I have ever received at any restaurant.  We had three different people come up to us as well as one of the cooks as well as what seemed to be the manager of the restaurant.  It was outstanding and the servers were all very nice.    However, I have to give a fair review and say the food was subpar.  I had a cheeseburger and my girlfriend had the tuna burger.  She loved hers, but I thought mine was overly greasy and it fell apart as I ate it.  Not one of the better cheeseburgers I have had.  We also got the potato chips which were good and my girlfriend loved the sauce that came with it.    I have to say I probably won't be coming back here due to the low quality of the food, but the service is exceptional and location is great as well.

Tasty may be an understatement. It was awesome. Had the tuna burger Adam & Eve style. Silly good. Service was fast and friendly, a smile and a thank you. Devil really is in the details. Speaking of which, the tuna was flavorful along with a half avocado and sauce (aioli?) was perfect accompaniment. The only thing I would ask for is the lettuce to be replaced with Romain or butter lettuce, but that's just my wish list. I cannot believe I passed by w/o stopping for so long. They make dieting and losing weight easy with dishes like that!

I frequent La Grande a ton and saw this place being built over the last 15 years. Hahahaha, sure as hell seemed like 15 years. I was shocked that it was a restaurant going in this tiny little round building. I finally tried it a week an half ago and I couldn't have been more rewarded for my wait. I keep having to update my fav burgers in Phoenix and I have to say it. Ingos is it!! The Stand and Delux have been knocked down the list.   Backing it up this way -  Bun - Ingo's (Light and perfect size) Meat - Ingo's (Seasoned right, juicy and medium rare) Sauce - Ingo's (Whatever the hell it is it's delicious!) Fries/Potato Chips - Ingo's (These PC are something else. Worth the trip alone) Service - Ingo's (Great personable service. Goes a long, long way)  La Grande Hospitality has done it again. Another great concept restaurant that was thought out, from the space to the menu. There are a lot of conceptual restaurant groups in town and they usually fall short. Good job LGO, when do you open The Luggage Room here?

If your in the Arcadia area and your looking for a no nonsense burger and beer stop, Ingos Tasty Food will not disappoint!   We started with shattered potatoes chips and a Paris, Texas Burger washed down with a refreshing Almdudler to really round off the salty savory flavors.  This sister restaurant to the LGO (La Grande Orange) market right across the street really lives up to name Tasty!  The chef was close enough to watch them make your meal, and a little Carmel ice cream sandwich made by the gelato place in LGO really made an exceptional conclusion to our new favorite spot!  Greatly looking forward to our next visit, quietest times on Saturday are before 700p if you enjoy a quieter experience    Recommended for quick meals at the bar with friends- 4.9 Stars

I love this place! The menu is simple but has everything a patio restaurant could need...and the food is amazing!!! The service is great and place is adorable. They really hit it out of the park with this concept.
I'm currently here in a business meeting and the service is phenomenal from our server Jenny and manager Erin. Thank you so much for the great food and wine...but most of all friendly service:)

I absolutely love this place! They have a vegetarian burger, and, it's actually vegan. House made patty w/ house made vegan nut cheese. I absolutely love it. I don't know if the original bun is vegan BUT you can get it "Adam and Eve" style, or, if you like the carbs, get it w/ the LGO English Muffin, which is vegan. I have had it both ways and love it both way. The staff reassured me that their veggie bun does not contain egg or dairy and that it truly is 100% vegan, and I have asked on numerous occasions. The seats are quick, the service is easy, and it's a great casual place to grab a good bite for anyone even those w/ dietary restrictions.

Incredible early birthday dinner last night with parents and girlfriend. When the weather in Arcadia makes you feel like you're living in Southern CA with that perfect breeze nothing is better. Love the food (always) and the greyhound on tap is delicious !!

Great fast but fresh food! More of a casual Lunch or early dinner spot as it's rather small inside and has a limited menu. But the limited menu doesn't mean everything isn't great! The fish sandwich is delicious and the potato chips and dip is good too! Get the spicy sauce!

I see there are already over 100 good reviews but I just have to put in my 2 cents. A friend of mine turned me onto a burger from Ingos the other day, it smelled so good when he got in the car that I just had to take a bite right away. When I opened the container, not only was the burger picture perfect but its made with grass fed beef & the taste was so delicious that I didn't want to put it away & wait until I got home to finish the rest. It was so juicy but not greasy at all. The potatoes that came with it are somewhere between a chip & a French fry, and also super tasty. This is definitely my new favorite burger joint, even though the parking lot is very small & kind of hard to park, its worth it even if I have to park down the street & walk there. I can't wait to try other items off the menu too.

Had the white fish sandwich, grilled not fried, and it was excellent!! My only recommendation is that they should throw in a few potato chips with a sandwich purchase instead of needing to purchase them separately.

My hiking partner strikes again, as during our 2nd descent down Piestewa today, she asked some guys around us for a hamburger restaurant rico.  "Ingo's" they shot back!  It's a round, quaint little place, slightly reminiscent of the old Woolworth lunch counter style dining.  If there's a free seat, take it, or stand on top of the printed footsteps located behind each position at the counter  We had a waitress in training, and both she and her trainer were pleasant and charming, full of recommendations and suggestions.  The Paris, Texas burger caught my fancy, and I requested it with the BBQ sauce on the side, topped with a fried egg.  It arrived with a darling heart tipped toothpick which held the condiments in place.  The burger was delicious and juicy, with a light and airy bun, crisp bacon, and this amazing fermented jalapeno sauce.  I actually tossed back a shooter of one.  And the "potato chips" were thin cut, french fried potato rings, crispy on the outside, creamy inside.  And when customers were all paid up, they hit the "cookie jar" before bouncing, as there were fresh made cookies, free for the taking.  I can imagine this place gets crazy busy, as the food is so good I tried to talk Yuko into splitting another burger with me... its worth the wait!

Love this place! Always prompt service! Great interaction with the staff! They serve quality product with consistency, not to mention the awesome ambiance provided by their unique patio experience! ...also, super stoked they started selling the green jalapeño sauce! Smart move! If you haven't tried it, it's definitely a must!! I'm forever a loyal "regular".

Veggie Black Bean Burger...  SO.FREAKING.GOOD!!!  I recently adopted a vegan diet and was craving a burger, this absolutely hit the spot.  My girlfriends and I ordered delivery (they also had the burger and loved it!) so I can't touch on wait times/service or anything like that, but I can attest to the fact that their food is fantastic! Looking forward to taking my boyfriend for happy hour so we can try the shattered potato chips and sip on some cold draft beer

AHH-MAZING sandwiches!! Another win for the LGO brand. The crispy chicken Sammy was voted as a top chicken sandwich in AZ...it did not disappoint. The fish sandwich was actually the winner of the day. The tartar sauce was out of this world. Service was great, great patio, and some of the best restaurant music I have had in town! This will defiantly be a go to in the Arcadia area food meca.

Second time here and again I ordered the watermelon salad and wasn't disappointed. Tried a burger for the first time and enjoyed it. The potatoe slices as always never let you down. Great tasting real lemonade to round it off and with great servers it was a pleasant way to sit out a dust storm.

The Food - Ordered tuna burger, and potato chips.   The tuna burger is different from what you would expect, but still tasty. The grain is mixed into the tuna, so it looks more like a thin turkey burger than a slice of seared tuna. The sauce is a bit more spicy than I was expecting and reminded me of Sriracha. Over all it tasted great!   The potato chips are essentially thick slices of potato with a chive-y sour cream like sauce on top. It was excellent!   The Atmosphere - parking is limited but we found a spot. The location is off of Campbell and 40th near LGO. The circular design is unique and beautiful. The inside is set up bar style with full view of the kitchen, cozy yet open. The outdoors is just as you would expect.   Service - we were greeted multiple times and invited to sit where we'd like. Everyone we interacted with was pleasant, and helpful. Our food did not take too long and neither did the check!   It's a great place to go for lunch or dinner for a quick meal, they have drinks as well.   Total bill for two people $30+ tip includes two non-alcoholic drinks, two burgers, and a side.

Jenny was our server and she was amazing! Great service all around. I'm a regular here who just comes for a good time and great food! The crispy chicken sandwich is the best in town and their post it note specials typically are incredible.  I tell all of my friends about this place!

Love this place! The patio is great vibes especially during the winter when the weather is nice. As for the food, I modified the veggie burger and got it on a English muffin to make it vegan. I also got an order of the chips that came with this spicy green sauce. The server suggested the vegan BBQ sauce as a dip too! Sangria was refreshing and great suggestion. I will absolutely come here again and recommend this cute spot to anyone! It's not super common in Phoenix to come across restaurants with options for all dietary needs so I appreciate you Ingo!
The perfect burger.  Cheeseburger,  with Strauss grass fed beef, medium well.  Perfect burger.

I have walked past this place probably a dozen or so times.  If I am down in this area, I am headed to Ingo's sister restaurant,  La Grande Orange,  for some pizza and baked goods.  I had always admired this beautiful, small, circular building, but I had never stopped in to try its food.  Recently, that changed!  I decided I would not cross the street to go to La Grande Orange, and instead, head here for a burger and some chips.  The pictures online and here on Yelp looked fantastic, and it was about damn time I tried everything out!    I drove down, parked in their overflow lot about a block down, and walked up to the joint.  A nice lady greeted me out on the patio and said that I could sit wherever I wanted.  I chose a nice little 2 top near a tree.  It was a beautiful 85 degree day out in Phoenix today, so I got some sunshine and shade all in one with the seat I chose.  I studied the menu for a bit and then placed my order.  I went with an order of Shattered Chips, a Paris Texas Burger (upgraded $1.00 to the grass fed beef) with no lettuce, and a glass of water to drink.  About 10 minutes later, my food was brought out to the table.  Here is how everything was............  Shattered Chips-  Um....FANTASTIC!  The word "fantastic" doesn't even really do them justice though. These "chips" are really thin sliced potatoes, deep fried to a golden brown, crunchy, yet still soft and chewy inside, piled high and then topped with some Lebni (pretty much a sour cream with a taste of lemon).  These chips also came with a little cup of green stuff that looked like salsa.  I took a bite of my first chip and was blown away at how great they were!  This was one of the best versions of ANY potato product I have ever had!  I dipped my chips in the Lebni and it was heavenly.  Next up, I dipped a chip in the green stuff.  WOW!   Taste explosion!  My waitress came around, and I asked what the green stuff was.  She told me that it was fermented/pickled jalapenos!  This stuff was awesome!  Tasted great, and packed just enough heat.  She told me that they were eventually going to bottle and sell that stuff.  I would buy it in a heartbeat!  It was a great compliment to the cold, smooth Lebni dip and the perfectly fried chips!  I would come back here again just for these chips...maybe order a take out container full of them.  They were flat out awesome! 5+ Stars!   Paris Texas Burger-  This burger came with a grass fed patty cooked perfectly medium, some cheddar cheese, some Nueskes bacon, pickles and some apple bbq sauce.  It usually comes with lettuce, but I left that off of there.  The only place lettuce belongs, is in a salad ;-).  This burger was presented very nice.  It was cut in half and held together by long toothpicks.  I took a bite and was pretty impressed.  The bbq sauce kind of overpowered everything, but it was still delicious and you could tell it was a high quality burger. The Nueskes bacon is awesome btw!  The grass fed beef itself was very tasty!   Maybe not the best burger I have ever had, but still a solid 4 star burger on its own.  I finished my meal, paid my check (just under $15.00)  and then walked inside.  Sitting there on the counter is a huge glass container full of mini sea salt chocolate chip cookies!  Yes, the same ones that they make and sell at La Grande Orange, only about 1/10th the size.  These cookies are like crack...I always have to get one whenever I go to La Grande Orange.  Perfectly crunchy, moist, gooey, salty and flat out delicious.  I grabbed about 5 of them, put them on a napkin and was on my way back to my car.  What a nice touch to end your meal!  Service was excellent!  All 3 of the ladies I interacted with were super friendly and helpful!  I will definitely be heading back here sooner than later.  Maybe a pizza from La Grande Orange across the street and an order of chips from here might hit the food jackpot, eh?  Wash it down with some mini sea salt cookies?  That, my friends, might be a perfect meal!  I will definitely be trying that combo out in the next month or so.  Can't wait!
This place is a great spot for an outdoor dinner. Well, when it's not 120 degrees out that is. It has a great atmosphere and great service. I loved the chicken sandwich and the sangria!

Ingo's runs with the major players in the heart of the most infamous burger-trap hood around. From the platinum shine to the grill, you'd never know that underneath all that flash, Ingo's ain't packin' heat.   Food-wise, I mean... The cold double stack of gritty, unmelted orange cheddar on 3/3 burgers (veggie, Paris Texas, & kids' meal status) was peeled off.
