The famous english muffin was dry (WHAT THIS IS, LGO COME ON) but not toasty or warm, and the regular bun was even more forgettable. It was reported as "way too mushy" by a high schooler who ordered meat & cheese on bread. This should not be a recipe for mushiness (nor should it be a recipe at all... but I digress.) What could've used a little less heat: any part of the patio lacking shade.    The remaining patio, however, is the beez kneez. We table-hopped to safety and enjoyed the beautiful weather to the sounds of rasta-hip-hop blaring from overhead, further enhancing our summer-in-February vibes with reasonably tasty mint chocolate chip ice cream sandwiches. The only element more impressive was the thumb-indented water cups... the ultimate drinking experience. Surrounded by puppies and gentle Arcadians, I thought, "patio game strong," though I can't say the same for the food experience.    A player must stay on their grind in these parts, and with so much competition less than a bun's throw away, Ingo's shade isn't enough to pull me away from the streets.

I've been hearing how yummy this place is for quite awhile and I finally got to try it on a beautiful afternoon. First and foremost, parking can be a challenge as it's very limited but there's complimentary valet right across the street.   I sat on the patio to enjoy the weather and was greeted very quickly. My friend Taylor ordered a Greyhound cocktail and it was really tasty, sour from the grapefruit and cool from the mint. A great cocktail for a warm afternoon.  Taylor and I then ordered the Fresh Shattered Potato Chips. Now you might be thinking crunchy, actual potato chips but don't let the name fool you. Ingo's puts their own spin on a "potato chip" and serves up potatoes cut somewhat thinly, so their's still actual potato inside the "chip". See my posted picture for a visual. The aioli they serve up with the potato chips complements the overall flavor. The combo is mouth watering! Salty, soft & crunchy, with a kick of lemon.   Next we ordered the Farmer's Daughter Burger and the Crispy Chicken Sammie. If you like dijon and sauerkraut, go for the burger! The burger was so juicy, they make a perfectly cooked burger. The Crispy Chicken Sammie was a light sandwich, even for being crispy chicken. It's not greasy whatsoever. The apple on the sandwich adds a nice refreshing touch. Then the spicy aioli balances it all out. It's Ingo's take on a buffalo chicken sandwich but it's ten times better!  When our check arrived, so did three little cookies that were complimentary. I wish I had a whole basket of those cookies because they were chewy and buttery, finished off with some sea salt.   Overall, pleasant experience with incredibly satisfying food!!

The Boy and I decided to try Ingo's for their 4th of July Special, $4 burgers.  I have warred with this place since it was built and took away the already scant parking for LGO and Postino's but I think it's time to wave the white flag and concede to Ingo's Tasty Food.  The place is small and quaint, inside is diner counter style eating with a nice shady patio outside.  The menu is, well, small, but we enjoyed what we had.  We started with the Post It Special of the day, Avocado Toast with Burrata, Heirloom Tomatoes, Grapes, Shallots, and Basil on Noble bread.  It was crazy delicious but the portion size was tiny for the $8 price tag.  Just once slice of bread with toppings.  Our burgers were very good, I had the Farmer's Daughter sans sauerkraut and The Boy had the Paris TX Burger.  The Shattered chips were just ok.  I like crispy, thin, potato chips and these were thick and soggy with some and thin and crispy with others.   What really won me over is the complimentary bite sized Sea Salt Chocolate Chip cookie they bring you at the end of your meal.  I mean I still went over to LGO and bought the large version to take home but it was a nice ending to a meal to satisfy a sweet tooth.
The seasonal frozen rita is amazing - tequilla, lime, pomegranate, winter spices- soo good. Still one of my favorite places for lunch/dinner - cant go wrong with any of their burgers or salads.

Great greyhound.... Terrible service.  We got one drink, waited 30 min and no one came back. The servers looked to be chaotic but so disappointing since LGO is my favorite. Too bad we didn't get to eat the food.... Or get anyone to come back.

A super delish Arcadia spot!  Love the food, attentive service and sense of community!  Support this local spot with the best music ever!  From grass fed burgers to shattered potato chips, it's simply ingolicious!  I could seriously drink the jalapeño green sauce!   Chef Richard is the bomb.com!
This place is a hidden gem. The food is great and the staff is very friendly. I recommend the kale salad.
The Paris, TX burger and shattered chips are absolutely amazing!  I've never eaten such a wonderful cloud of a burger in my life.  Highly recommended to everyone.

Ohhhh yes. After coming here for the Yelp event, I knew I would be back, but I wasn't sure that it would be consistently good (I would guess a restaurant would try to be top notch for an event). That being said, this was just as good as the first time on our second trip. We went on a beautiful Phoenix winter day (70's and partly cloudy...ahhh) and sat on their lovely patio. We got the chips (which they had run out of at the event) and they were pretty amazingly delicious. They are crispy, but not too crispy and the sauce pairs with them perfectly. Additionally, I got a side of their wonderful and amazing jalapeno sauce....so good on just about everything....especially the chips. YUM! We also each got a Paris Texas burger....very tasty stuff. I like that they make their prosciutto crispy....I have never had it that way, and it is wonderful. The food here is pretty substantial too, ate it for a late lunch and was too full to eat again all night. I would say that this place doesn't have my favorite burger in town, but it is in my top 3. I definitely will be back.

My son had a basketball game close so we went to yelp and picked this spot. It was great.  They make their own chips and the burgers were wonderful.  Their jalapeno hot sauce was the bomb!  And a free cookie as you leave!!  Great neighborhood spot.

The most amazing customer service ever. Went above and beyond to accommodate my requests, and recently updated their water filtration system. Best burgers in town. James Beard winning taste with fast food pricing. Great atmosphere for a date or just a nice lunch out.

So....this should be a 5 star review because the food was VERY tasty! I had the veggie burger which was so good! The veggie patty was fresh and made in house..and the vegan cheese was awesome as well. If you go here, definitely get their potatoes as they're delicious and served with fermented jalapeños.   Ok, so why the 3 stars? My friend ordered a drink and there was still lipstick on his glass. Gross! The food is good but I question the cleanliness of the restaurant after this incident. Such a shame.

Their service is pretty lame. They have a lot of young girls that should not be in the service industry. It took them over 30 minutes to get to drinks to us. And never came back. We have been there over three times and every single time there's service is slow.

Great atmosphere and good service. We went with the Yelp recommendations and tried the shattered chips, Paris/Texas burger and the fish club sammy. All were extremely delicious! The free cookies at the end were a nice touch.

Cute little place! Wish the seating was a little better on inside. With that being said..probably one of the best chicken sandwiches I've had in a long time. The chicken was crispy yet super moist. The apple really gives it a nice crunch and freshness. I got mine without pickles but they are usually served with the sandwich. The potato chips/ fries came out hot and crispy. I would opt to have the dip on the side. I will be back!

Great little spot off Campbell and 40th street.  Excellent little diner style restaurants with an interesting menu with a daily happy hour Monday through Friday 11 to 7. Good craft beers on tap. Wroth checking out. Will be back for sure.

We have already been big fans of the burgers over at LGO, so it was no surprise to be impressed at Ingo with the same deliciousness. The set up is a little unusual with the order window towards the back of the venue, but I like the seating layout a lot. It's fun to sit outside and soak up some sun or lounge in the shade with a brew and some taters.  The food itself was fabulous. The crushed potatoes with labne were extremely tasty - even more so than I had imagined with the wonderfully distinct dip. I thought it was going to taste like any other sour cream or ranch dip, but it was something beautiful in its own right. I enjoyed the tuna burger - the burger itself was pretty good with plenty of avocado a soft spice. I added extra with their homemade fermented jalapeno sauce (totally awesome!). The buns were remarkable with just enough softness to not be mush when you bite. My companion tried the Ingo burger and reported the bun to be a slightly mushy with the saurkraut and mustard sauce dripping on it.  The service was friendly and timely. But the only reason I'm docking a star  is because they've removed the veggie burger. LGO's veggie burger has been my FAVORITE in the valley. I tried ordering it at LGO itself about a week prior to visiting Ingo and was told they no longer have it at the pizzeria, because it's on the Ingo menu. When I ask for it at Ingo, they've taken it off the menu... Do I want a rice bowl? F*&% no I don't want a rice bowl at a burger joint. Please bring my veggie back.

Ingo's is legit.  I'll even say I like it better than the more famous LGO across the street.  Great prices on drinks (try the greyhound!), killer chips and dip (couldn't stop devouring the greek yogurt sauce... and the jalapeno sauce... and the BBQ sauce that our waitress brought us to sample), and probably the best Paris Texas Hamburger and Chicken Sammy that I've ever had.  The atmosphere is great, especially when it's winter and it gets dark a bit early.  We had a great time sitting out on the patio drinking and enjoying the gorgeous weather and delicious food via candlelight.  Portions are a little small but are priced accordingly, so you actually walk out with a little lighter body and a little heavier wallet than you would normally have after a nice dinner out.  100% will be back.

My wife and I go at least twice a month.  Can't say enough about the food for the price.     Have sampled most of the menu and everything is well composed and executed (flavor, texture, seasoning, etc.).  I think my only complaint is I like my cheese a little more melted on my burger...  There is no salamander so I get the constraint.  Maybe throw it on the flat top for a few seconds before putting on burger?  Fish and chicken sandwiches are amazing... Take a break from burgers and order one.. you won't be disappointed.

I just found my sweet spot on the menu!  Crispy Chicken Sammy!!!  My second visit here, and again, I sat inside at the not too busy hour of 2:15.  Service, just as before, was rapid and friendly.  I had done my research, and already had a plan, so I didn't need to figure out the menu options this time.  I also already grasped the concept, and that the prices related to quality, organic, local ingredients.  I even knew what the numbers on the floor were for, although I didn't need to use them. (They are so if you are waiting for a seat, you know the order in which you get to be seated.  Pretty clever.)  I am now hooked on their Crispy Chicken Sammy.  They marinate their chicken breast in buttermilk, and pound it to make it super tender.  Then, it is lightly battered, deep fried, and served up juicy, crispy and tender on a bun with pickles, slices of granny smith apple (it works) and spicy aioli.  This is a sandwich that I intend to have frequently.  It is madly perfect.  Also to die for are the deviled eggs.  I wasn't sure how I would like the beets, but there are just a few pieces diced on top of each egg, and they work perfectly.  The eggs themselves were light, perfectly seasoned and piled high with deliciousness.  My shattered potato chips were perfect, and having the lebni on the side was the right way to go for me.  This trip, I added a Sangria to my meal, and it was just the right touch.  I also ordered a nice little house salad with goat cheese and sunflower seeds that I hadn't noticed on my last visit, and it struck me as a generous portion for the price.  Although I'm curious about other items on the menu, I think that I know what I will be eating here for awhile...Crispy Chicken Sammy, Deviled Eggs and Sangria.  I may eventually get around to trying something else, but I can't imagine a better meal.

If you like delicious food and great service, this is the place for you. Their menu is simple yet perfect. Their burgers are juicy and full of flavor. My all time favorite is the Paris Texas Burger and the Black Bean Burger. Highly recommend the potatoes. The green dipping sauce is to die for!  The service is also what keeps bringing us back. Everyone is so attentive and great with suggestions. My drink was never empty and they were so fast to help out any time I even looked up.
Best patio?!? lgNo!! Over priced, small portions (which match the tiny space review...)No pkg...nothing tasty bout that...ps nice clock lol

My love letter to Ingo's:  INGO'S! I love you. Your food is so amazing and delicious. Burgers are cooked to a perfect medium and seasoned so well. Egg salad is OUT OF THIS WORLD. Perfect for brunch. Kale and quinoa salad is so light and refreshing. Sangria is lovely, especially in the beast that is Phoenix weather. Deviled eggs, shattered potato chips, and hummus and pumpkin seed dip - best way to start a meal. Ice cream sandwich cookies and complimentary sea salt chocolate chip cookies - even better way to end a meal. Super fun seating with nice shade. FAST AND EFFICIENT SERVICE! Good prices. Good food. Fin.
Everything is delicious!  The service was great and quick.  It's a little small and maybe not the best for larger groups but definitely nice for a daytime date.

Happily breezed through a critical interview that morning, so my husband took me here to day drink and grub. Ingo's is a super cute corner cafe, with nice patio seating that I wish I could've enjoyed today, had I brought another sweater with me. Playlist is mellow and feel-good, and service was pleasant.  It was Happy Hour, so my 2 cocktails were only $6 each. The Ingo's Greyhound is a pretty pink drink with a great grapefruit flavor. Their moscow mule tasted quite unique because of the rather strong muddled ginger. It sort of worked for me, but I don't imagine it would for the usual mule drinker. Hubby had the Ska Brewery Modus Hoperandi IPA for $5.  Our food was BANGIN'! Hubby had the Paris Texas Cheeseburger and I had the Crispy Chicken Sammy ($8.50 whaaaattt). Don't let the sandwich sizes fool you! Both were so juicy and flavorful, you'll be comfortably satisfied at the end of the meal. Oh, and those thick-cut potato chips with ranch and salsa verde dips are awesome to share and start with.

Ingo's - I really like your food, your service, your beer, your everything... but I HATE your flies!! There has to be something that can be done to keep the little pests out of my plate of food. It was nightmarish. I had the veggie burger and loved it, especially on one of the LGO English muffins. Very nice selection. Fries, and sides are all good, and the beer choices were excellent. Great vibe - get rid of the flies!!

Love love love LGO and Ingo's! Food is A++ service is too! Not a ton if indoor seating so in the summer it's better to go at night. Burgers are OHMYGOSH WOW!! I highly recommend...well...everything!!!

Went there on a late Sunday afternoon, there was four other people in the restaurant . The restaurant is small and maybe holds up to 20 inside in a semi circle bar/table. I do a take out order and sit down to wait and then a large group of 7 comes in to sit so I give up my seat so they could sit together and the waitress thanks me and tells me to sit and as I sit this idiot in the group that sat in the seat I gave up asked me to move so he could sit next to his friend which there was a seat between his friend and I. Wanted to put my fist in his food since I gave up my seat previously and he was so ungrateful.   This led to my displeasure for my experience here.  I ordered the Ingo Burger with a fried egg which I specifically asked to not have sunny side up. As I opened my food later the first thing I see is a burger with a sunny side up egg. Also ordered the fresh shattered potato chips they were pretty good but the dipping sauce seemed a little off . Overall the food was average at best the service was average and the idiot in the restaurant was like a grade school punk . With all the quality restaurants in that area that will be the last time I will eat here

We are LGO frequenters and we watched as they built this place just across the street for a few months so I'm not sure why it has taken us this long to try it!  This past Sunday we met another couple for a late lunch around 2pm. Luckily there was plenty of parking spaces because as other regulars know, parking in this area during peak times can be a bit stressful.   The inside is cute but pretty small with seats at the bar and only a few tables. Since it was beautiful outside, we decided to sit out on the patio and they definitely had more seating outside, though the gravel was a bit of an odd chose for patio flooring. When sitting outside, you order at the window on the north side of building and then take your number to your table where they deliver it.  I ordered the Ingo burger without the bun, with the yuzu berry iced tea. My fiance got the Paris Texas burger and the other couple both got the cheeseburger. We also shared an order of the shattered potato chips. The tea came in a bottle and was really good, it did taste more like a green tea though and I doubt there are free refills but I didn't ask. I probably would have ordered a Diet Coke in a can when I saw someone else with one but didn't see it on their menu, only a Coke with cane sugar so it would have been nice to have it listed.   The cheeseburgers were delivered all at the same time and they were all really good. My fiance literally moaned every bite he took of his Texas burger. He said it was the best burger he's ever had. I had to try it after a comment like that and while good, I've had a few better so maybe he was just really hungry. Don't get me wrong, it was good, but not the best ever in my opinion. The chips were really good and fresh and the accompanying dip was good too, different.   One other note, several people brought their dogs. I am a HUGE dog lover and would typically be a fan of being able to bring your dogs to a patio but the seats are pretty close to each other and the couple next to us had a long leash and I definitely felt like the dog was part of our lunch. Not something I'm into at a restaurant. They did try and watch him but it's still interrupting when the dog barked at other dogs or  when others petted the dog, you could see the hair flying in the breeze...enough to make me worry about getting it on my food and that's pretty gross.   All in all, I would come back here on a nice day and enjoy the patio and hope only shed free dogs were around.

This review is really 3.5 stars.  With some improvements, Ingo's can be a solid 4 or even a 4.5.  As some of the other reviewers have mentioned, the parking is abysmal and the inside is small... and depending on time of day on the patio, you may be blinded by the setting sun.  I don't hold these things against Ingo's, just the LGO architects.  I've been here a few times, and am always pleased with the quality of the food.  There are two areas that could use improvement: Service, and beer.  The service is generally good, but sometimes is slow and they don't always get any custom requests done correctly (like not cutting the burger in half).  For Beer:  I would a) like to see a larger beer selection and more importantly b) stop serving the beer in a crappy plastic pilsner glass.  You might as well serve it to me in a sippy cup.  If you are afraid of people breaking glass, I don't know what to tell you?  But the small-ish size and the fact it is a lightweight plastic just seems odd.

Yesterday was "Burger Monday" in my world, and we heard good things about Ingo's so we finally got around to trying it out for lunch.  I was expecting a burger place, but it was not nearly as focused on burgers as I thought it would be from hearing about it.  I think there were a few options in that department    The building's atmosphere is super cool and unique, which felt right in place across from Postino and LGO at 40th and Campbell.  We (5 dudes) sat at the counter inside in a linear fashion and it was a bit cramped, but not so bad that it ruined the experience - we moved on from the topic in a mere 10 seconds.    I ordered the gourmet burger with Pancetta, medium-rare, along with a side of their "chips".  To me, fries are just as important as the burger, but "chips" were the option.  They need to come up with another name for this offering, because the words "chips" sells them very short!  They're more fry than chip, but I'm glad I ordered anyway.  The only suggestion I would make is a smaller portion option, so one can get out with a little cheaper lunch tab, and not gorge themselves on spuds!  The burger arrived and it was amazing - nothing really else to discuss on the topic.  Enough said - Ingo's is a winner!

I really wanted to like this place. It's a cute little spot, with some healthy food options and a small menu. I was pretty disappointed for several reasons.  First and most importantly, the food just wasn't as good as I had expected. We ordered a fish sandwich and a burger and split them. We also tried the chips and lebni appetizer. The hot sauce/ salsa served with the chips was awesome, way better than the lebni. I didn't enjoy the lebni at all, it was so lemony, but maybe that's what lebni is supposed to taste like? I'm not sure. The burger wasn't good at all. While it was juicy, it didn't taste seasoned. It tastes like plain hamburger meat which wasn't appetizing to me at all. The bun was delicious, which was a nice surprise. It was soft and fluffy with poppy seeds on top. The fish sandwich had a large batter coating with little fish. The fish that was there was pretty strong. It didn't taste fresh. On top of it all there were flies buzzing around inside landing on us and our food which was super annoying. The manager saw us batting at the flies and didn't try to take care of them. The service wasn't great either, we had to ask for everything: napkins, refills, check, etc. however they were friendly, just not attentive.
